loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 55-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Ahmad has been selling fruits and vegetables since 1996. Ahmad is a mobile seller. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a small van for his work. The van will facilitate his work and his moves. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad is special in his work because he goes into regions where no mobile salesman goes. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. When Ahmad first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash. He decided on doing this business because he needed to improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and maybe opening a shop.

loans.use: To purchase a small van for his work.

loans.name: Umedajon

texts.ru: Умедажон 1983 года рождения, она замужем имеет 2 детей. Она торгует в магазине 5 лет. Торгует она продуктом питания. В основном она продает консервы: соленые огурцы, зеленый горошек, майонезы и кофе разных сортов. Перед новым годом был хороший сбыт товара, потому что все готовились к новому году и к зимовке. Сейчас кроме тех товаров она будет продавать напитки, для этого она и получает кредит. В ее бизнесе помогают дети. Товар привозят поставщики и если есть лишние деньги заказывает своим соседям по магазину. Она благодарна КИВА за поддержку, благодаря которым  расширяет свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Umedajon was born in 1983, she is married and has two children. She has own store where she sells food products for five years. She mostly sells canned foods such as pickles, sweet peas, mayonnaise and different varieties coffee. Before the new year the sales were good and she sold a lot of inventory because everyone was preparing for the new year and the winter ahead. Right now besides those items she will also start selling soft drinks and she needs a loan for this. Her children are also helping with the business. The products are brought in by the suppliers and if she has extra money she also orders for the store neighbors. Umedajon is grateful to Kiva for the support thanks to which she is expanding her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Assétou S. est une veuve qui est mère de 5 enfants (2garçons et 3 filles). Elle est née vers 1980 à Awanou en République de la Côte d’Ivoire, un pays frontalier du Mali.  Elle vit dans la maison de son défunt mari avec ses enfants à Kadiolo quartier Koko.
Elle fait  le commerce  depuis 6 ans  avec la vente de pagnes real.  Elle vend également de temps à autres les petits articles de son jeune frère qui est commerçant..
 Elle est à son troisième prêt individuel avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Les prêts passés  se sont  bien dénoués
Elle compte acheter, une vingtaine de pièces de pagnes real. Elle  s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Elle vend au comptant et à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes et très  souvent aux associations féminines.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les dépenses familiales et l’autre partie sera investie dans son commerce
texts.en:
Assétou S. is a widow with 5 children (2 sons and 3 daughters). She was born around 1980 in Awanou in Côte d’Ivoire, a country which borders Mali. She lives in the house of her late husband with her children in Kadiolo district Koko.

She has been in business for 6 years selling "Real" brand "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth). From time to time, she also sells small items for her younger brother who is a merchant. She is on her third individual loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Both the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

She intends to buy 20 or so lengths of "Real" pagne. She does her buying in the big marketplace of the town of Sikasso. She sells for cash or credit (wholesale and retail) to a clientele composed of women and men, and very often to women's groups.

She expects to make a monthly average profit of 60,000 F CFA of which part will be used for family expenses and the rest invested back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "Real" brand "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Effuah

texts.en:
Effuah K. is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one son and one daughter. According to her, one is in the senior high school and the other in junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Effuah works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She sells rice and stew. She prepares the stew in her house and sells by the roadside. Effuah procures bags of rice and other ingredients from the local market. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice in bulk. Effuah is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena started her fish sales ten years ago at Dorma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Abena prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She has a cunning spirit to convince her suppliers to sell her more fish when there is high demand for fish and supply is low. She buys stocks of fish from the cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them at a nearby stand. She has a high customer base, lots of customers that buy from her stand. They buy from her both fresh fish and smoked fish.

Abena is now 40 years old, married, and a mother with a child who is currently working. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of goods; like this, she believes she can buy more fish to prevent her from frequent traveling to Kumasi. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Asomdwe’ which means Peace.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Diana Jamileth

texts.es: La señora Diana Jamileth, resise en el barrio Villa Flor en la capital de Managua, tiene 31 años de edad, con tres hijos de 4,12 y 14 años de edad, los cuales estudian, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos que desde hace dos años inicio con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, el trabaja de bodeguero en una librería, pero su salario es bajo. Con estas ventas ha logrado estabilidad económica para su familia. y el préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar mas mercadería de cosmético como: perfumenes, pinturas, cremas entre otros encargos que le hacen con esto espera captar clientes nuevos y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios, hacer mejoras en la vivienda. Da las gracias ala institución por hacer posible el incremento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana Jamileth lives in the Villa Flor neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She is 31 years old and has three children ages 4, 12 and 14, who are in school. Her business is cosmetics sales, which she started five years ago with the aim of helping her husband with the household expenses. He works as a shopkeeper in a bookstore, but his salary is low. With these sales, she has managed to obtain financial stability for her family. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of more beauty supplies such as: perfumes, makeup, and creams, as well as other products that customers request from her. With these supplies, she hopes to attract new customers and increase her earnings. Her plans include helping her children obtain their educations and making improvements to her home. She gives thanks to the institution for making it possible for her to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies such as: creams, makeup and perfumes.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 27 years old, married, and has two children aged 3 years and 3 months. He is living in the same house as his father, mother and four of his brothers.

Mohammad’s business is the only source of income for the family since his mother is suffering problems with her heart while the cost for such things is very expensive. He started his business four years ago and his mother’s sickness was the main drive for him to work harder, especially since he lives in Qalqilia, which is surrounded by the wall (Israel established this wall for security reasons and a huge amount land was confiscated for it. Qalqilia was much affected since it is a border town and very famous for its agriculture).

This is Mohammad’s first loan with FATEN. He has asked for $1,500 to buy clothes for the summer season. Mohammad’s shop sells clothes for children, not expensive clothes, to suit the economic status of the poor people. 
 
Mohammad appears in the photo at his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new stuff for the summer season

loans.name: Fabiana Flavia

texts.es: La señora Fabiana se encuentra en su quinta secuencia durate todo el tiempo que a trabajado junto a la institucion siempre a demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y con ganas de superacion.  La actividad economica que realiza es la venta de articulos varios lo cual realiza en una pequeña tienda de barrio ubicado en la misma calle de su domicilio.  Ella vive conjuntamente con su señora madre a la que colabora con los gastos familiares, tambien vive su hermano.  La sañora Faviana invertira el prestamo en la compra de insumos para su negocio.
texts.en:
This is doña Fabiana's fifth loan and during the time she has worked with the institution she has proven to be a hard-working person wanting to improve. She sells different articles for a living at a small local store in the same street where she lives. She lives with her mother whom she supports with the family expenses. Her brother lives there too. Mrs. Fabiana will spend the loan in the purchase of supplies for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in supplies for a business.

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai U. (0) is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of Fusi Saoluafata. She is married and has seven adult children.

Salafai owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 700 WST a month.

In 2004, Salafai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.

Salafai is now requesting a new loan of 3,000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 5th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50-years old and married to Apolonio who is 51-years old and a farmer. She has always prayed for the health of herself and every member of her family. As a parent, she has felt it important to fulfill her responsibilities to her children. Through their diligence in managing their resources, Lourdes and Apolonio have been able to provide a complete education for their children who were willing to pursue their college studies. At the moment, they are still sending two of their children to school.

Lourdes is engaged in the livestock business. She has been taking good care of ten goats which has been a big help in responding to their financial needs especially in times of emergencies. Grown up goats are being sold at least once a week. For each goat, she gets PHP 2,500 and this is quite helpful for the family’s needs. Lourdes is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more baby goats to raise. She is planning to use some of the loan to sustain their farm.

loans.use: To purchase baby goats

loans.name: Comunidad Unido 7 Group

texts.en:
Reyna is the group coordintor of Comunidad Unido (United Community) which is based in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she lives alone in a small house maD. of scrap metal which she owns, though she does not have title to her home.

She came to Esperanza because she wants to improve her life and believes that access to credit would help improve her business. She sells jewelry and shoes from her home, and having completed her first loan term successfully, she is now requesting a loan to purchase five rings, five chains and women's shoes to sell. With the profits from this business she plans to pay for her daily living expenses, including food and medicine.

This is very important to her as her business is her only source of income. She is confident that in the future her situation will continue to improve, and she plans to expand her business into a salon which will generate a solid reliable income so that she can remain independent. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase silver chains, rings, and shoes

loans.name: Felicisimo

texts.en:
Felicisimo T.'s main source of income comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in his community. He is 58 years old, widowed and has four adult children. He is from the village of Biasong. Felicisimo has been in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Felicisimo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Felicisimo is requesting a loan of 6000 pesos which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This will be Felicisimo's first loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth S. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Bernadeth runs a business making and selling food. Her main source of income is from making and selling peanut butter in her local community. Bernadeth has been running her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bernadeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. She used this previous loan to purchase raw ingredients. Bernadeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Bernadeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos que en estos momentos cuenta con 53 años de edad vive en su propia casa, ubicada en la zona sureste de la localidad, Carlos vive junto a su hijo de 22 años. Carlos se dedica desde hace varios años atrás a la carpintería, realiza todo tipo de trabajo al respecto. Su taller lo tiene en la misma casa donde vive. La verdad que la competencia es mediana, esto por el hecho de que existen otros carpinteros, pero por su experiencia, ubicación, calidad y puntualidad en su trabajo tiene muchos clientes. Carlos también cuenta con una moto la cuál renta diariamente por lo que recibe un ingreso seguro. Carlos con el crédito compró una computadora marca lG en $us. 720.- el resto del dinero lo invirtió en la compra de brocas y madera. Este es el tercer préstamo de Carlos y todos los anteriores los ha cancelado puntualmente. No tiene crédito en ninguna otra financiera.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is currently 53 years old, lives in his own house, located in the south-east zone of his community. Carlos lives with his 22-year-old son. For many years, Carlos has made his living from the trade of carpentry, and he performs all kinds of related jobs. His workshop is located in the house where he lives. Truthfully, he has substantial competition because there are other carpenters, but because of his experience, location, quality, and punctuality with his work, he has a lot of clients. Carlos also owns a motorcycle, which he rents daily, in order to receive regular revenue. Carlos used his loan to buy a 1G brand computer for $720 and used the rest of the money for the purchase of drill bits and wood. This is Carlo's third loan, and he paid off all his previously loans punctually. He has not received a loan from any other financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Yessika Carolina

texts.es:
la sra. Jessika Carolina Q. tiene 28 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene un hijo de un año, su compañero de hogar trabaja de albañil y ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, las cuales las vende en diferentes caserios y colonias de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. ahora necesita el credito para comprar leñe, maiz, cal ya que la demanda es mayor y no produce lo suficiente.
su sueño es poder hacer una casa propia y darle un techo digno a su hijo, ahora viven en la casa de los padres de su marido.
texts.en:
Jessika Carolina Q., 28, is in a common-law relationship and has a one-year-old son. Her life partner works as a bricklayer and she makes and sells tortillas in various farms and neighborhoods in the city of San Lorenzo. She has been working at this task for the past three years and needs financing to buy firewood, corn and lime powder since demand is high but her production is not sufficient to meet it. Her dream is to build her own house to provide her son with a proper home. They currently share her inlaws' home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, water, firewood, matches, lime powder.

loans.name: Gulbuta

texts.en: Gulbuta has sold fabrics for women's national dresses at the market for many years. Her fabrics are some of the best at the market. By now she has many clients. She knows her business very well. She is married and the mother of 5 children. Her husband works as a cook. Gulbuta wants to borrow money to purchase more goods for selling and thus have more profit. With that profit, she can provide better living conditions for her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more fabrics and expanding her business

loans.name: Jay Ven

texts.en:
Jay Ven G. is from the city of Aguada, Ozamiz City. He is 25 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Jay Ven owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling pet animals in the local community. He also operates a business providing motorcycle transport in the local community. He has been engaged for over two years in pet selling, one year in providing motorcycle transport, and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jay Ven joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pets for sale and motorcycle spareparts

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim N. lives in Daeum Rumdael village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables.  She faces an obstacle in that she does not have enough money to buy farming supplies. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers, and pesticides, as well as pay for plowing the field. Her husband, Mr. Phun Min, is a construction worker. Mrs. Kim N. is 39 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional hair products

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro S. H. de 58 años de edad, reside en Armenia, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposa y un hijo quien le ayuda en el negocio. Alejandro posee un molino el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación, ahí las personas llegan a moler maíz, frijoles, e ingredientes para salsa, entre otras cosas más. Desde hace 10 años el señor Alejandro se gana la vida de esta manera, razón por la que desea poder invertir en el negocio, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar un motor para el molino, el cual trabaja con gasolina, esto le permitirá  poder brindar un mejor trabajado, ya que el molino funcionará de una manera más rápida y mejor. Para el señor 
Alejandro mejorar su servicio significa más clientes lo que se convierte en mayores ganancias, es por esto que él desea poder mejorar su negocio, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para solventar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Alejandro S. H. is 58 years old and lives in Armenia, which is in the department of Sonsonate. He lives with his wife and his son who helps him with his business. Alejando has a mill which is located in his home. People come to have corn, beans, ingredients for salsa, and other things ground. Mr. Alejandro has made his living this way for ten years which is why he would like to invest in his business, and is why he is asking for a loan. He would like to buy a motor that works with gasoline for his mill. This would allow him to do a better job since the mill would work faster and better. Improving his service would mean more customers for Mr. Alejandro which also means he would earn more. He wants to improve his business since this is his only source of income he can count on to take care of his household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor for his mill.

loans.name: Mrs. Da Hoeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Da H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Roung Ngorn, is a construction laborer. In the rice field, they have some problems because it has infertile soil and is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Da H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she needs to buy fuel to support the rice field. 

Mrs. Da H. is the mother of seven children: two are construction laborers, two others help their parents with the farm, and the others are attending the local public school. 

This village bank has 18 people who all live in Prey Totueng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Da H. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use their loans for different purposes. All of the members are present in the photo (some of them are blocked).

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Busajja Bwakuba Nakimuli Halima Group

texts.en: N. Halima is the group representative of her group. She is married with two children and she has one dependent going to school. She has been dealing in a charcoal business for over three years. With this loan she is purchasing seven bags of charcoal, when previously the maximum she could purchase was four bags. The loan will seriously improve her business as well expanding it. She is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase seven bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 36-year-old married man and father of one young child. He has owned a car repair shop since 2005 with a previous 20 years of experience. He learned this occupation when he was only 16 years old. He is the only provider for his family with his business income. He specializes in making and repairing all type of car motors. He manufactures cars motors and bodies. 

Today Ahmad is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new manufacturing machine in order to improve his business level and productivity and he’s certain that with the help of the loan he will make excellent growth.

loans.use: To purchase a new manufacturing machine

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 33 years old. Jimmy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jimmy owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling coconuts, rice and corn in the local community. Jimmy has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jimmy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and support education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose runs a uniform and linen rental and cleaning service. Having worked previously for another linen company, he realized he could run his own company much more effectively. With his determination and entrepreneurial spirit, today he is a proud business owner. He takes great pride in the fact that his two children also work with him in the business. His daughter handles the administrative work, as well as their marketing efforts to expand to an English-speaking clientele. Jose's son helps out in the warehouse. Jose has also employed a driver to deliver their uniforms to various clients. 

He will use his loan to purchase new inventory for his growing business and for a website and marketing.

loans.use: New inventory, website and marketing

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a carpenter and he has been using this business to care of his family. He lives in Edo state. He is proud of his occupation as he makes chairs, tables and cabinets. He is in need of the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more furniture materials like foams, nails and woods to boost his business.

He is 56 years old and married with 6 children. His children are doing well at school. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture materials to boost his business

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Yang R., 64, sells various kinds of vegetables in the local market, and earns approximately $3 profit a day. Besides her current work, she also takes time to grow a rice crop. She is married to Leum Ngorm, aged 58, who shares responsibility for his family by working as an ox-trader. Yang R. has a child who is single, and two other children who are now married and live away from home. All of them are employed in various jobs. Yang R. is taking out her first loan to buy a cow to raise to produce a baby and to use to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann C. is from the village of Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Julie Ann is married and has 4 infant-aged children. To make a living, Julie Ann owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Julie Ann has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julie Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julie Ann is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Julie Ann from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Sady Mabel

texts.es:
La solicitante es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, esta casada y tiene casa propia.
Es propietaria de una despensa que tiene en su casa, tiene 4 hijos todos en edad escolar.
La señora es una persona muy trabajadora responsable, y honesta. Nos comento que empezo a vender mandioca y carbón en una carretilla por la ciudad de Santani, y que siempre soñaba con tener una despensa bien surtida, por ahora su mayor deseo es aumentar sus ventas diarias y surtir con mercaderías su negocio.
Para eso esta solicita un credito para su capital operativo, es decir desea comprar carne, harina, azucar, arroz, fidoes, aceite, ya que carece de suficientes recurso económico.
texts.en:
Sady is from the city of San Estanislao. She is married and has her own home. Sady manages a store in her home and has four children, all of whom attend school.

She is a hardworking, responsible, and honest person. Sady says she began selling cassava and charcoal from a wheelbarrow in the city of Santani and had always dreamed of having a well-stocked store, but now her greatest wish is to increase her daily sales and restock her business with more merchandise.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to use as operating capital. Sady says she wants to buy meat, flour, sugar, rice, noodles, and oil because she lacks sufficient financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, flour, sugar, rice, noodles, oil, and other products

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, es madre de 2 hijos, el primero tiene 45 años y el segundo 42 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azucar, sal, aceite, leche, huevo, harina, detergente, jabon, champú, fideos, etc., el negocio esta ubicado en su casa. Lorenza antes de ser socia de Finca Perú realizaba las comprás para su tienda por docenas, las cantidades eran menores, pero desde que le facilitan los préstamos ella compra cada producto por cajas inclusive los almacena.
El préstamo que esta solicitando Lorenza lo va ha invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, leche, huevo.
La meta que tiene Lorenza es poder comprár mas exhibidores para poder ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She has two children. The first is 45 years old, and the second is 42 years old. She sells groceries like rice, sugar, salt, oil, milk, eggs, flour, detergent, soap, shampoo, and noodles, etc. Her business is located in her house. Before becoming a member of Finca Perú she bought things for her store by the dozen; the amounts were smaller. Since she received the loans she buys each product, including the ones that are stored, by the case Lorenza will use the loan she is requesting to buy rice, sugar, salt, milk, and eggs. Lorenza’s goal is to buy more display cases to be able to present her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, salt, oil, milk, and eggs

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Matina de 50 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas  caballeros y niños su puesto de ventas se encuentra en la Terminal de ómnibus  de la ciudad hace mas de 15 años, en el trabajo le ayuda su cónyuge el señor  Carlos de 56 años de edad, a cargo de la pareja  solo se encuentra una hija de 21 años estudiante.
 Comenta que empezó con poca mercadería y se hicieron de capital gracias a un préstamo que se le otorgo actualmente cubre todo los gastos familiares gracias al ingreso diario de las ventas de ropas.

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de más mercaderías como camperas, medias, bufandas, pantalones y otros, para satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene estos prendas de vestir por la temporada fria.
texts.en:
Martina, age 50, is a businesswoman. She sells clothes for women, men, and children. She has been selling at the city’s bus terminal for over 15 years. Her life partner, 56 year old Carlos, helps her with the work. The couple only has one daughter under their care. She is 21 years old and goes to school. Matina comments that she started with little merchandise. Her capital grew thanks to a loan she received. She now covers all of the family expenses thanks to the daily income from the clothing sales. She is requesting a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya to buy more merchandise like jackets, hosiery, scarves, pants, and others. She wants to do this in order to satisfy the great demand there is for these articles of clothing for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get seasonal cothes wholesale to sell retail:  jackets, hosiery, scarves, pants, t-shirts, and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Kyeijanga Wome's, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hard working and cooperative T. Winfred is married with four children of her own to take care of and knows that she has her tasks cut out for her.  This reality has looked her in the face for the past nine years as she has gone about her general retail shop business.  Her shop sells general merchandise particularly items for home use and she also does a side business in liquor sales from Kyeijanga, Kihihi. 

With her monthly earnings of 320,000 Ugandan shillings, she has faced long odds in providing for all her family’s needs and principally catering for her children’s welfare as her husband is negligent. Winfred wants to improve the living status of her family through the acquisition of this loan and plans to give her business an improved lease on life by expanding. Through restocking her shop with a vision of making it a wholesale business, she hopes to earn increased sales revenue and to be able to pay the education bills for her children.

loans.use: To restock her business.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 52 years old. Rogelia is married and has 7 school-age children. To make a living, Rogelia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rogelia is doing her best to keep her farm productive. She wants to have a stable income so she can provide for the increasing needs in her household and to sustain her children's education.

Rogelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rogelia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Ulugbek M. is a very open-hearted seller of children's toys. He is 43 years old and has two school-aged children.  Ulugbek started his business in 1998 and achieved success due to his strong efforts and persistent personality. Ulugbek s small shop was known among his little loyal customers as  a place of joy, where they can find different kinds of playthings. 

Unfortunately, in June 2010, Ulugbek lost his business, which was robbed and looted during violent clashes caused by a deposed political regime. But Ulugbek, being very optimistic and hard-working person, didn t give up and did his best to rise from the ruins.  

Ulugbek is applying for a loan of 135,000 Kyryzstani Soms to resume his lost business and continue his activities. He plans to buy a parcel of soft toys for reselling now and playthings for the future New Year s celebrations. It will allow him further development of his shop and to invite his little smiling customers back. 

Ulugbek believes that citizens of Osh will certainly celebrate all festivals and holidays together like one family, in friendship and solidarity.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase toys for reselling

loans.name: Adis Judith

texts.es:
Adis Judith nació en Larica una población del municipio de Córdoba, allí nacieron sus sueños que en un futuro trasladó a la ciudad de Cartagena, hoy con dos  hijos en las edades de 17 y 19 años  terminando el bachillerato y cursando una carrera en la universidad, se siente muy agradecida con Dios, porque como mujer cabeza de familia vivió los mas grandes desafíos en su educación, tratando de ofrecerles siempre lo mejor. Adis se inició trabajando en el sector publico de estado,  luego empezó a trabajar independiente vendiendo ropa de segunda, en el año 2004, gracias a la capacitación que le brindó la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  ha logrado sus cuatro financiamientos   y    crecer como comerciante, pues en la actualidad ha diversificado su oferta de mercancías  y por eso  compra  la ropa en Medellín,  la cual es muy apetecidas por sus clientes y los vende en la ciudad de Cartagena, así mismo viaja a San Jacinto Bolívar, donde compra  hamacas y otras artesanías que vende en la ciudades donde se las encarguen. Con su credickiva, comprará ropa casual para damas caballeros y para niños que tiene encargado para engalanar a sus clientes en las fiestas de fin de año.

Como Adis siempre piensa en ingresos, trabaja fuertemente, así es como también  se dedica a la venta de lotería y al chance; todas estas actividades en su conjunto le han permitido mejorar su nivel de vida y  ahora su sueño  se enfoca en tener una boutique porque su principal reto como  madre cabeza de familia es ayudar a brindarles una educación de calidad  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adis Judith was born in Larica, a town in the municipality of Córdoba.  It was there that she dreamed of moving to the city of Cartagena in the future.  Today, she has two children ages 17 and 19. One is finishing high school and the other is studying for a university degree.  She feels very thankful to God because as the female head of the family, she endured great challenges in providing their education and was always struggling to give them the best. 
 
Initially, Adis worked in the state’s public sector; then she began selling second-hand clothing. In 2004, thanks to the training offered to her by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she received her fourth loan and continues to grow as a business woman. At the present time, she has diversified her supply of merchandise.  She buys her clothing in Medelin because it is very highly desired by her customers and sells it in Cartagena.  In addition, she travels to San Jacinto Bolívar, where she buys hammocks and other crafts which she sells in cities where customers have placed orders.  With her Kiva loan, she will buy casual clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children for her customers who have ordered it to dress up for New Year’s Eve parties.

As Adis is always thinking about income, she works hard.  She also sells lottery tickets.   All of these activities together, have allowed her to improve her standard of living. Now her dream is focused on owning a boutique because her primary goal as female head of the family is to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To buy ladies', gentlemen's and children's casual clothing to fill orders.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar B. is 28 years old and lives with his daughter in Umnugobi province, Mongolia. He and his daughter live together in a traditional Mongolian tent home called a ger. His daughter attends a local kindergarten.

Chuluunbaatar has a studio where he produces a variety of paintings and sculpture. He has been engaged in this business since 2000 with the help of his father, B., and he has since built a stable and successful operation. Over the years, he has gained a lot of experience as an artist and has greatly improved his quality of life. He has used his earnings to build a workplace in his yard as well as to decorate his home.

In the future, he wants to expand his business and study to become an art teacher to instruct children how to paint pictures. He is planning to open his own exhibition during the end of October in his town. In November, he hopes to participate in an exhibition that will be held in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city.

Chuluunbaatar says, "For artists, the exhibition is the best way and biggest chance to sell their art." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials and supplies in order to create more paintings and sculptures that will be exhibited in his own gallery opening in November.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and supplies

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney was born in 1983 and is married with one child. Jean Marie Vianney is a driver, however, he does not drive his own motorbike. Jean Marie Vianney's wife does not work, so she does not have any income. For that reason Jean Marie Vianney works hard in order to provide all necessities for his family. Jean Marie Vianney has an experience of one year in his business and the hours he works are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day.

Jean Marie Vianney is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance in order to buy his own motorbike since he is a licensed driver. With this loan, Jean Marie Vianney will be able to have more income for daily needs.

loans.use: buying a new motorbike

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es: Blanca Nidia tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijas menores de edad a su cargo, ella es una madre soltera, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su hogar. Pues esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos en Fundación, ya que ha tenido varios créditos. Empezó con este negocio desde hace 9 años, empezó vendiendo ropa y zapatos en la calle de manera ambulante con una canasta, hasta  que  estableció una pulpería. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan detergente entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Blanca Nidia is 43 years old and has 2 daughters in her care.  She is a single mother and her business is a grocery store which is located in her home.  This is not the first time she has requested a loan from Fundación.  She has already had several loans from us.  She started this business 9 years ago.  She started out selling clothes and shoes in the street from a basket and did that until she set up her grocery store.  She is requesting this loan to buy candies, soft drinks and detergent among other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 55-year-old husband and supporter of five children.

In 2005, Abbas decided to open his own food market. He is well known where he lives and has a good reputation.

After benefiting from his prior loans, now he is applying for a $2,500 loan to carry out some innovations at his shop and buy more inventories. He plans to expand and enlarge his business and provide a wide variety of products.

loans.use: To carry out some innovations at the shop and buy more inventories

loans.name: Mrs. Chok Saveth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Samraong village, Takeo province, a group of 11 people makes up the village bank loan group. The group members will use the loan to improve their families' living conditions. Mrs. Chok S. has been selected by the other members as the village bank president. 

She is a door-to-door Khmer cheese and fish sauce seller, earning some profit to support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a more than 2-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support the family and he is a cow middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. 

To improve her daily income, Mrs. Chok S. is asking for a loan to buy more Khmer cheese to sell and use the rest of the loan to buy a cow to resell. She has two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cheese to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana nacida el 12 de Julio  en Chuquisaca tiene 6 hijos, ella es viuda se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra sorgo, maíz y maní también se dedica a la ganadería, ella sola mantiene a sus hijos que le ayudan también en la siembra, ella es muy trabajadora,  el  dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas y lo que ocasiona los gastos del preparado de la tierra para la siembra,  ella trabaja solo con Emprender por la facilidad de pago que se le da. En la evaluación de todos los créditos que se le dio a ella resulta que no tiene problemas en cuanto a los pagos de su cuota, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Juana was born July 12th in Chuquisaca, has 6 children, is widowed, and grows sorghum, corn, and peanuts. She also raises cattle. She raises her children on her own and in turn they help her with the crops. She is very hardworking. She will use the loan to buy seeds and pay for expenses from preparing the land to sow. She only works with Emprendedor for the ease of payments that are offered. In evaluating her for past loans granted she has had no problems with paying back loan payments. She is thankful for the help offered by this institution.

loans.use: SIEMBRA DE SORGO COMPRA DE SEMILLAS

loans.name: Jinan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 29 years old, married and has four children.

In 2008, Jinan opened her own sewing project for women and children clothes. She is very experienced in this field and now she is becoming well known and has a good reputation in her local community.

She is requesting a $2,500 loan to buy a new big sewing machine to increase her production. She uses a room in her house for her sewing and she wants to renovate this room. She is aiming to grow bigger in the future and increase her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new big sewing machine and renovate her work room

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie M. is from the village of Mohon. She is 40 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a sari-sari store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in her community. Elvie has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: From the Phnom Penh City of Cambodia, Mao L. is 33 years old and has been selling fresh fish in her village for two years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen, and resales them for profit. She is married, but she divorced from her husband many years ago. Mao L. has five children, three of whom are single and two are married. To improve her business, Mao L. would like a loan to buy fresh fish in large amounts in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in large amounts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Rustam yavlyayetsya IDP personom one pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Rustam F.  31 qod. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Rustam uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji kasetov, diskov i t.d. On seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN  dlya toqo chtobi kupit pobolshe novix diskov i kasetov kotoriyi trebuyutsya sredi pokupateley, eto v osnovnom diski znamenitix pevcov i kaseti so smeshnimi video, no takje on xochet na eti dengi kupit i sdelat sebe steklanniye polki qde budet lazlajivat eti diski , tak kaka vi videte na risunke on prodayet diski v korobkax. Mama Rustama uje 2 qoda kak boleyet  i on vse vremya uxajivayet za ney i mnoqo rabotoyet chtobi oplatiti lecheniye materi.
texts.en: Rustam F. is an Internally Displaced person from the town of Fuzuli. Now he livesi n the Fuzuli Region together with his mother. Rustam F. is 31 year old. He is single without children. For the last four years, Rustam has been selling videotapes, CD/DVD disks etc. At present he needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy merchandise for resale. Rustam’s mother has been ailing for two years. He always takes care of her and works a lot in order to cover her medical expenses

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is a 40-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a snack vending business.   She lives in Balamban, Cebu. Flordeliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Flordeliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to buy more curls, candy, soft drinks, shampoo, sardines, and other miscellaneous items so that she can continue to save up for a future business (like RTW) and to renovate their house. Flordeliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for the store

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra F. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Alejandra is married and has three adult children. Alejandra makes and sells snacks & other delicacies like rice & cheese cakes in the local community. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Alejandra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 8,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital.

This loan will be her third from HSPFI. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase raw ingredients like flour & eggs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour & eggs

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 35 years old and married to Kennedy Tuwei, a farmer.  They are blessed with three children, 16, 12, and 9 years old. Dina owns a posho mill in Ndurio trading centre in Kapsabet town, and has been in the business for a period of eight years.  She earns a monthly income of KES.14,800.  

She has taken out three loans from KADET LTD, and has successfuly repaid them.  She hopes to use the loan to purchase dry maize.  The profits will be used to purchase another posho mill.

She hopes to own a supermarket in Kobujoi trading centre.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some modern tools and other equipment for his metal shop

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La Sra. María  Cecilia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y tiene  04 hijos, tres ya cuentan con familia propia solo el menor de 17 años está en el nivel superior.

Ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos inicia su negocio con la venta de cosméticos  que muchas veces los vendía al crédito, hecho que causó la pérdida de gran parte de su capital y  contando tan solo con  un capital de S/. 500.00 decide vender mercería, pasamanería, zapatos(productos de uso personal) haciéndose rápidamente de muy buena clientela por su carisma y buena atención.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.  2000.00, comprará: espejos, peines, linternas, gel para cabello, jaboneras y zapatos, todo ello en docenas para así surtir su mercadería y dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

María Cecilia es una mujer emprendedora, su sueño es contar con una tienda propia y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Cecilia belongs to the “Virgen de las Mercedes” Communal Bank in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She is single, 42 years old and has 4 children, three of which have their own family, the youngest is 17 years old and is attending high school.

Due to necessity she decided to earn her own income and began her own business selling makeup that many times she sold on credit, which caused her great losses to her capital as she only had S/. 500.00. Mrs. María Cecilia decided to sell haberdashery, embroidery, shoes (products for personal use) especially having quickly made a good customer base with her charisma and good customer service.

With a loan of S/. 2000.00 she will buy mirrors, combs, flashlights, hair gel, soap, and shoes, all of it in dozens to stock her merchandize and provide her customers with what they need.

María Cecilia is an enterprising woman; her dream is to have her own store and is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women liker achieve their dreams.

loans.use: buy mirrors, combs, flashlights, hair gel, soap, and shoes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 49 years of age and married. He has four adult children. He earns about PHP 40,000 per crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

He grows a large crop of rice and has been doing it for over 20 years. George is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase pesticides, fertilizers and seeds of rice for his farm. 

He dreams that someday his business will be profitable to uplift their living condition. He also wishes to expand his area of farming for an additional source of income.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, fertilizers and rice seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and has five children.

In 1997, Hamza opened a workshop, selling spare parts for cars. He has long experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to make a sliding door and to purchase additional inventory (car accessories and tools). He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to purchase additional inventory (car accessories and tools).

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is 60 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rodita has an "abaca" weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca-making.

Rodita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Rodita would like to provide good living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for "abaca" (natural fiber) making.

loans.name: Anna Rose

texts.en:
Anna Rose is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Anna Rose makes and sells souvenirs like necklaces made from seashells. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed to make souvenirs.

Anna Rose is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anna Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed lo make souvenirs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 38-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur.  She has 11 children between the ages of 1 and 18 and her husband works as a driver.  

For the past four years, she has owned a general store in which she sells goods such as rice, sugar, and salt.  This business has allowed her to maintain a good standard of living for her family.

She will use this loan to purchase 50 kg of sugar and salt and 150 kg of rice that she will sell at her place of business for a profit. 

With the future profits from her business, she plans to feed her children and begin saving so she may provide for them in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and rice to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is too young for school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a fruit-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She also sells vegetables, her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old married man, father of four children. Mohamad works in car maintenance. He specializes in fixing car radiators. He's an expert in his field, and is recommended by most of his clients because of the good quality of his work.

Mohamad is a hard worker, and in order to cover most of his family's expenses he has started a new business, transporting students from/to school on a school bus. It's a good job that provides him with an acceptable income.  That's why he is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, the Kiva partner, in order to do the necessary maintenance to his bus before the school year starts.

Mohamad said that he wants his students to be relaxed, and he will work hard on improving this part of his business in future. For now he will fix the bus and its color, while next time he hopes to invest in a bigger bus. He also wants to expand both businesses to fulfill all his family's needs. This is his first experience with A. Majmoua, and he hopes it's going to be a good investment for future plans.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his bus

loans.name: 10.7 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai has a retail business selling dry food and she has been involved with this business for two years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to resell.

Mai is 36 years old and she is married with one child.
Mai is the group leader of the 10.7 Nam Ngạn solidarity group which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Mai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main harship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.  She hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is 25 years old, married with 3 children between the ages of 6 months and 5 years, living in her own house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been operating a cosmetics shop for 1 year despite the challenge of price fluctuations. Her dream is to have a wholesale shop. Immaculate needs the loan facility to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Jaqueline F

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme qui vend des produits halieutiques notamment le poisson frais, le poisson séché et le poisson fumé.Elle écoule son produit sur les marchés de sa localité, ce qui lui assure des revenus pour prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille .Pour renorcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 250000F de l'UIMCEC pour acheter  du poisson et des produits entrant dans la transformation .
texts.en:
Jacqueline sells fish products, in particular fresh fish, dried fish, and smoked fish. She sells her products on the markets of her city, which assures her an income to provide for herself and her family.

In order to bolster her working capital, she's seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, in order to buy fish and products needed for the transformation process.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of fish and products needed for the transformation process

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Marcial has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & vegetables like eggplant & string beans. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables for sale.
Marcial has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marcial hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables for sale

loans.name: Maria Felicitas

texts.es:
María de 52 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y ganadería.  

María se dedica  a la venta de frutas, tiene su puesto al frente de mercado de la zona donde vive, con una experiencia de 10 años, es conocida por la buena calidad de su producto (frutas) y tiene su propia clientela,  las ventas de sus productos se han ido incrementando; al igual que sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue de 1000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar mayor cantidad de fruta para abastecer su negocio como a su clientela, ya que sus productos son consumidos diariamente, el aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito y cumplir con sus obligaciones de casa.  María es una persona con muchos aspiraciones y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener más grande su  puesto en el mercado y contar con más comodidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
María is 52, and lives with her husband and children in their own house, which has water and electricity. It is located in the urban area of Bambamarca district, which is part of Cajamarca department.  People in this area make their living from farming and livestock-raising.

María sells fruit. She has her stand in the front of the market of the area where she lives.  She has ten years of experience doing this, and is known for the good quality of her fruit.  She has her own clientele, and the sales of her products have been gradually increasing, along with her income; improving her family's quality of life.  

She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles through the Capital Semilla program. She will use it to buy fruit in greater quantity, in order to stock her business and supply her clientele, as her products are consumed on a daily basis. The increase in her sales will allow her to pay back her loan, and meet her household expenses.

María is a person with many ambitions, and one of them is that with her hard work, she can have a larger stand in the market, and have more home comforts.

loans.use: To buy fruit in greater quantity for stocking her business and supplying her customers.

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es: Marlith tiene 55 años, es una mujer luchadora y alegre. Viven en compañía de su pareja, su hija, su yerno y su nieto en su casa que es propia. Se siente muy contenta de poder tener cerca a su familia a los que quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Marlith es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para lo cual abrió un bodega en su propia casa. Desde entonces su establecimiento esta abierto todo el día atendiendo a su clientela. Se siente muy contenta con su negocio, por la clientela que tiene, quienes siempre le compran sus productos. Tiene seis meses dedicándose a esta actividad, y considera rentable ya que gracias a ello percibe ganancias, lo cual lo deriva para los gastos del hogar. Asimismo su yerno también apoya en la economía, de esa manera pueden vivir comodamente. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio, sabe que ésto solo se puede lograr a base de trabajo constante y dedicación. Este sería el crédito número once con la institución MFP, se siente cómoda con su grupo comunal, por el tiempo que tiene conoce muy bien a la mayoría con las cuales tiene una estrecha amistad y se apoyan entre si. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará más productos de primera necesidad y al por mayor para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Marlith is 55 years old. She is a cheerful and determined woman who lives in her own house with her partner, her daughter, her son-in-law and grandson. She very happy to have her family and loved ones close by. Marlith sells staple products to which end she opened a store in her own house. Since then the business is open all day serving customers. She is very happy with her business, for the cuctomers she has who always buy her products. She has been doing this work for 6 months and thinks it is profitable as it has resulted in profits which are used for household expenses. Her son-in-law also supports the household economy and in this way they can live comfortably. Her greatest desire is to expand her business. She knows that this can only be achieved through consistent hard work and dedication. This would be her 11th loan with the institution MFP. She feels comfortable with her communal bank group. She has known most of them a while and has a close friendship with them and they support each other. With the requested loan, she will buy more staple products wholesale to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more products with which to stock her store.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана – из Великой Знаменки. Она занимается выращиванием ранних помидор на своем участке вот уже 8 лет. Ее сын Евгений активно помогает ей в этом, работая на огороде. У Светланы есть 2 больших теплицы. В хозяйство у Светланы вложено 40 000 гривен. На семена и полиэтиленовую пленку у нее в год уходит около 17 000 гривен.

Светлана планирует вложить кредит в 13 000 гривен в постройку новой теплицы для выращивания помидор. Дополнительная просторная теплица даст возможность выращивать более качественные помидоры и притом в большем количестве. В ближайших планах Светланы также провести отопление в теплицы, что становится все более актуально в преддверии холодной зимы. Благодаря успешному ведению сельскохозяйственного бизнеса Светлана смогла в этом году приобрести автомобиль для вывоза помидор. В следующем году это должно помочь при реализации продукции.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Svetlana is from Velikaya Znamenka. She grows early tomatoes on her plot of land for eight years now. Her son Evgeny is actively helping her in this business by working on the field. Svetlana has two big greenhouses. She has invested 40,000 hrivna in her business. She spends around 17,000 hrivna a year on seeds and plastic covers.

Svetlana plans to invest the 13,000 hrivna loan to build a new greenhouse to grow tomatoes. An additional spacy greenhouse will let her grow better quality tomatoes in larger quantities. In her short term goals Svetlana also wants to install heating equipment in her greenhouses which is becoming increasingly important in the run-up to cold winter. Thanks to the successful farming business Svetlana was able to buy a car this year to transport the tomatoes. Next year it should help her to sell the products.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse for growing tomatoes.

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es: El señor Alejandro es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, su esposa labora como comerciante de nacatamales , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen hijos a su cargo , don Alejandro desde hace varios años trabaja en un empresa privada , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su sueldo no es suficiente para poder realizar de una sola vez la reconstrucción de su humilde vivienda ,ya que necesita bloques , cemento , arena , piedrín , hierro , zinc , etc. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondos Kiva ya que con la ayuda que brinda son muchos las familias de escasos recursos que logran cambiar sus vidas obteniendo un techo digno .
texts.en: Alejandro lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife and children.  His wife sells nacatamales to help with the household expenses since they have children to take care of.  For several years Alejandro has worked for a private business.  The biggest problem he faces is that his salary doesn't provide him with enough to rebuild his modest home all at once, since he needs cinder blocks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, zinc, etc.  He is thankful for the support he has received from Afodenic through Kiva's funding as their help allows many families with limited resources to change their lives by putting a decent roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Koudiratou

texts.fr:
Koudiratou est une femme  âgé(e) de 34ans. Elle est veuve et a 04 enfants en charge.
Koudiratou travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames frites et pâtes alimentaires depuis 2006. Elle vend dans un quartier de la place et est aidée par 02 personnes.
Koudiratou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames,de l’huile et de la boisson locale
texts.en:
Koudiratou is a 34-year-old woman. She is a widow with four children to care for.

Since 2006 Koudiratou has been retailing fried yams and pasta. She sells in her local neighborhood, assisted by two persons.

Koudiratou requested her first loan from WAGES to buy yams, vegetable oil and local beverages.

loans.use: Buy goods for her business (yams, vegetable oil and others)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
La señora Gisela es costurera; vive con su hijo y su esposo el cual  es chofer; el crédito lo necesita para la compra del equipo de gas natural vehicular  para el taxi de su esposo, ya que es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Con esta modificación, el costo de combustible se verá notablemente reducido.Gisela vive en la zona San Martín ubicada en  la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es la séptima vez que Gisela trabaja con IMPRO y la sexta vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en: Gisela is a seamstress living with her son and husband who is a driver.  She needs the loan to buy a kit to change from gasoline to natural gas for her husband’s taxi because that’s the source of income for family support.  With this modification fuel costs will be noticeably reduced.  Griselda lives in the city of La Paz’s San Martín zone.  This is the 7th time she’s worked with IMPRO and the 6th with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a kit to change from gasoline to natural gas for her taxi.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia a 25-year-old woman from Irbid, Jordan, who lives with four other family members. She is requesting a loan of 300 JOD to pay for maintenance repairs on her home. Since Fadia is under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan. 

Due to cultural reasons Fadia prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Iralda

texts.en:
Iralda C. was born in Manabi, Ecuador and is 40 years old. She is a married mother of two who sells perfumes, creams, and clothes to her female clients. She attends to the business at her own home and is willing to do business just about any time of day any day of the week. Iralda takes advantage of the fiestas that happen in the town and works along side a friend of hers who also runs a clothing business. Her friend supported her financially when it came time to start Cosmeticos Iralda, and her husband stood behind her every step of the way. With five years of experience, she can’t complain. Business has been pretty good for Iralda. She has been able to supplement her husband’s income with her own. She is asking for this loan to buy new perfumes and cosmetic products.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: buy new perfumes and cosmetic products

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
3 years ago Anar decided to open his cafe.He has many regular clients. His cafe is very small.
