Anar is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin region, settled in  Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 2 children.
This 29-year old man is a very good kabob-maker. You can see in the picture a woman, who is his worker.
Having borrowed a loan of $500 he bought an oven and a stove.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy additional equipment to maintain his cafe.

loans.use: To buy equipment for cafe

loans.name: Puapuaga

texts.en: Puapuaga is married with five children. She started her business selling Samoan cocoa and pancakes using a small loan from the SPBD program in 2006. She usually operates her little  business during mornings when people prepare for their breakfast.  Recently, she was able to get a special arrangement with the nearby school to supply pancakes and Samoan cocoa for breakfast. With a more steady market, she is now more confident in expanding her business by purchasing an additional oven, grinder and stocks for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven for the pancakes, grinder for the cocoa, and additional ingredients for the business

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna Banguran is forty years of age, married to tractor operator and has  four children. She runs a jewelry stall in market in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  She would like a second larger loan fund from SMT to purchase better quality jewelry.   Memuna says that with a larger loan she will be able to extend her business to the near by villages where she will earn more profit.

loans.use: Increase inventory of costume jewlery

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en: I have had a small Grocery Store( pulperia) for 7 years. I have good customers; all my neighbors buy and other people from other communities. Now I need to provide more products in the store. This business allows me to help my family with monthly expenses.

loans.use: Buy products such as rice, sugar, juice, beans, bread, coffee, disinfectant

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 47 years old and has been separated from her husband for a number of years. With her strong character, she set a good example for her three adolescent children and set them on a good path. Previously she worked at a well-known restaurant in her town, but she saw household expenses rising and her salary was insufficient to meet all her family's needs. So she decided to risk her small amount of saving and start her own business with the help of her children. Since then she has set out on the streets selling delicious cebiche, a popular regional dish. At first, the business did not appear to be too profitable, but little by little her sales grew thanks to her excellent flavor and seasoning, and she now has a long list of customers. Her dream now is to purchase a cart and enlarge her business, and for this she is requesting a loan of $350 to help her increase her income and be able to fulfill her dreams of a higher education for her children. Help Francisca and her family will prosper along with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Francisca de 47 años edad, separada de su esposo hace ya varios años, con su entereza y su buen ejemplo supo sacar adelante a sus hijos 3 hijos adolescentes y guiarlos por el buen camino.Anteriormente trabajaba en una cebichería reconocida de su ciudad, pero al ver que los gastos de su hogar se incrementaban y el sueldo que obtenía con este trabajo era insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, decidió arriesgar el poco ahorrito que tenia y emprender junto a sus hijos su propio negocio, desde entonces se dispuso a salir a las calles y ofrecer su delicioso cebiche en forma ambulatoria; en un principio este negocio no parecía ser tan rentable, pero poco a poco fue creciendo gracias a su excelente sabor y sazón ya cuenta con gran cantidad de clientes.El deseo que ahora tiene doña Francisca es comprar un triciclo y ampliar su rentable negocio, para esto solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares, dinero que podrá invertir para acrecentar su negocio y así generar mayores ingresos económicos para ofrecerles sus tan deseados estudios superiores a sus hijos. “Ayudemos Francisca y su familia a prosperar con este negocio”

loans.use: Enlarge business and set up a better sales stand

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.ru:
Nurmahmad S. is 40 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 5 children. Nurmahmad’s main occupation is repair and construction of houses. In addition he raises livestock, as he has spent his whole life living in a village. He has taken care of livestock since childhood.

Nurmahmad will use the loan to purchase 3 small bulls and plans to sell them after feeding them. He sells his livestock at the local market where local residents come. After the credit cycle and full repayment of the loan, Nurmahmad will earn 2 pieces of livestock in profit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Самадов Нурмахмад, возраст – 40 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Основным видом деятельности, которым заниамается Нурмахмад это ремонт и строительство домов, помимо этого он дополнительно занимается разведением и домашнего крупного рогатого скота, так как всю свою жизнь он прожил в кишлаке Мингчинор Яванского района и с детства ухаживал за домашним скотом своего отца, а затем и своим собственным. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести 3 небольших бычка, который собирается после откормки продать. Скот он продает на местном рынке, где в торговый день съезжаются жители города Явана и близлежащих районов. В конце кредитного цикла после полного погашения суммы кредита клиенту в качестве прибыли остается 2 головы крупного домашнего скота. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 bulls

loans.name: Chit

texts.en:
Mrs. Chit K. H., 32, is the mother of four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She cooks a variety of Khmer foods, selling them to the people at a market, and typically earns about US$ 7/day in revenue. Her husband works as a barber on a roadside in his community, making on average US$ 2/day in profit. Two of their children are employed by a private company and other two are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Chit K. H. hopes to use this loan to build a little shelter to be used as a barbershop for her husband. The remainder of the loan is to buy a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Chit K. H. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To build a barbershop for her husband's business and buy a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thêu, 55 years old, has been with the TYM Fund for 10 years. Her husband passed away long time ago. She raises three children by herself. She confides to her friends that having all children grown up and become good people is everything to do with the Fund. She brews rice liquor and tends pigs. Byproduct from the brewer is used to feed pigs. Money from liquor sales is used to pay loan installments and money from pigs sales is used for big spending items. She is applying for a loan of 1200USD to by more piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Thêu, 55 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương đã được trên 10 năm. Chồng chị mất từ lâu, một mình chị lam lũ, vất vả nuôi 3 con trưởng thành. Chị tâm sự để có được như ngày hôm nay là nhờ rất nhiều vào Quỹ Tình thương. Từ những món vay lớn trả dần giúp chị thuận lợi trong việc phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Công việc chính của chị Thêu là nấu rượu và chăn nuôi lợn. Bã rượu được chị tận dụng làm thức ăn chăn nuôi nên tiết kiệm được một phần chi phí thức ăn gia súc. Tiền bán rượu giúp chị trả tiền tuần. Thu nhập từ bán lợn giúp chị có một khoản tiền chi cho những dự định lớn. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm lợn con và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and foods for them

loans.name: Lucie Hortense

texts.fr:
Mrs. Lucie P. was born on December 13, 1967 in the economic capital of BENIN. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She is a professional seamstress, and at the same time she sells traditional wrap around fabric (pagnes), dry goods and also phone cards for the different phone networks of BENIN. Her business is set up in the heart of the largest town of BENIN, COTONOU. The customers’ demand is in a clear-cut growth. The financing not being available, she is requesting a loan to reinforce and improve the conditions of her performance in order to respond to the requests and demands of her clientele that keeps on growing.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 13 décembre 1967 dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame P. Lucie est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Couturière de profession, elle mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente des tissus pagne, des produits de mercerie et également les cartes de recharges des différents réseaux de téléphonie du Bénin. Son lieu d’activité étant implanté au cœur de la plus grande ville du BENIN, COTONOU la demande des clients est en nette progression. Le financement n’étant pas au rendez vous elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer et améliorer les conditions de sa prestation afin de répondre aux exigences et aux demandes de la clientèle qui ne cesse de croître.

loans.use:
Purchase of 2 bales of traditional wrap around fabric and 20 phone cards.
Achat de 2 balle de tissus pagne et 20 cartes de recharges.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
PORFIRIO is 54 and is a single father with three small children. He lives in the Primavera neighborhood and has sold clothes and groceries from his small store for the past ten years. His business allows him to support his children and make sure that they have the food, medicine and education they need. He has taken out loans in order to increase his business and is now requesting a loan to be able to invest further in his business. He is very concerned about maintaining and increasing his business to be able to provide for his children's basic necessities. His oldest son is 12 and the youngest is 6. Porfirio has built a solid client base in his community and has been able to get ahead despite the difficulties he has encountered.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

PORFIRIO es un señor de 54 años de edad, es padre soltero de 3 hijos aun pequeños, vive en el Barrio la Primavera y tiene un pulpería y venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, con ese negocio mantiene a sus hijos y procura no les falta comida, medicamentos y educación, con créditos ha logrado ir creciendo en su negocio. Solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio el cual le preocupa mucho mantener y hacerlo crecer para garantizar a sus hijos sus necesidades básicas ya que son pequeños el mayor tiene 12 años y el menor 6 años. Ha logrado una buena clientela en su comunidad y en medio de sus dificultades ha logrado salir adelante.

loans.use: Investment for his business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and has three children, who are 12, 8, and 6 years old. All three study at a school in the same neighborhood where they live because it is too difficult to get to the city center of Encarnación, since both Lilian and her husband have to work.

They have lived in their own house for many years. They acquired it through much sacrifice, since they had to double their efforts and go through some very difficult times in order to get together enough money to buy it so that they could give their children an improved life. Lilian owns a very well stocked small grocery store in the house, which allows her to be at home and take care of her family.

Lilian’s husband is a street vendor that sells a variety of merchandise in the neighborhoods of Encarnación. In this way they both contribute their income to their household and expenses.

Lilian sells different types of basic goods merchandise in her store. In general, small grocery stores like this are the most frequented for daily purchases in the country. Despite the fact that there are municipal markets and supermarket chains, the small grocery stores continue to be the most convenient and inexpensive option.

Lilian is requesting a loan today with which she will augment her stock of merchandise and buy a greater variety of products so as to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lilian tiene 31 años, vive en pareja y tiene tres hijos, de 12, 8 y 6 años, los tres estudian en un colegio de la zona de su casa, ya que le es difícil venir hasta centro mismo de la ciudad de Encarnación para que estudien por el tema que tanto ella como su pareja trabajan.

Viven en su casa propia hace muchos años, la misma fue adquirida bajo mucho sacrificio de parte de la pareja, ya que tuvieron que redoblar sus esfuerzos y pasar por momentos muy difíciles para poder reunir el dinero suficiente para comprarse la casa y dar una seguridad mayor a sus hijos. Lilian posee una despensa muy bien surtida de mercaderías en su domicilio lo que permite que este todo el día en la casa cuidando al mismo tiempo de su familia.

La pareja de Lilian se dedica a la venta ambulante de mercaderías varias por los barrios de la ciudad de Encarnación, de este modo ambos aportan con los ingresos a la casa y hacen frente a los gastos.

Lilian comercializa distintos tipos de mercaderías para consumo diario en su tienda, por lo general, las despensas son las tiendas mas recurridas para abastecimientos en los barrios del país, a pesar de que existen los mercados municipales y las cadenas de supermercados, las despensas siguen siendo la opción mas rápida y cómoda de comprar.

Lilian solicita el crédito hoy día, pues con el mismo busca acrecentar su stock de mercaderías y variar más sus productos de modo a poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise such as dairy products, breads, soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, sweets, canned goods, and noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Ida belongs to the Communal Bank “El Progreso,” her business is a pharmacy where she offers her customers medicines and toiletries for the entire family. Her business is located in the Central Market of Huaraz, in Huaraz province, Ancash state

With the S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy different medicines and toiletry products.

She is 54 years old, is separated, and has 1 child who is now a grown professional. She separated from her husband when her son was 5 years old and alone she has been able to educate and enable her son’s success. The two still live together and she continues working so that she can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Señora Ida pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Progreso", tiene como negocio una Botica en donde ofrece a sus clientes Medicinas y Productos de Tocador para toda la familia, su negocio esta ubicado en el Mercado Central de Huaraz; provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará diferentes medicinas y productos de tocador.

Ella tiene 54 años es separada y madre de un hijo que ya es profesional, se separo de su esposo cuando su niño tenia la edad de 5 años y sola a podido educar y sacar adelante a su hijo, viven los dos y sigue trabajando para que siga creciendo su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in the pharmacy

loans.name: May

texts.en: May K., 53, is married and lives with her three children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband work in the fields together as farmers and they make around US$4 each day. The family is also supported by one of their children who is a brick ladder maker. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia, because weather patterns have not been as consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. May K. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer and yam seeds. They believe that with an opportunity to expand their business, they can generate more income and improve their standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business even further with the purchase of rubber trees.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and yam seeds

loans.name: Elena Anastacia

texts.es:
Elena is a married mother of 4 daughters, ages 20, 19, 12, and 10. She started her own business because one of her daughters, who was selling shoes by catalogue, convinced her to do so. Because her daughters were studying to be administrative assistants at a technical institute, and because the expenses were too big for her husband, she started selling footwear to help out with her children’s studies. She started 4 years ago and has been prosperous so far.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase this season’s merchandise. With your help, she will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es casada y madre de 4 hijas de 20, 19, 12 y 10 años. Ella inició el negocio por una de sus hijas que al estar viendo un catalogo de zapatos, la animo a vender, y como sus hijas estaban estudiando para secretarias contador en un instituto técnico comercial y los gastos eran muy fuertes para su esposo, ella comenzó a vender para poder ayudar con los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. Comenzó hace 4 años y hasta la fecha le ha ido bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar mercancía de temporada. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Salomat

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Г¤Г«Гї Г°Г Г±ГёГЁГ°ГҐГ­ГЁГї

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, es socia del Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Triunfo Nº 1112. Se dedica a la fabricación de cajas de madera para el envío de frutas y verduras a otras partes del departamento y del país. 

Con este crédito de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  madera para la fabricación de las cajas, clavos y pegamento, asimismo invertirá en la siembra de cacao, tiene planeado sembrar 8 hectáreas y necesita capital para ello, para pagar sobre todo la mano de obra de los peones. 

La señora Silvia tiene 57 años de edad, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se puede alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa arreglar su casa para poner una tienda de venta de repuestos para motos.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the community banking group called "Hidden Treasure." She lives in the San Martín region of the Mariscal Cáceres province in the Juanjui district. Her business is located in her own home at Jr. Triunfo #1112. She works building wooden boxes to send fruits and vegetables to other parts of the department (state) and country.

With this loan of 3000 soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will buy wood to build the boxes, nails and glue. She will also invest in the sowing of cocoa beans - she has planned to seed 8 hectares, and needs the capital for this, and especially, to pay the day laborers.

Silvia is 57 years old, and works daily showing that she's an ambitious woman and that to acheive her goals, there are no limits and she can reach them with strength and dedication. It's with this attitude that in the future she is thinking about fixing up her house to put in a store that sells spare parts for scooters.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, nails and glue.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: COUMBA L. HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE COMMERCIALISE DES DENREES ALIMENTAIRES DEPUIS 2003. ELLE EST MARIEE.
texts.en:
COUMBA L. lives in the NDAYANE district of DIOURBEL. She has been marketing grocery items since 2003. She is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 41 tuổi. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán. Ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương thợ xây của chồng và con trai. Với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Thảo đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư vón cho công việc kinh doanh tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thảo is 41 years old. In 2003, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed to invest in a retail business. In addition to the income from the retail business, her family get additional income monthly from her husband's and son's construction worker salaries. With an income of 4,000,000 VND per month, each day Mrs. Nguyễn's family's financial situation becomes more stable and gets better. This upcoming loan cycle, she wants to borrow 15,000,000 VND to put towards the family business in an effort to further improve their income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr: Né vers 1978 dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur   E. Karim est marié et père de 3 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village d’Ahovilèkomè de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU DE HOUEDOME. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique ils ont sollicité un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Mr. Karim E. was born around 1978 in the HOUEDOME district in the town of DANGBO. He is married and the father of three children, one of whom attends school. He is a farmer in Ahovilèkomè village in the Ouémé valley and is a member of the HOUEDOME group GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU. The inhabitants of this village work the land after the fall of the level of the Ouémé river. Their land is rich and offers a high yield. Their main activity is growing corn, peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes and manioc. The problem for these riverside residents is that, during the flood period, they no longer have anything to do and spend all the income generated from the sale of their harvested produce. When the river level drops they do not have any money left to pay for the workforce essential for sowing the available land. The local practice of selling cheaply the harvest does not provide them with financial security and further bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at a rock-bottom price to an affluent person in order to have the required money to continue farming. Tired of this practice, they are requesting a loan of 100 000 FCFA (USD 200) to farm about one hectare of the aforementioned land.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To farm one hectare of corn and peppers

loans.name: Olawuni

texts.en: Olawuni is 35 years old and married with two children. She is a LAPO client. She sells jewelry and kitchen utensils. She is requesting for the loan amount of 140,000 NGN ($1,000 US) to start selling kerosene. She hopes to combine the two businesses together to help her make more profits to assist her husband in taking care of the children. She says, "Thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Danya Nor Group

texts.en:
Sayadnor is the leader of this group. There are five members in the group and each of them would like to receive a loan for his/her own business.

Sayadnor Ahmady and Mastora want to take loans for their shops to expand them and to buy necessary materials. Leyda wants to take a loan for her business of beading and wants to buy necessary materials for her business. SayadA. Waley and Wayda want to take loans for their carpet weaving businesses, wishing to expand and progress their businesses.

With these loans they can support their families and make a better future.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business.

loans.name: Erwin Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Erwin Julio Zúñiga vive en el barrio Mira Flores del Torno, en el departamento de Santa Cruz, Bolivia, vive conjuntamente a sus padres en la casa de su padre. Se dedica al comercio de ganado porcino, es un cliente antiguo que empezó a trabajar con nosotros hace desde el 2006.
Además de esto tiene como profesión la de Médico Veterinario con lo que se ayuda mucho para el comercio de ganado. El crédito que le fue desembolsado es especialmente para la compra de ganado porcino, que comercializará en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Es un muy buen cliente tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Mr. Erwin Julio Zúñiga lives with his parents in the Mira Flores del Torno neighborhood in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. He makes a living raising pigs. He has been a client [of Emprender, the loan agency] since 2006. In addition, he also acts as a veterinarian, which helps a lot when raising and selling animals. The loan he received is for buying more pigs, which he sells in the city of Santa Cruz. He is a good loan client who really wants to keep working with [Emprender].

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, cooking oil and maize flour in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa Lidia M. P. vive en  Soyapango departamento San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo que es empleado en un taller de mecánica automotriz  e hijos de 6 y 7 años de edad que estudian. Rosa se dedica a la  producción de jugos y licuados, que son muy conocidos y preferidos en zona por sus precios muy bajos y de excelente calidad, Rosa solicita un crédito para compra de materiales para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Lidia Martinez Panameno lives in Soyapango department San Salvador with her husband, who works at an auto repair shop, and their children, ages 6 and 7, who are students. Rosa sells fresh fruit juices and blended fruit drinks which are well-known and liked in her area due to their high quality and low price. Rosa is asking for a loan to purchase materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Farida has been a clothes, shoes and perfumes seller in the Milinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to Mwanzo mgumu group loan (Group code 2018). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business for eight hours every day.

Farida is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes, perfumes and shoes to add her current stock, to expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Farida is 34 years old, married, and has a 12-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Asha, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, and perfume to add her current stock to expand her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is 35 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. According to her, the children are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Regina works very hard to support her husband in providing for the children. She is a trader of pastries. She fries doughnuts, meat pies, etc., and supplies them to retailers. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Accra. Regina has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en: Mrs. Cherrylyn M. is a bonafide resident of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Married and blessed with 2 children, she started her business with their own capital together with her sister. Their customers are mostly their  neighbors and passers-by. The status of her store is stable and progressing, expanding and full of stock. Recently, she's requesting her loan in the amount of 3,000 that will be used to buy additional stock. Her future plan is to have branches in other municipalities. And for her family, that her children will be able to finish their studies and become successful in their profession.

loans.use: to buy additional stock

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A., 45, is a married mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. While few of her children have completed school and are working, others are still in senior and junior high school. She lives with few of her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She trades in printed textile and ladies wear. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. Hannah also hawks to sell. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi de l’association Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles polygamiques dans le village de Banankoro  (4ème  Région administrative du Mali). Âgées en moyenne de 45 ans avec 4 enfants, elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et d’amitié.
Les membres du groupe Benkadi font le commerce d’articles divers et de la friandise dans lesquels  ils sont très sollicités et appréciés.
Dans le but d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités, elles décidèrent de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursés les six prêts précédents, elles sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire qui  sera utilisé pour acheter,  4sacs de haricot, 2 sacs de mil, 400 kg d’oignon et un chargement de charrette en mangue. Elles s’approvisionnent en mangue dans les vergers du village, en haricot, mil et en oignon hebdomadairement à la foire du village avec les forains venant de Niono et de Ségou. Une bonne partie du haricot est transformée en beignets pour la vente. Elles revendent toutes leurs marchandises en détail au comptant et à crédit  à domicile, en ambulant dans le village, au camp militaire et à la foire hebdomadaire de Banankoro à une clientèle constituée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
Elles  envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt  et pour l’épargne. 
Elles souhaitent épargner afin d’acheter des équipements pour les travaux champêtres.
texts.en:
The five women of the Group Benkadi in the Association Danaya are mostly married in traditional, large, polygamous families in the town of Banankoro (4th Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). On average they are 45 years old with 4 children. They know each other through of the links of marriage, neighborhood and friendship.

The members of Group Benkadi sell various items and delicacies which are very wanted and popular. With the goal of increasing the volume of their business, they decided to turn to the micro-finance group Soro Yiriwaso. After having properly re-paid their 6 previous loans, they are on their 7th loan together. They will use the loan to buy 4 sacks of beans, 2 sacks of millet (grain), 400 kilograms of onions and a cart-load of mangoes. They will supply themselves with mangoes from the local orchard; they will buy beans, millet and onions from the weekly market from the vendors from Niono and Ségou. A good part of the beans is turned into donuts to sell.

They sell all of their merchandise at retail for cash and credit from their houses, walking around the town, at the military base and in the weekly market in Banankoro. Their clientele consists of men, women and children.

They anticipate earning an average monthly profit of 17.500FCFA which they will use to pay the maturity dates of the loan and for savings. They want to save to buy farming equipment.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various supplies for their business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 35 años, está casada y es madre de un hijo. Junto a su esposo pudo concretar la realización de su casa propia a base de mucho esfuerzo. Desde soltera se dedicó a trabajar en la venta de cosméticos, pues apoyaba a su familia con los gastos de la casa y ahora tiene una responsabilidad mayor en su propio hogar. Los 15 años de experiencia en este negocio le permiten desenvolverse adecuadamente en el comercio, además tiene gran cantidad de clientes que le hacen pedidos mensualmente. Todos los días se dedica a visitar a sus clientes regulares y por las tardes va en busca de otras personas para ofrecerles sus productos con la finalidad de que sus pedidos aumenten. Actualmente, Luisa ha puesto en marcha un nuevo proyecto, que es de instalar una tienda en su casa, local que está en construcción, pero pronto funcionará como una tienda de productos de belleza. Es por este proyecto que Luisa se está esforzando al máximo en sus horas de trabajo, realizando grandes recorridos por las calles de su localidad en busca de clientela. En los 14 préstamos que viene teniendo con Microfinanzas PRISMA ha trabajado con su banco comunal de manera muy responsable, gracias al empeño que ponen cada una de sus compañeras. Con los 2000 soles que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, en especial los más solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa is 35 years old, is married and is the mother of one son. Together with her husband and with much effort she has been able to solidify the realization of owning her very own home. From the time she was single she worked in cosmetic sales, since she was supporting her family with the household expenses, and now she has more responsibility in her own home. Her 15 years of experience in this business have enabled her to manage properly in the business. What's more she has a large quantity of customers who order from her monthly. Everyday she visits her regular customers and in the afternoons she goes searching for new people to offer them her products with the aim of increasing her orders. Currently, Luisa has set a new project into motion, which is installing a store in her home, a location which is still in construction, but soon will function as a beauty products store. It is due to this project that Luisa is working her hardest during her work hours, carrying out large trips down the streets of her town in search of customers. In the 14 loans that she has had with Microfinanzas PRISMA, she has worked with her communal bank in a very responsible way, thanks to the effort put out by each of her partners. With the 2000 soles that she is requesting now she will buy a larger quantity of beauty products, especially those most requested by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete F. (10100006977) is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Faleseela. She is single and does not have any children. Pelenatete operates a family member's business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Pelenatete has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Pelenatete joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Pelenatete is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD. Pelenatete is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST to be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Pelenatete from SPBD. Pelenatete plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Manzoor Group

texts.en:
Mazoor S. is the group leader. He is single and lives in Jalalabad, Nangarhar province. With hard work, he formed a group of three members. Each one of them is busy with different tasks: Mazoor S. has a general store, Mahmood S. is a taxi driver, and Bibi S. has a tailoring business. 

They want to become stronger in their businesses, so they formed a group and requested a group loan. Each member requests 14,000 Afghani to further their work and be a good client for Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. Mazoor ensures that they can repay the loan on time and he can lead the group. He would like to thank everybody who helps with this loan process in Afghanistan and other poor countries.

loans.use: To invest in making the businesses stronger

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase four cattle

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad A.'s main source of income comes from selling ready-to-wear clothes in her community. She is 57 years old, widowed and has seven adult children. She is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7000 pesos from HSPFI, which was used to to invest in expanding her business, Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Phaiy

texts.en: Phaiy S., 31, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a professional decorates handicrafts. Since 1999, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living and typically making US$2.5 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wears it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Her husband stays at home helping his wife. Phin Saroeun is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase silk and beads to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk and beads.

loans.name: Nancy Marleni

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 23 años de edad y vive con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío San Bernardino, distrito de Túcume, a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es costurera y se dedica a esta labor desde hace tres años. Aprendió el oficio con una cuñada y empezó a trabajar con una máquina de coser de pedal. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos: sus clientes le solicitan el servicio y le brindan el material que necesita para realizar su trabajo.

La máquina con la que trabaja tiene muchos años de antiguedad y está empezando a sufrir fallas. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de otra máquina de coser semi industrial. Así puede seguir trabajando y apoyando al sostenimiento de su familia. Su esposo es agricultor y juntos tratan se salir adelante y progresar.

Nancy planea instalar un pequeño taller en casa de sus padres para trabajar junto a sus hermanas que también son costureras; ella sueña con construir su casa propia y por ello trabaja todos los dias con ahínco.

Ella es muy conocida y estimada en la zona en donde vive, sus vecinos la consideran una joven responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old and lives with her husband and 2-year-old son in her parents' house in the San Bernardino hamlet, Túcume district, 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been a seamstress for the past 3 years. She learned this trade from her sister-in-law and began working using a treadle sewing machine. She does piece work: her customers request the service and supply the material needed for the job. The machine she works with is very old and is beginning to fall apart. This is the reason she is requesting funds for the first time from Edpyme Alternative. She needs 1000 new soles to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine. Thus she can continue to work and help support her family. Her husband is a farmer and together they do their best to get ahead and progress. Nancy plans to install a small workshop in her parents' home so that she can work together with her sisters, who are also seamstresses. She dreams with building her own home and this is why she works daily with great earnestness. She is well-known and liked in the area in which she lives; her neighbors consider her to be a hard-working and responsible young lady.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a semi-industrial sewing machine to improve her business.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Santos G. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en la cual vende pocos productos ya que ahora no tiene dinero para comprar mas mercaderia y poder surtirla mejor, pero esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mercaderia y asi tener varios productos para que sus clientes le compren todos los dias. 
Maria es una persona muy especial, tiene un buen caracter y sabe tratar muy bien a las personas.
Necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio y su hogar, esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que ella tiene ahora.
texts.en:
Maria Santos G. sells popular consumer products. She has a small mini market where she sells a few products. She does not now have the money to buy more merchandise and be able to better stock the store. She is asking for the loan to be able to buy merchandise. That way she will have various products that her customers buy everyday. Maria is a very special person. She has a good character, and she knows how to treat people very well. She needs the loan to be able to get ahead with her business and her home. This is the only source of income that she has now.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, rice, churros, eggs, toilet paper, batteries, locks, matches, wheat and corn flour, juice, tomato sauce, and pastas

loans.name: David D.'s Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of an Institution in Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo to seek a loan in order to supplement their monthly salaries. With a loan, they can buy or invest in something that they could otherwise have not been able to do with their salaries alone. But with a loan, some of these staff can pay school fees for their children; others will use it to buy a piece of land for the purpose of constructing a house in the future; some will use it to buy house building materials;  while others will use it to buy pieces of furniture or invest in a business. 
The leader of this team of borrowers is David, on the left, back row. David is a Revenue Collector at the office and has been working in this capacity for nine years. He is forty-eight years of age, married to teacher and they have three children and four foster children. Two of their children are in primary school and five are in senior secondary school. David will use his share of the loan to pay school fees and other school related charges for his children and foster children.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children and foster children

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita B. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Chita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Chita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a variety and food store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different food to customers in the local community. Chita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Chita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn S. lives in Daeum Rumdael village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she needs a loan to buy a water pump, gasoline, and pesticides to support her rice farming. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Sen San, is a palm juice collector. This couple has two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the other is employed at the Thai border. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy water pump, gasoline, and pesticides to support her rice farming

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia M. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Delia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta, tiene una pensión (tipo restaurante) en su domicilio, donde elabora almuerzos diariamente. Trabaja con una empleada (cocinera Ayudante) y con su hija.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la operación de su hija porque tiene un lunar en su nariz, que le molesta y no le deja trabajar.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Julieta has a restaurant in her home where she makes lunch every day. She works with an employee (assistant cook) and with her daughter. Her home is located in the Tembladerani zone in the city of Paz. The loan will be used for an operation for her daughter, who has a mole in her nose that bothers her a lot and keeps her from working. This is the 3rd time she has asked for a loan from Impro. Her loan history qualifies her as a good client in the payment of her bills.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for an operation for her daughter so that she can breathe better.

loans.name: Lesa

texts.en:
Lesa P. is from the village of Gingoog,  Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Lesa is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lesa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lesa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lesa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife, 35 years old, is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has three children with her husband Allan. Her children go to school and it’s a challenge for Marife and her husband to sustain their education. Involved in rice farming, she helps her husband maintain their farm. She makes sure that the farm is free of weeds and pests. Farming is not an easy job for her but she finds it comforting that she and her husband support each other no matter what.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haidar is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and 2 brothers. He has worked in construction since 2008 and has 4 years of previous experience. He helps his father and mother who also work to provide the family with income. He works on a freelance basis, taking housing projects and other projects such as building shops. After gaining a good reputation in this occupation, Haidar plans to expand his business services. That is why he has now requested a loan of $800 to purchase scaffolding to facilitate the pickup of construction supplies and to improve the liquidity of his business.

loans.use: To purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander G. is from the village of Brgy.4, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 48 years old. Alexander is single. To make a living, Alexander owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alexander joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alexander is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide more better service. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alexander from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide more better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to produce crafts and local enamels

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en: Suzy F. is currently in the business of importing rolls of cloth from Khartoum and selling them in Juba and is requesting a loan to stock more rolls of cloth to sell. Suzy is 44 years old and is married to an inspector in the labor office. She has seven children and only four go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more rolls of cloth to sell

loans.name: Complex Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Janet is a 46-year-old woman with four children.  Janet describes herself as a visionary.  For the past 4 years, Janet has operated a retail business selling eggs and clothing.  She will use the loan to buy crates of eggs and clothes.  Janet’s future goals include expanding her business and building a house for her family.  She would also like to help her children acquire higher education.  

Janet is currently the leader of the group called 'Complex'. The group has 14 female members.  The other group members are engaged in trades such as selling 'kente' cloth, a traditional Ghanaian cloth usually worn during traditional occasions. They may sell clothes or sell fish. They plan to use the loan to purchase various inventory items to grow their businesses

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothes and crates of eggs for resale

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun N. is 52 years old and is a villager who lives in Samna Khmau village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. N. Nut, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice on to earn their living. Mrs. Yun N. now is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for transport. This couple has six children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a car wash laborer, and one is a laborer at the Thai border while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Tierra Linda Group

texts.es: Doña Carmelita Elena Chutá G., tiene 52 años de edad con tres hijos, de los cuales  una esta a su cargo, se dedica al comercio de repuestos  de maquinas de conturar y de esa forma ha trabajado diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder incrementar el volumen  de ventas. Son 5  señoras  que conforman el grupo denominadas  Grupo “Tierra Linda”, las señoras se dedican a diversas actividades productivas  tales como, comercio, la crianza de animales, bordado de blusas. En el Canton Pahaj, Santa Lucía Utatlan, Sololá. Eperan onbtener mejores ganacias al adquiririr el prestamos con esta institucióin.
texts.en:
Doña Carmelita Elena Chutá G. is 52 years of age with three children, of which one is still in her care. She is dedicated to the sale of refurbished sewing machines and works in this business daily. She has organized a group jointly with other neighbors to be able to increase their sales volume. There are 5 ladies that form the group called "Pretty Land". The ladies are dedicated to diverse productive activities such as sales, the breeding of animals, and embroidering blouses in Canton Pahaj, Santa Lucía Utatlan, Sololá. They hope to obtain better profits after acquiring the loan from this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for various businesses, including selling sewing machines, animal breeding, and embroidery

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, es madre soltera, tiene 40 años y tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad. Doris tiene un restaurante este negocio lo realiza desde hace 20 años. 
La meta de Doris es que su hijo sea profesional y poder tener un recreo propio (restaurante con juegos, espacio para descansar, piscina, areas para hacer deporte).
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de insumos para el restaurante.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 40 years old and a single mother with a nine year old son. Doris manages a restaurant and has been in business for 20 years.

Her goals include seeing her son become a professional and opening her own recreation center (a restaurant with games, a space for relaxing, a swimming pool, and areas for playing sports).

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, rice, oil, sugar, and meat

loans.name: Marie Irène Ida

texts.fr:
femme de 48 ans, celibataire et mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varient entre 22 à 10 ans.Ayant quitter sa scolarite tôt par manque de soutien financier elle s'est lancé dans le commerce de vente des ustentils de plastiques,des sous vêtements,des bombons, biscuits en 1990 afin de palier à la crise financière et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.son revenu journalier vari de 15000frs à 20000frs.

avec ce prêt elle compte renforce son activiter en achetant des plastiques tel que des paniers, des cuvettes, des bassines, des bols,sceaux, des cucreries(bombons,biscuits kwik, biscuit telephonne, biscuit chocolat),des mèches(pony,afro,darling,x-pression, olive et des mèches angaise),des sous vêtements( slip,soutien) et bien d'autres choses.

sa strategie est de bien ranger son étalage afin de mieux attirer ses clients, le bon acceuil,et épargner du jour au jour.

 elle a pour vision d'avoir une grande boutique dans le  futur, s'acqueruir un terrain et mettre ses enfants dans des bonnes conditions.Elle est un bon exemple des femmes de son quartier.
texts.en:
This 48-year-old woman is a single mother of five children whose ages range from 10 to 22 years old. She had to quit school early on for lack of financial support. She started selling plastic cutlery, underwear, candy and cookies in 1990 in order to deal with the financial crisis and provide for the needs of her family. Her daily income varies from 15,000 to 20,000 francs. With this loan, she plans to boost her business by purchasing plastic items such as baskets, bowls, basins, bowls, buckets, as well as sweets (candy, cookies), hair extensions (pony, Afro, darling, x-pression, olive, English), underwear (slips, bras) and many other things.Her strategy is to set up an appealing display of her merchandise to attract customers, to give them a proper greeting, and to accumulate daily savings. For the future, she plans to open a big shop, get a piece of land, and provide good living conditions for her children. She is a good representation of the women in her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cutlery, plastic chairs and tables, etc.

loans.name: Kashenshero United, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
Hard-working, 35-year-old Peace N. has a dependable sense of purpose as regards anything to do with her 8-year-old agro-produce business. She has worked tooth and nail to keep her business, which trades in bananas from the Kashenshero trading center. On the sunny side, her strong work ethic has gotten her far, as her business currently generates 300,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.
 
With these modest earnings, she has been able to make the best of the bad bargains that have hit her business occasionally. She gleefully reveals how she is able to educate three out of her four children, who are undergoing different institutions of learning respectively with her small profits. 

With this loan, she envisions being financially empowered to buy more stock of bananas and further pay rent for the business shop as she looks at expansion into bigger markets and also to improve her household income from the sales of her business.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of bananas for resale

loans.name: Vida 2 Group

texts.en:
Felicita is the coordinator of her group, Vida 2 (life). She lives in a simple structure with her 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is raising her children. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying reading the bible.

Felicita is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost two years, starting with a loan from her sister. She plans to use this loan to invest in selling different products like cosmetics, beauty products, clothing and shoes. She will use the profits to invest and to buy school supplies that her children need to start school. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she need a loan to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities include a free trading zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products

loans.name: Ninda

texts.en:
Ninda E. is a 62-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a general store and an RTW business. She lives in Prk.Paraiso, Brgy. Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and RTW businesses, Ninda is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,500 PHP. Ninda is now borrowing 19,500 PHP to purchase more stock to sell in her General Store. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ninda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Hector Otoniel

texts.es:
Héctor Otoniel A.
Héctor es de 65 años de edad, casado, tiene tres hijos varones y una mujer, es oficinista, actualmente es Tramitador de Empelados Municipales, en la actividad lleva ocho años de experiencia, solicita su cuarto crédito para remodelación de su vivienda y la mejora del mismo como el bienestar de su familia en general, los préstamos anteriores los pago sin problemas de atraso.
texts.en:
Héctor Otoniel A.
Héctor is 65 years old, married (his wife works at an office), and has three sons.  Héctor currently works as the Clerk for Municipal Employees, and has eight years of experience in that job.  He is requesting his fourth loan so that he can remodel his home and thus improve his family’s general welfare.  Héctor paid back his previous loans without ever falling behind in his payments.

loans.use: Remodeling his home

loans.name: Violet Lukwa

texts.en:
Violet Lukwa L. is a hardworking lady of 39 years married to Titus Amako Omuse. Together they have five children aged 16 years, 15 years, 13 years, 11 years and 9 years. She has been selling vegetables and fruits for the past eight years and she earns a monthly income of Kshs. 4,000. They live in Eldoret, Kenya.

When she learned about KADET LTD and had no history with any other MFI, she immediately applied for her first loan of Kshs. 10,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to purchase vegetables and fruits. She plans to use the profits to expand her business.

Violet hopes to grow her business and see their children realize their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny vive en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos de 15,13,11 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. Fanny confecciona almohadas  con el apoyo de su esposo y las comercializa en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto.  Vive en la casa de su madre con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos.
El crédito será utilizado en la compra de telas y otros insumos que requiere para continuar con su negocio, el cual aprendió de su madre.

 Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in the 16 de Julio area of the city of El Alto. She is married and has four children who are 15, 13, 11, and 5, respectively. She and her family live in her mother’s house. Fanny makes pillows with the help of her husband and sells them at the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used for the purchase of fabrics and other supplies that she needs to continue with her business, a trade that she learned from her mother. This is her second loan from IMPRO and first through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other supplies for her pillow making business.

loans.name: Central Bo Road Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Central Bo Road” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Isatu F. K. is the leader of this group. The approximately 35-year-old is a widow and has six children, two of whom are still attending schools. Isatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells palm oil, rice, beans, fish, oranges, etc. With the help of this loan, Isatu is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, beans, fish, oranges, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 42 year old married man living in Nabatieh with his wife and child. Ali works selling fruits and vegetables in his van, travelling from one town to another. His clients wait for him every day; they know his time to pass by so they expect him every day. His clients say that the quality he sells is perfect and that’s why they wait for him from every day. Ali has 18 years of experience in this field; he’s requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to renew his van, because it’s his essential source for living. He hopes to open a big market for selling fruits and vegetables in the future.

loans.use: To renew his van.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. lives in the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by raising pigs, which she fattens before taking to market. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns about 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Irene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for 5,000 PHP which which she will use to buy livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first issued to her by ASKI, and she plans to use it to continue expanding her business.  

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años, estado civil casada, realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja más de 01 años con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su préstamo inicial  fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio venta al por menor de animales caseros.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar  cuatro unidades de ovejas y tres kilos de lanas.

Paralelamente, la señora también confecciona enaguas (ropa interior), también vende leña.  Su esposo trabaja como registrador civil en el municipio de  Mucumayo.

Su sueño en el negocio es tener una empresa de tejidos.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las capacitaciones..
texts.en:
Maritza, 28, is a member of the “Las Huancheñas” communal bank located in Huancané district, Huancané province, Puno department.  She is married and finished secondary school.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year.  Her initial loan was for 500 new soles that she used in her small domestic animal business.

She is now asking for a 1500 new sol loan to buy four sheep and three kilograms of wool.

As a side occupation she also manufactures enaguas (underskirts) and she also sells firewood.  Her husband works as a Registrar for the municipality of Mucumayo.

Her dream is to have a textile firm.

What she likes about her communal bank are the meetings and the training sessions.

loans.use: To buy four sheep and three kilograms of wool.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.ar:
امين في عمر 51 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في توزيع الخبز والكعك له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب ان يتطور وان يزيد
من مدخوله له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساهم القرض الاول في زيادة مدخوله ودعم مصلحته وقد كان يلقى
الدعم الكامل من عائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء معلبات وتوزيعها لزيادة المدخول
اوضاعه المادية لم تكن مستقرة لأنه يلقى منافسة في عمله ولكنه يلقى دعم من محيطه العملي حيث ان زبائنه
هم من محيطه وجيرانه واصدقائه
texts.en: Ameen is a 51-year-old husband and father of two who is greatly supported by his family. Ameen has a decade of experience working in bread and pastry distribution. Although his financiA. situation has not been entirely stable because of the stiff competition, he has found great support among his friends and neighbors, who make up his customer base. He is eager to further develop his business to increase revenues. Ameen enjoys a good credit history with A. Majmoua, and his last loan was very helpful. He is now looking for another loan to purchase canned goods to add to his inventory.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. is from the village of Calube. She is 50 years old. Elsa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she sells dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Elsa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Riziki Mpya Group

texts.fr: Chibalonza M.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Riziki Mpya, âgée de 30 ans, divorcée, mère de 2 enfants respectivement âgés de 12 et 6 ans. Elle vit actuellement seule pour des raisons intimes.  Chibalonza M.  est  vendeuse de souliers usagers (ketch).  Elle s’installe au long de la rue.  Elle a commence son business de son fonds propre de valeur de 50$ issu des revenus de la commission de vente de souliers dans laquelle, elle aurait facilité la transaction. Plus tard, elle  bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Il ya 13 ans qu’elle est en action. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (35 paires de souliers).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, voir ses enfants  étudier confortablement et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. La cliente Chibalonza M.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Riziki Mpya est constitué de 24 membres.
texts.en:
Chibalonza M. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the Riziki Mpya group. She is 30 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children, aged 12 and 6. She currently lives alone for personal reasons. Chibalonza M. sells used shoes, called "ketch", after finding a spot along the street.

She started her business with her own funds, 50$, that she got from commissions on shoe sales transactions she facilitated. Later on, she benefited from a $50 loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Hekima. She's been running her business for 13 years, and she will use her loan to get new supplies (35 pairs of shoes).

She ambitions to expand her business, see her children study comfortably, and buy them a land lot. Chibalonza M. thanks Hekima for its actions targeting poor women who do not get access to loans from regular banks. The Riziki Mpya counts 24 members.

loans.use: To buy 35 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Edgar Juvenal

texts.es:
Edgar C. de 27 años, está casado y tiene una hija 2 años. Trabaja  en servicio de transporte de personas en una moto. Anteriormente laboraba en una fábrica  de atún y quiso independizarse para tener sus propios ingresos. 

En la actualidad labora de lunes a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la  noche. Unas de sus dificultades es en época invernal las calles se destruyen por lo que hace un poco defectuosa la transportación de personas en el sector. 
 
Su esposa realiza el comercio de la pesca ya que la familia de ella son comerciantes de pesca en la parroquia. Con el préstamo va a hacer arreglar su tricimoto. Sus metas es poder mejorar su vivienda y brindarle la mejor educación a su hija
texts.en:
Edgar C. is 27 years old, married, and has a 2 year-old daughter.  He works providing a passenger transport service with his motorbike.  He used to work in a tuna factory but wanted to work for himself and make his own income.
