Edgar currently works from Monday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  One of the difficulties he has during the winter is that the streets get damaged which negatively affects the transportation of passengers in the area. 

Edgar's wife sells fish since her family are fish sellers in the area.  Edgar will use his loan to fix his 'tricimoto' (a motorbike with a cabin in the back for transporting passengers).  His goals are to improve his home and to provide his daughter with the best education possible.

loans.use: To fix his motorbike

loans.name: Mrs. Lina Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen people who will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Lina is the village bank president and she has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1982. She owns a general store in the local village where she earns some profit in order to support her family.  She is also a pig breeder. Since her business is going well from time-to-time, she wants to expand. Therefore, in order to improve this business, Mrs. Lina is seeking a loan to buy more piglets. Her husband, Mr. Mut, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where he grows rice, which he does not sell, to support his family. This couple supports three children, one of whom is enrolled in a local public school, but the others are too small to work or study.

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Diody

texts.en:
Diody L. is from the village of San Ramon. He is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Diody owns and operates a business providing motorcycle and tricycle transport services to local community members. Diody has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Diody joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diody is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Diody from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn is the group leader, as selected by the four members of a group loan. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standards of living. 

Mrs. Chorn was born in 1957. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. She is a widow with three children. One of the children is a grocery seller who gets a low salary, while the other one is a stave maker. The third is still studying in local public school. 

Now Mrs. Chorn has a problem because one of her children is going to be married. She needs some money to support the costs of the wedding. To improve this condition, Mrs. Chorn is asking for a loan to pay for her child’s wedding.

loans.use: To pay for her child’s wedding.

loans.name: Naema

texts.en: Naema S. is a 53-year-old married woman. She started a home business selling clothes and accessories four years ago to support her family. In these four years, she has managed to improve the quality of her products. She now wants to have her own shop, since she believes that she can compete in the market in her area by depending on word of mouth and the good reputation she has gained. She applied for a loan to purchase more products so she can have the her own store in the future.

loans.use: to have her own shop for clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia. Her daughter goes to a kindergarten, while her husband, who works in a mining company, earns a monthly salary of 650,000 MNT.

Narantsetseg manages a clothing-trading business in a rented stall at a trading center, and has gained much experience since starting the enterprise in 2007. She is very adept at collecting and purchasing stylish and quality products for her business, so her customers are happy to patronize her stall. She also offers barter trading for local residents in order to make her business more accessible.

A hardworking lady who says, "One will succeed if she has a positive attitude," Narantsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import products from China to sell in the coming summer. She is planning to buy a house and a car with her business profits.

loans.use: to import clothing products from China.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, vive solo y se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y sandalias, tiene 5 años en dedicarse a este negocio, a tiempo completo durante todos los días de la semana.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones y zapatos, pues quiere incrementar el negocio y sus ganancias, su única alternativa es a través del financiamiento.
Sueña con algún día tener su propia casa y formar su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 29 years old.  He is single and lives on his own.  His business is selling clothes, shoes and sandals.  He has been in this business for five years and works full time hours, every day of the week.

Wilfredo is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, pants and shoes as he would like to increase his business and his profits.  His only option is to use loans.

Wilfredo dreams of some day owning his own home and starting a family.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants and shoes

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is 44 years old, married, and has five children. One child is married and lives outside the family home, two are security guards, and two attend school. They live along National Road Number Two, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Their income is from her husband’s business and her children’s salaries. Sophea stays at home and does housework. Sophea’s husband is a mason; he hopes to supplement his income by driving a tuk tuk (motorcycle-based) taxi.  She is requesting for a loan of $500 to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Kouame

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 27ans et père d’1 enfant, Kouame est technicien de profession. Il veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses famille c’est pour cela il a ajouté à son activité principale en 2008 la vente des articles scolaires. Ce premier prêt qu’il sollicite lui servira à acheter plus de marchandises pour répondre à la demande. Sa femme est revendeuse. Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé et la revente dans sa boutique dans un quartier de la place.
texts.en: Kouame is 27 years old, with one child, and is a technician by trade. He would like to ensure a bright future for his family and so began to sell school supplies in 2008. This is the first loan that he has sought and he will use it to purchase more goods to meet growing customer demand. His wife also sells goods at retail for a living. Kouame sources his goods from Lomé and sells them from his shop in his town quarter.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Bebie Elena

texts.en:
Bebie Elena is 48 years old. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. 
 
Bebie Elena owns a mini restaurant that caters food like different meats and rice for an affordable price. She had this business for 1 year. She  has requested a loan to buy more ingredients and utensils for the business.

Bebie Elena has been a member of HSPFI for this year, 2011. In the future, Bebie Elena hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the menu.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.en:
Juma, who is in his early 20s, is married.  He has been running a genge (fruits and vegetables) business for two years now.  He works from 5am to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to buy more fruits and vegetables for him to sell. His dream is to one day buy land.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Amani" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil paints, fabric, and general supplies to be able to make his works of art.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has five children. They are all enrolled in  school. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. 

The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Chan doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So Chan is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Chan is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 39 years old She is married and has four children ages 22, 20, 13 and 3 years old. Rosita established a retail business 19 years ago. Aside from the store, she sells charcoal in the nearby town. Rosita is well known as a very loving and supportive mother of four children.

Rosita is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snack foods, drinks, spices and other daily needs. Rosita dreams that someday she can renovate their house to be comfortable and she can save money for her children to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cereals, coffee, milk and drinks for her store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming. She has been farming for over five years. She is 31 years old, married, and a mother of three school-going children.

She is applying for her second loan. She plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 23 years old married with one child aged two years, living in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. He has been in a butchery business for three years and this has facilitated him in paying school fees for his young brother. He faces a challenge of meat going bad due to poor preservation methods and his dream is a modern butcher shop that has all facilities. John needs the loan to buy cows for slaughtering in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée mère de trois enfants.Elle tient une librairie dans laquelle elle vend des journeaux, des revues.Elle offre aussi à ses clients des services en bureautiques et traitement de texte.Son activité lui permet d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en soutenant son mari.Elle sollicite un pret de 200000F pour acheter des cahiers, des stylos , des livres afin de préparer les ouvertures de classes de l'année scolaire 2011/2012.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married woman and mother of three children. She runs a bookstore where she sells newspapers, magazines, etc. She also offers secretarial and word processing services to her customers. This activity allows her to improve her family’s living conditions, and to help her husband. 

She is seeking a loan of 200,000F to purchase notebooks, pens, and books to stock up in time for the start of the 2011-2012 school year.

loans.use: to buy office and school supplies for resale

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 45-year-old married man with seven children living in a permanent residential house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a family goal of educating his children up to university. He has a wholesale shop dealing in general merchandise, which he has been operating for the last 15 years. He is faced with a challenge of limited funds to meet the demand and his dream is to own a warehouse. William needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa tiene 61 años y vive en un Barrio fuera de San Pedro Sula. Ella y su esposo Porfirio, llevan 40 años de casados. Don Porfirio es electricista. La pareja tienen cuatro hijos mayores de 43, 40, 38, y 37 años. Actualmente uno de los hijos vive en su casa. 

María Luisa siempre le encantó cocinar. Siempre le gustó hacer tamales. Hace diez años, empezó a vender tamales de su casa. Su familia le impulsó a comenzar debido a su talento como cocinera. Ella hace los tamales a diario y también los hace por encargo de cantidades grandes. Con las ganancias del negocio a logrado un aumento en los ingresos familiares. Una de las dificultades que enfrenta María Luisa es el transporte. La pareja no cuentan con vehículo propio, así que para salir de la aldea y entregar pedidos, tienen que utilizar el autobús. 

A través de 8 prestamos anteriores, María Luisa ha logrado crecer su negocio y su clientela. Este préstamo de L4,500 le va a ayudar a seguir aumentando sus ventas. Lo va a utilizar para la compra de 2 quintales de maíz, ollas, y platos
texts.en:
María Luisa, age 61, lives in a neighborhood outside of San Pedro Sula.  She and her husband, Porfirio, have been married for forty years.  Porfirio is an electrician.  The couple has four grown children; ages 43, 40, 38, and 37.  One of their children lives in their house.

María Luisa has always loved to cook.  She has always liked making tamales.  Ten years ago she started to sell tamales at her house.  Her family urged her to start because of her talent as a cook.  She makes the tamales every day, and she also makes large quantities by order.  With the earnings from the business she has managed to increase the family income.

One of the difficulties facing María Luisa is the transportation.  The pair does not have their own vehicle.  In order to leave the village and deliver orders they have to take the bus.

Through eight previous loans María Luisa has managed to make her business and her customer base grow.  This loan for 4,000 lempiras will help her to continue increasing her sales.  She will use the loan to buy two “quintales” (one quintal is about 100 lbs.) of corn, pots, and dishes.

loans.use: to buy two “quintales” (a quintal is about 100 lbs.) of corn, pots, and dishes.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 57 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. She has a sewing business from which she earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase more sewing materials. 

Marina has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials

loans.name: Gayceli

texts.es: Gayceli, de 32 años, es una mujer noble. Vive en compañía de Juan, su esposo desde hace 4 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Jean Pier al que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Chambará. Su principal objetivo, es mejorar su casa. Pues ya tiene un hijo a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Su esposo trabaja en el gobierno de su localidad, ahí se encargo de los pagos de impuestos y rentas de los pobladores. Recibe un sueldo mensual por ello. Pero como Gayceli, es una mujer responsable, siembra en los terrenos que heredó; papa, maíz, cebada y trigo. Los cuales vende en la feria de Chupaca los días sábados. Además con su esfuerzo pudo abrir una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su zona. Por el momento le va muy bien, tiene la seguridad de que con esfuerzo seguirá concretando sus objetivos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Gayceli, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado; en mejorar la infraestructura de sus habitaciones, pues está realizado con material sencillo a base de tierra.
texts.en:
Gayceli, 32, is an honest woman. She lives with Juan, her husband of 4 years. They have one son, Juan Pier, who they care for in their own home, located in the Chambará hamlet. Her main goal is to improve her house. She wants to provide her son with a better quality of life. 

Her husband works in the local government. He takes care of tax payments and inhabitants’ rent, for which he receives a monthly salary. 

As for Gayceli, she is a responsible woman. She plants potatos, corn, barley, and wheat in the land that she inherited. She sells the crops in the market in Chupaca on Saturdays.  

Through her effort, she was able to open a grocery store, where she sells basic necessities to the residents of the area. Everything is going well for her at the moment; she has the security that with effort, she will continue realizing her goals. 

This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she hopes to fulfill her plans through this collaboration. She commits to carrying out the payment of her loans. In addition, she is pleased to be a part of the association because the members are responsible and united. Upon receiving the support, Gayceli will invest the money requested in improving the infrastructure of her home, which is made with simple, earth based materials.

loans.use: improve the infrastructure of her home using quality materials

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
En la  Ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron un grupo de mujeres con el fin de conocer más sobre los beneficios ofrecidos por la Fundación Paraguaya, el cual les resulto una buena oportunidad, es por eso que decidieron formar el comité, el cual lleva por nombre Virgen del Carmen, ellas han asumido el compromiso de mantener el grupo juntas, siempre bajo un marco de respeto  mutuo. Ellas actualmente se encuentran en el Quinto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata, comenta que siempre tiene mucha variedad, por lo que atrae a más clientes. Dice que gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelannte y de esa forma ayudar a todos sus familiares.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de anillos, pulseras, cadenas y demás tipos de joyas, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, a group of women met with the objective of finding out more about the benefits offered by our institution and they considered it to be a good opportunity. They decided to create their Communal Bank and they called it Virgen del Carmen. They have committed themselves to keep their group together, always treating each other with respect. Currently they are on their fifth cycle of the institution’s Entrepreneurial Women Program. 
Maria is one of the group members. She sells silver jewelry and says she always has several different products, hence attracting more customers. She says that thanks to this work she has been able to get through in life and help all her relatives. 
She is asking for this loan to purchase rings, chains and other jewelry in order to stock her business and supply her customers’ demand.

loans.use: Comprar anillos, pulseras, cadenas y demás tipos de joyas

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora lucia cuenta con 32 años de edad, está casada con el señor Ulises quien es campesino, tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales todos estudian, el mayor cursa tercer año de prepa, 2 más primero y segundo año de secundaria y tercero y quinto año de primaria, tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva un año y medio.
Dice que inicio con este pequeño negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y mejorar un poco su economía, para poder gozar de una muy buena calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercancía como son: huevos, frijoles, refrescos, leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, etc. Para así tener un mejor surtido.
Ella está convencida que uno de sus más grandes sueños se podrá cumplir, ya que es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local más amplio, para poner una abarrotería y así tenerlo bien surtido, con una amplia variedad de productos, para así incrementar y mejorar sus ingresos.
Doña lucí (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) dice que está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que le están brindando, pero sobre todo por la confianza.
texts.en:
Lucia is 32 years old. She married to Ulises who is a farm worker. They have five school-age children. The oldest is in the third year of preparatory school. The next two are in their first and second year of secondary school. The youngest children are in their third and fifth years of primary school. Lucia has had a grocery store for a year and a half.
She says that she started this small business because she wanted to find a way to support her husband with the household expenses and to improve their economic situation in order to enjoy a good quality of life. The loan that she received was invested in the purchase of more merchandise like eggs, beans, soft drinks, milk, oil, rice, sugar, etc. This merchandise will give her a better selection. 
She is convinced that one her biggest dreams that she will be able to achieve is to make her business grow a lot more. She wants to build a larger building for her grocery store in order to have a good selection and greater variety of products. With this plan, she can increase and improve her profits.
 Lucí (how she is known in her community) says that she is very grateful for the kiva lenders, for the support that they are offering and more than anything for the confidence.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of more merchandise like eggs, beans, soft drinks, milk, oil, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is 24 years old. He married a short time ago and lives now with his wife Nargiz and parents in the village Iremadzeebi, West Georgia. Jemal works as a truck driver in the village. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the family's agricultural activities. They have 0.8 hectare land, where citruses and vegetables are grown. Also they have 8 milk cows. Jemal’s mother makes traditional Georgian cheese. Both the cheese and the harvested crops are sold locally to retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Jemal requested credit for purchasing 2 additional milk cows. The family will produce and sell more cheese and their income will grow. With the increased income, Jemal’s family will be able to improve their living conditions, purchase more necessary household goods.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Orlith

texts.es: Orlith, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y de campo, además de empeñosa y amable. Convive con  Eglin, quien es agricultor, tienen cuatro hijos pero ya son independientes. Juntos habitan a lado de su nieto de 15 años de edad en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Orlith, es la agricultura, contando para eso con un terreno de 8 hectáreas del cual se posesionó hace 20 años, pero solo dos hectáreas cultiva mandarinas, naranjas y yuca. Una vez cosechado éstos productos son vendidos en los mercados más cercanos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite mantener a su familia, como también comenta le gusta la vida de campo, donde se siente más tranquila, ya que aprendió de esa vida gracias a sus padres, quienes también eran agricultores. Por otro lado manifiesta sus deseos de seguir creciendo e incursionar paralelamente en otro negocio que sería el de una bodega contando para eso con una casa. Este seria el préstamo número 15 con la institución MFP, está agradecida de contar con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su actividad. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus miembros y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su terreno en la contratación de personas para la cosecha que tiene de su producción de yucas.
texts.en: Orlith is 60 years old.  She is a hard-working woman from a rural area and is also earnest and friendly.  She lives with Eglin who is a farmer.  They have four children, but they are now independent.  Together, they live next to their 15 year old grandson who lives in his own house.  Orlith is a farmer; she has a plot of land of 8 hectares which she took possession of 20 years ago.  But only on two hectares does she grow tangerines, oranges, and cassava.  Once harvested these products are sold at the nearest markets.  What she likes about her work is that it allows her to support her family.  She also says she likes life in the country where she feels calmer.  She learned about this life thanks to her parents who were also farmers.  On the other hand, she expresses desires to continue to grow and to make inroads in another business which would be to have a grocery store in her home.  This will be loan number 15 with the MFP institution. She is grateful to have financial support to expand her business.  She also says she is happy with her communal bank because she knows the majority of its members and she considers them to be responsible and supportive people.  With the amount requested of 3000 nuevos soles she will invest in her land in the contracting of people for the harvesting of her yucca crop.

loans.use: to contract laborers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 42 años, convive con Adrián de 41 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. María, tiene la clave del éxito, posee una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que es muy concurrida, ya que supo valorar y tratar bien a su clientela. A pesar de que María no tuvo estudios, ella sabe que su mejor cualidad es la de vender, además de la paciencia que tiene a sus clientes. Por otro lado el precio de sus productos están al alcance de la economía de sus asiduos compradores. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia a veces su esposo e hijos la apoyan en el negocio, y son quienes lo animan mucho a seguir con el trabajo. Lo único que la aqueja es la competencia por lo que debe siempre procurar llenar su tienda y buscar nuevas formas ed venta. En un futuro próximo desea implementar mejor su tienda con productos novedosos. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ella está entusiasmada con seguir trabajando con su banco comunal por que son puntuales. Con los 2.500 nuevos soles, comprará nuevos productos para el expendio de su bodega.
texts.en: María is 42 years old and married to Adrián, 41. They live in their own home in the district of Pichari. María has the key to success: she has a grocery store that is heavily visited because she values and treats her customers well. Despite not having a formal education, she knows her biggest strength is salesmanship, as well as patience for her customers. Furthermore, her prices are affordable to her regular customers. She generally works on her own, but sometimes her husband and children help her with the business; they are her biggest motivation to keep working. Her only challenge is the competition, so she always must keep her store stocked and looks for new ways to sell products. In the near future she wants to introduce new products to her store. This will be her second loan with Kiva partner MPF, and she promises to make her payments on time. She is enthusiastic to continue working with her community bank because it is punctual. With the loan, she plans to purchase new products to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Lusita

texts.en:
Lusita is 59 years old, and she is a single mother of eight! All of her children have since moved out of the house, but they take with them the many lessons that their mother Lusita taught them.

When she left her parents house many years ago, Lusita dedicated herself to selling goods near the major streets in Guayaquil. In the past she also worked in a restaurant for the Ecuadorian Navy, but when they closed their doors, she moved her business to her home. It hasn’t been easy for Ms. C.. Her husband left her to raise all eight children, so she had to find part time work outside the home to bring in enough income for the family. Lusita wants to raise $585 so that she can purchase more diverse products like briefcases and bags for businesspeople and consumer items like umbrellas and car accessories.


Mifex offers our clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Lusita wants to raise $585 so that she can purchase more diverse products like briefcases and bags for businesspeople and consumer items like umbrellas and car accessories.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: M. Suleyman is low-income person,living in Baku. He started his business in 2001 with his own small capital. He is married, has two children. In 2007 he plans to borrow $1000 from Normicro Baku branch, with funding from KIVA, to increase his business goods.

loans.use: To increase business goods

loans.name: Sopo

texts.en: Sopo is married with four children.  She and her husband tend a small vegetable patch near their house to earn a living.  She joined the SPBD microfinance program with the hope of improving her vegetable gardening business by purchasing better farming tools, fertilizers, chemicals and more seeds.  She believes that by improving the production of her farm she will be able to sell at least three days a week in the market.  She is confident that with a little loan she can improve their farm and their lives as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements, fertilizers, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Estefani Carina

texts.es:
Estefani is a very enterprising and active woman; she is married and comes from the Apodaca region in the state of Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a factory worker, however, the salary he receives is very low and insufficient to cover all the expenses of his home; before the necessity of an extra income, Estefani began with the sale of cosmetics via catalogue, where she has been saving since the year she started.

Now in order to give a push to her business so it can grow, Estefani asks a loan of $475 that she will use in the purchase of merchandise in order to supply the orders of her clients and to improve her service; she offers to pay back the amount in six months. Today you can help who needs it the most; decide to help Estefani; thank you very much for your contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Estefani es una mujer muy emprendedora y muy activa es casada y originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en el estado de Nuevo León. Su esposo es obrero en una fábrica, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, Estefani comenzó con las ventas de cosméticos por catálogo, donde ha estado mejorando desde hace un año que empezó.

Ahora para darle un impulso a su negocio y pode crecer, Estefani solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y mejorar su servicio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a Estefani, muchas gracias por tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (to fill client orders).  Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Francisco has a grocery store which he opened 4 years ago. Currently her wife helps him since she joined efforts with him after loosing her job. Besides his grocery store, Francisco also sells fish by peddling in the mornings.

Credit use

He needs the credit in order to purchase more merchandise at wholesale prices and to purchase a freezer. The freezer he currently owns is now not large enough to keep all the fish he sells.

Personal Information

He is 32 years old and his 2 children go to school. His house is made of cement, but a part of it has not been finished. His main goal is to save to be able to finish his house and guarantee an education for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Descripción del Negocio

Don Francisco tiene una despensa que la comenzó hace cuatro años, en la actualidad su esposa le ayuda pues después de quedar desempleada aunó esfuerzos para sacar adelante el negocio. Además de la despensa el también vende pescado de forma ambulante en las mañanas.

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería a precio de mayorista y para poder comprar un congelador y así poder guardar el pescado que el vende pues el que tiene actualmente no le abastece.

Información Personal

El tiene 32 años y 2 hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento pero aun le falta una parte por terminar. Su meta principal es ahorrar para así poder terminar su casa y asegurar la educación de sus hijos

loans.use: Investing in merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Faataape

texts.en: Faataape is a 60 year old mother. She also has 7 delightful grandchildren. She has lived in Vaovai all her life with husband and her children. Faataape's family has lived on a plantation for their main source of income. For many years, they have been doing  arduous work including cleaning, weeding, and trying to clear the area. She used to buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, as well as many other products. Unfortunately, they have had hard times and still continue to take their time when cleaning a small area. This is Faataape's second loan. She will also spend time buying supplies for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet’s business is located in an old charcoal corral. In these shantytowns, everyone uses charcoal. It is interesting how charcoal is made. It is not mined, it is made. Trees are cut in the forests, and an open pit is dug and a smoldering fire is started in it. Banana leaves are placed over the fire and the logs from the trees--which have now been chopped into small pieces--are thrown into the pit. Banana leaves cover the logs, and dirt is placed over everything. It is important not to suffocate the smoldering fire. Three days later, all is dug up and the chopped up pieces of tree are now blackened charcoal. 
Charcoal is sold by the cup. Most people can only afford enough charcoal for one day, so they regularly visit charcoal sellers each day and buy a couple cups. Annet also sells produce, such as cabbage, matooke, tomatoes, peppers and eggplant. Annet is 25 years old and married with two children. She also cares for two orphans. Her dream is to be able to educate her children build a home. She is requesting a loan of $550 so she can buy more charcoal and matooke stock.

loans.use: Too buy more bags of charcoal and to stock more matooke.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Sharif G. is 44 years old, finished high school, married, has five children. Sharif lives in the village Obi-Keek, in the Hurossonskiy district and in the last 10 years has been raising and fattening cattle for sale. Until now he never took out a loan, since he didn't think anyone would loan him money. Sharif is planning to use the loan money to buy more cattle for fattening and sale. Every 40-45 days he will sell the bulls and use the money to pay back the loan, purchase the calves and family needs. With time he is hoping to save enough money and use it to expand his business. The client is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Гаффуров Шариф, возраст – 44 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Шариф, житель кишлака Оби-Киик, Хуроссонского района в течение уже 10 лет занимается разведением и продажей домашнего скота. До этого никогда не получал кредитов, так как не верил, что ему могут дать деньги в кредит. Поэтому Шариф планирует на полученные денежные средства прироберсти крупный рогатый скот для откормки и продажи. Через каждые 40-45 дней он хочет продавать скот и вырученные деньги направлять на погашение кредита, приобретение молодняка, а прибыль использовать для личных нужд. Со временем он хочет скопить свой собственный капитал и использовать его на расшиерение своего бизнеса. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of cattle for fattening and sale

loans.name: Sulaymon

texts.ru:
Sulaymon D., 47, is married and has 4 children. He owns a small food store. Sulaymon has been in business for 8 years. He plans to use this loan to increase the assortment of goods sold in his store. Sulaymon plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Дустов Сулаймон, возраст – 47 лет, образование среднее, по специальности – товровед, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Сулаймон имеет небольшой магазин по продаже продуктов питания. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 8 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на увелечение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Получив кредит, Сулаймон увеличит ассортимент продаваемого товара и местные жители будут иметь возможность приобретать у него необходимые продукты питания. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods sold

loans.name: Juana Esther

texts.es:
Miss Juana belongs to the communal bank "Las Hormiguitas," located in Yarinacocha, Ucayali in Peru. She is a 43-year-old single woman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S./300, she decided to invest in selling food and beverages.

Currently, she relies on a restaurant where she sells typical foods of the region. To do this, she gets up very early to go to the market and buy supplies that she needs for preparing her meals. She spends the afternoons working in the restaurant.

With this loan for $425, which she will repay in four months, she will make the first payment towards a motorized cycle as well as buy a sack of rice, oil, condiments and eggs.

Juana is very grateful for the help that Manuela Ramos provides her. It has helped her a lot in achieving her various goals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Hormiguitas, ubicado en el Jr. Roberto Ruiz Vargas Mz. P Lt. 32, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en la venta de comidas y bebidas. En la actualidad cuenta con un restaurante de venta de comidas típicas de la región, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los víveres que le harán falta para la preparación de sus comidas y en las tardes atiende su restaurante. Con el préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la inicial para la compra de un motocarro y en 1 saco de arroz, aceite, condimentos y huevos. Juana se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo que Manuela Ramos le brinda, le ayuda bastante a lograr varios objetivos.

loans.use: For the down payment on a three-wheeled motorbike, and the purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: De Cristal Group

texts.en:
Slightly timid, but sure of their reasons for being here, the women of De CristA. gather for their first loan from Friendship Bridge. Gradually they open up, sharing their goals and hopes for the future. With a variety of businesses, the women are bound by the common goA. of providing a better life for their children and grandchildren.

Three women prepare breakfast and lunch from their homes, serving plates of beans, eggs, and tortillas, as well as tamales and rice. They will invest their loan in the ingredients to prepare these meals, as well as more plates that will allow them to serve more people at one time.

Five women raise animals. They will invest their loan in feed for their cows, pigs, and chickens. One of the five women is also planning on buying a calf that she will use to make milk and cheese.

Two women are weavers, specializing in "huipiles," the traditionA. Mayan blouse, as well as skirts like the ones you see in the picture. They will use their loan to purchase thread in bulk, something they’ve never been able to do before. Until now, they had to travel to the market and purchase just enough thread for a single blouse, which meant they had to pay retail price and spend a lot of time traveling.

Two women rent small plots of land where they grow corn and milpa, the leaves used to wrap tamales. They will invest their loan in seed and fertilizer, and to pay the rent on their land. These women provide the milpa for the other women in the group who sell tamales.

After only a couple meetings, the women already know they love being a part of their village bank. They say it is a support group that allows them to laugh and joke around while learning to improve their businesses and better provide for their families. The twelve women are asking for a group loan of 17,100 quetzales, about $2250 USD. They will pay this back over the next nine months.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food preparation, feed for animals, a calf, thread, and seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Miranda

texts.es:
Mrs. Miranda U. E. is a member of the “All United” Communal Bank. She lives in the province of San Martin, Picota district. Encouraged by her mother-in-law and the experience that she had in this type of work, as well as the need to have her own income to contribute to the household economy, she decided to start selling breads of different varieties, as well as sweets. She has been doing this for the past year, and her products are requested by her neighbors for their good quality and hygiene. With the loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid over 6 months, Miranda will buy sacks of flour and sugar, eggs, liters of oil, packets of butter, and other ingredients for the preparation of a variety of breads and sweets which she carefully makes with the help of her husband and mother-in-law. She is 26 years old, lives with her husband and two children, and currently she feels more secure and independent, capable of making her own decisions. In the future she would like to have her own space where she can open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Miranda U. E. ,es socia del Banco Comunal “Todas Unidas”, vive en la región San Martín provincia y distrito de Picota motivada por su suegra y la experiencia que tenía en este tipo de trabajo y la necesidad de tener sus propios ingresos para ayudar en la economía del hogar decidió dedicarse a la venta de panes en sus diferentes variedades y dulces, desde hace 01 año, sus productos son muy solicitados por los moradores por la buena calidad e higiene. Con el crédito de S/.800.00 será pagado en 6 meses comprará harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en javas, aceite en litros, mantequilla en paquetes y otros para la preparación de variados panes y dulces que los prepara con mucho esmero con el apoyo de su esposo y suegra. Ella tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, actualmente se siente mas segura, independiente, capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones, desea en un futuro tener un local propia para poner un restaurante.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for the preparation of her breads

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra B., wife of Mr. M., is a mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Azra’s son is 14 years old and her daughter is 10 years old. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Her husband runs a grocery shop, and she would like to apply for a loan to expand into a bigger grocery store.

Her loan group includes: Rashida B., who wants to purchase and sell tape recorders; Bashiran B., who wants to buy horse; Sharifan B. who wants to start a milk business; and Balqees B., who wants to buy buffalo. This is loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Shahnoza is 21 years old, not married. After graduating from school she has not worked anywhere and stayed at home because there were not positions open anywhere where she could work. To have some kind of additional income Shahnoza has been drying fresh apricots during the season for the past three years. The technology is simple and does not require any hard labor. In the early mornings the apricots are collected into boxes and after being burned in sulfur are lied on the sun to dry. After a couple of days the seeds are taken out and the fruit is dried more. The ready made dry apricots are then collected into sacks and then sold closer to autumn when the price for them is higher. The profits from this business helps support the family. This year Shahnoza decided to get a loan to buy more apricots.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шахнозе 21 год, она незамужем. После окончания школы она нигде не работает и сидит дома, так как нету места где можно было бы устроиться на работу. Чтобы иметь хоть какой нибудь дополнительный доход Шахноза уже третий год в сезон сушки абрикосов покупает свежие абрикосы и сушит их. Технология простая и не требует особых затрат труда. Рано утром абрикосы собираются в ящики и после обкуривания серой выкладываются на солнце. через день-два из них выжимаются косточки и потом снова сушатся. Готовые высушенные абрикосы закладываются в мешки и потом ближе к осени когда цена на них вырастает их можно продавать. Полученный таким образом доход помогает содержать семью. В этом году Шахноза решила обратиться за займом, чтобы закупить больше абрикосов.

loans.use: To buy fresh apricots

loans.name: Mrs. Hang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Hang (ID: 11030026), aged 34, is an active and energetic woman. As her husband is a blue-collar worker overseas, Ms. Hang takes care of everything at home from raising her two young children to doing the farming works, breeding poultries (pigs and chickens). She once took out a loan from Vietnam Bank of Agriculture and Rural Development and fully paid it back. Mrs. Hang then learned about SEDA and its paying-back method, which really interest her. She has asked for a loan of 3.186.000 VND to purchase more food for her chickens.

Other members of her group include:

- Mrs. N. Thi Dan (ID: 11030027) would like to borrow a loan of 3.186.000 VND to purchase goods for her shop in the market.

- Mr. T. Dinh Duyen (ID: 11030028) would like to borrow a loan of 3.186.000 VND to purchase fishes.

- Mrs. N. Thi Hien (ID: 11030029) would like to borrow a loan of 3.186.000 VND to purchase pigs.

- Mrs. N. Thi Ngoc (ID: 11030034) would like to borrow a loan of 3.186.000 to purchase woods for her carpentry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng (MS: 11030026), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị là người rất năng động, tháo vát. Chồng chị đi xuất khẩu lao động ở nước ngoài nên mọi việc nhà đều do chị đảm nhiệm. Chị không chỉ chăm sóc hai con nhỏ mà còn làm ruộng cấy lúa, chăn nuôi lợn thịt và nuôi gà đẻ trứng.Trước đây chị đã vay vốn của ngân hàng nông nghiệp phát triển nông thôn và đã trả hết. Nay rất thích hình thức tiết kiệm để hoàn trả của chương trình nên chị đã tham gia vay 3.186.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua cám gà.

Trong nhóm chị còn có:

  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Dần (MS: 11030027), vay 3.186.000 VND để buôn bán hàng ở chợ.
  • Anh Trần Đình Duyệt (MS: 11030028), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua cá thả.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 11030029), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua lợn giống.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc (MS: 11030034), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua gỗ phát triển nghề mộc.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi và buôn bán

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with four children, aged 22, 20, 17 and 10. She own and runs a small general store where she works everyday. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business expansion.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan A. is a 23-year-old and very passionate man who raises calves for meat production. He lives with his parents who are retired now. He thanks his parents who taught him from a very young age how to look after, raise, and sell calves. He finished high school and decided to engage in livestock activity and follow his father.

As calf-breeding is the only source of income in his family, he tries very hard to keep his economic situation stable, but every day it is getting harder and harder as prices for fodder increase. He needs additional animals to stabilize the situation and provide normal conditions for his elderly parents.

Ruslan`s dream is to marry and have two children who will enter university. But now he has to look after his parents and work hard for the future.

To help him to approach his dream, he needs first to expand his business and for this purpose he has applied for 1000 USD. We hope that your support will help him approach his dream much faster!

loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: AIDA S. est une femme restauratrice mariée .Elle gére un restaurant dans un des quartiers de mbour depuis plusieurs années.Son activité marche bien ,la demande  est tres forte .Pour satisfére cette demande et moderniser le restaurant elle sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
Aida S. is married and is in the food service business. She has managed a little restaurant in a neighborhood in Mbour for several years. Her business is going well, with lots of customers. She is asking for a loan to satisfy her customer demand and modernize her restaurant.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1998. Chị Nguyễn Thị Huế 34 tuổi, mặc dù tuổi đời con trẻ nhưng chị laị rất ham làm kinh tế, tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vào buôn bán nhỏ, các vòng vốn đều được gia đình chị sử dụng hiệu quả thu nhập từ buôn bán gia đình chị đều tích lũy, kết hợp với vay vốn các vòng tiếp theo gia đình chị đã mở được một cửa hàng tạp hóa với đa dạng mặt hàng, ngoài ra gia đình chị còn bán thêm các thiết bị điện dân dụng, chị có 2 con hiện các con chị đang trong độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Huế is 34 years old, she is a TYM fund member since 1998. Despite her young age she is an ambitious entrepreneur. Initially she used her loan from TYM to start a small retail business selling stuff. Later rounds of loans were used effectively, from a small business she now owns a grocery store that offers a lot of products. Beside the grocery , her family also sells electric appliances. Mrs Huế has 2 children who are school aged. This time she is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 to invest in her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Ami

texts.en:
Ami D. is 38 years old and a married mother of three children. Two of her children go to primary school. One of her children is still too young to attend, but will start next year. Ami lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.

To provide for her family, Ami sells liters of gas to taxi and taxi-moto drivers. She buys large quantities of gas, which is stored in the large black cistern in this photo. She distributes it in one-liter bottles with a funnel, pictured in front of the cistern. With this loan from Kiva, Ami hopes to refill the cistern so she can continue selling gas to her customers. Ami appreciates this opportunity from Kiva to improve her family’s quality of life and the ability to send her youngest child to school next year.

loans.use: Buy large quantities of gas to sell

loans.name: Domenica

texts.en:
Domenica is a member of the Señor de Luren Village Bank. She is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their 12-year-old son. Domenica buys firewood from producers who deliver it to her home, then she re-sells the wood from her home. She is also a member of a women’s group that knits sweaters, puppets, and cushions for export.

Domenica needs a loan of 750 soles, which she will use to buy different colors of wool to knit with. Domenica’s dreams are to build her own home and to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Domenica es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren. Domenica es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo de 12 años, Domenica vende leña en su casa, que compra de los productores que le llevan a su casa. Además Domenica integra una asociación de mujeres que hacen tejidos de chompas, títeres, cojines, productos que envían al extranjero.

Domenica necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana de diferentes colores. Los sueños de Domenica son construir su casa y tener una bodega.

loans.use: Buy different colors of wool for knitting

loans.name: Mrs. Sovanna Tien Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of eleven people and is located in Trapeang Saom village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sovanna T. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. Mrs. Sovanna T. is 29 years old and the mother of two children. The eldest attends school and the youngest is only two. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at better price. Her business is going well, so she is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase her income. Her husband, Mr. Pon Reasmey, is a farmer who owns 2-hectars where he  cultivates rice. 

Two members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The two clients are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To puchase more rice and expand rice business

loans.name: Florepes

texts.en: Mrs. Florepes C., 38, married and lives in Lumbayao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 5 children. Her husband is a mere laborer. In order to help her husband, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) last April 2004. She availed loan for PHP3,000 and used it as initial capital for her “sari-sari” store (small grocery store). She was able to manage the business successfully; in fact, it became the source of their daily consumption needs and also for allowances of her elementary children in school. Now, she applies for PHP14,900 to buy piglets and feeds for her duck. She ventures into this new business to have also additional source of income. Someday, she plans to buy RTW’s (Ready to wear) products from Cebu. She will be happy enough if she sees all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy piglet & feeds for duck raising

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey K., 38, lives in the Siem Reap province with her husband and two young children. She makes about US$2.50 daily, selling wood and growing rice, while her husband helps her with planting the rice. She is asking for a loan in the amount of US$500 to purchase more wood. She is also hoping to purchase a pig to raise and sell with the money from the loan. She sees this loan as a great opportunity to expand her business and is confident that she will see her income increase as a result.

loans.use: To purchase wood to sell.

loans.name: Aotoa

texts.en: Aotoa M., 50, is married with nine children.  She has seven years of experience in the Chinese cookies and pancake baking business. She sells to the public and villagers five days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 145 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Aotoa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and a frying pan

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Since 2004, Charlotte A. has worked as a trader in Elmina, selling goods such as biscuits, Kalypo (fruit beverage) and drinks. Charlotte has received a junior high school education. She is married and has three children.  She is responsible for paying to support her husband in paying school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more drinks, biscuits, etc., for resale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save money to acquire land for farming.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, biscuits, etc., for resale

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: BABACAR S. EST NE EN 1964 A DIAMAKA COUNDA .IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE TROIS ENFANTS.IL EST MAITRE CORANIQUE ET POUR AMELIORER SES REVENUS ,il fait du petit commerce.SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER DES MARCHANDISES VERS ROSSO ET LES REVEND A SES CLIENTS CONSTITUES DE SES VOISINS.
texts.en:
Boubacar S. was born in 1964 in Diamaka Counda. He is married and the father of 3 children. He teaches the Koran and also does some petty trading to increase his income. His business is buying merchandise in Rosso and re-selling it to his customers, made up of neighbors.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of various items

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Jiguisseme est  constitué de quatre femmes mariées toutes monogames ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 2 enfants et  habitant à Bougoula hameau, une des communes rurales  de  Sikasso  (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur  cinquième   collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de  satisfaire le besoin croissant des  clients et d’accroitre leurs revenus. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de condiments alimentaires, de haricot et bien d’autres céréales.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  40 colis de condiments alimentaires et 50 sacs  de 100 kg de céréales . Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, et dans les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place, à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et en détail.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’éducation et  la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Jiguisseme ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes.
texts.en:
This Jiguisseme group is made up of four married women, all monogamous, with an average age of 35 and on average two children. They live in Bougoula hamlet, one of the rural communities of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They are on their 5th loan through the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, so as to satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers and increase their income. All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. They have varied businesses, among others selling condiments, dried beans, and various other cereals.

With this loan, they intend to buy 40 containers of condiments and 50 sacks of 100 kg of cereals. They stock up at the big open-air market of the town of Sikasso and in the surrounding villages. The merchandise is sold at the Sikasso city market right where they live, out of their homes, and door-to-door to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash, retail.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 19,000 F CFA of which part will be used for the health and education of their children and the rest reinvested into their businesses or used to reimburse the loan. The ambition of the women of this Jiguisseme group is to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments and cereals for resale

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en el Jr. La Libertad S/Nº, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años, 04 hijos, que están estudiando y dependen de ella.

Lidia, es una mujer muy joven, se siente capaz de seguir adelante y trabajar hasta donde Dios le de fuerzas, se siente muy bien con lo que hace, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, que ofrece en el Mercado Municipal de San Hilarión y sus ventas le van muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Esta muy contenta con lo que hace y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. 

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su puesto de mercado a comprar todo lo necesario que la ama de casa necesita, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa que la caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando racimos de plátanos, naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y verduras en diferentes variedades para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y que encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Se siente una mujer luchadora, y contenta por haber cumplido algunas metas que tenia trazada en su vida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar en su negocio y la ayuda que brinda a muchas mujeres que quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to the El Triunfo Community Bank. She lives at Jr. La Libertad S/Nº, San Hilarión district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 41, married, and has four dependent children who go to school. Lidia is a very young woman. She feels capable of getting ahead and working as long as God gives her strength. She feels very good about what she does. She sells fruit and vegetable in the Mercado Municipal of San Hilarión. Her sales are going very well; she is well known by her customers. She is very happy with what she does, and she has the support of her children. She currently has a loyal customer base that goes every day to her stand in the market to buy everything that a housewife needs. She personally waits on them with her characteristic smile. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she wants to buy bunches of bananas, oranges, mandarins, lemons, citron, golden apples, and different varieties of vegetables. She wants to buy these items to give her customers better attention and provide what they need. She is a fighter, and she is happy that she has met some of the goals she has planned for her life. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her set up her business and for the help they offer many women who want to develop themselves on a personal and on a business level.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits like bunches of bananas, oranges, lemons, and various vegetables

loans.name: Bello

texts.en: O. is 44 years old and married with five children. She lives in Lagos State Nigeria. She is into laundry services and has been selling drinks for over 20 years. O. has been with LAPO Microfinance for one year. She is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more drinks and a laundry machine. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a laundry machine & drinks

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: El señor Pascual vive con su esposa la señora María y juntos son un matrimonio estable; tienen una tiendita de abarrotes de nombre “Abarrotes Mary” con una antigüedad de 15 años establecido, son personas muy constantes, trabajadoras y que se proponen lograr sus objetivos; están solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía para su negocio y así cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pascual lives with his wife María and they have a stable marriage together; they have a small grocery store named "Abarrotes Mary" which has been in establishment for 15 years. They are very hardworking and persevering people that are intent on achieving their goals; they are requesting this loan in order to buy more merchandise for their business and thereby meet the needs of their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Levi Saleimoa.  She is married with 12 school-aged children.   Gloria owns and operates a business raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Gloria has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.

In 2006, Gloria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  Gloria is now requesting a new loan of 3000 WST for the same purpose.  The loan will be her fourth loan from Kiva partner SPBD.  Gloria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Ghullam Aly Group

texts.en:
Ghullam Alay   is the group leader of Ghullam Alay group. There are four members in this group. All of them want to receive money for their business.
Masodan and G. Khanam want to take a loan for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Also Norya wants take a loan for her business of embroidery. She wants to take necessary materials for her business. And Ghullam Alay   
Wants to take a loan for his business of carpenter. He wants to complete her stock. They want to thank form the loan of 56000 Afghani.
With this loan they can make larger their business. And support their families and make a better future for themselves and there families in future and thanks the all lenders of AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: they are make larger their business

loans.name: Olaga Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y madre de 1 hija, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Pueblo Libre de Ilave.

La señora Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con un préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de lana sintética de colores para la elaboración de artesanías, como fajas, fajillas, trencillas, etc.

Su deseo es obtener mayor capital para agrandar su negocio.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Viviana is a member of the "24 de Junio" Community Bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, Province of El Collao, Puno State. She is 30 years old, has a daughter and lives with her partner. She finished High School and lives in the Pueblo Libre de Ilave neighborhood.

Mrs. Viviana started working with Manuela Ramos association, with an initial loan of 500 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase of wool and synthetic colors for the making of handicrafts, such as belts, corset, braids, etc.

Her desire is to obtain more capital to grow her business. She likes the terms of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una carismática mujer de 36 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos: Esteban de 11 y Katherin de 10 años, hace pocas semanas nació el bebé que esperaba, así que está muy contenta. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la preparación y venta de jugos de fruta, pero al haber quedado embarazada y con el reposo recomendado por los médicos, tuvo que dejar de lado esta actividad, dedicándose por completo a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que no requiere mucho esfuerzo, además sus clientas van hasta su casa a ver las novedades que ella ofrece en los catálogos que tiene de reconocidas empresas de cosméticos. Juana quiere ofrecerle lo mejor a su recién nacida, es por ello que piensa seguir trabajando sin descuidarla. 
Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un grupo solidario y se lleva muy bien con sus compañeras, además que todas son muy puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, pues quiere aumentar sus ventas para generar mayores ingresos económicos para su hogar.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
T. Lê Thị is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đông 1 (1).

T. is married and has three adult children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 Vietnamese dong a month from these activities.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by T. from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Hoàng Thị M. is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Lê Thị N. is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

3. Lê D. Dị is a 50-year-old male who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. Lê D. S. is a 34-year-old male who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5. Vũ Thị H. is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

========================================

T. Lê Thị (20209010006) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đông 1 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thực phẩm chiên trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các D.ch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Hoàng Thị M.  (20209010007) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Lê Thị N. (20209010008) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


3.  Lê D. Dị (20209010009) là 50 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Lê D. S. (20209010010) là 34 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Vũ Thị H. (20209010011) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các D.ch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên D.ch. .  Do việc biên D.ch thủ công các D. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary-ann S. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis, Occidental. She is 27 years old, single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary-ann owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Mary-ann has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mary-ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Mary-ann is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 
-----------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Flor Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora  FLOR ROSMERY Q. B. tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia tiene estudios hasta 6º de primaria, no logró estudiar secundaria porque no tenia el apoyo de su familia, la cual estaba sumergida en la pobreza, puesto que la socia es natural de la ciudad de Quiruvilca, ahí se dedicaba al cuidado y crianza de animales, los cuales los vendía vivos en el mercado de su pueblo, actualmente tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 13 años; los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Flor se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como: arroz, gaseosas, jugos, galletas, aceite, papel higiénico, pastas dentales, cepillos, etc, en la tienda de su casa.. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró dos pequeñas vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.  Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará una vitrina más grande en la que podrá mostrar sus productos mas grandes, al igual que pronto comprará algunos juguetes para vender por navidad. 
Flor sueña con tener un minimercado en su casa, en el cual pueda vender variedad de productos.
texts.en:
FLOR ROSMERY Q. B., 39, lives in the FLORENCIA DE MORA district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She finished sixth grade but was unable to go to secondary school because her family, which was plunged in poverty, couldn't afford it. Since she is originally from Quiruvilca, she was engaged in the care and raising of farm animals, which she would then sell live in her town's market. She has two children, 10 and 13 years old, who depend upon her financially. Flor sells food items like: rice, soft-drinks, juices, crackers, oil, toilet paper, toothpaste, brushes, etc. in a store set up in her home. With her first 300 sol loan she bought two small display cases to exhibit her wares.
