With this 800 new sol loan she will buy a larger display case in which to exhibit her larger items as well as some toys to sell during the Christmas season. Flor dreams with having a minimart in her home from which to sell a wide variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display case, rice, soft-drinks, juices, crackers, oil, toilet paper,  toothpaste, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
Gbassay is a petty trader married also to a petty trader with three dependents, one of whom is their son. She trades in cutlery, plastic rubbers, and enamel dishes. After dropping out during senior secondary school some fourteen years ago, she has been in business. She usually travels to a neighbouring country (Guinea) to purchase her stock.

Gbassay intends to use the profit from the loan she is seeking to buy more stock, rent a bigger store to stock her goods and to help her husband to purchase land.

loans.use: To buy cutlery and  plastics rubbers

loans.name: Geoffrey Maina

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 31 years old and married to Rachael. He was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. Geoffrey has no loan history with any other MFIs. 

He has been selling Irish potatoes for the past seven years. He is planning to purchase more stock of Irish potatoes as the season has high demand for the product. He intends to purchase a pick-up to transport potatoes from farms and eventually buy a piece of land with the profit he is expecting from his business (as a result of this loan). His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and create employment for other people. Geoffrey is very enterprising and determined.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia A. is from the village of Paglaum, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Namizzi Central Farmer's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
G. Peter is 30 years old and married with six children aged 12 to 2 years. He also takes care of his mother.

Peter is a businessman dealing in the sale of molasses that is used to distill alcohol. He says that his business is good except for the scarcity of limited raw materials hence making them expensive.

Peter has been in business for four years and he is able to make 50,000/= as profits a week and this is also mainly attributed to his good customer care and the high quality of his raw materials.

Peter’s business goal is to be able to buy more sugarcane for his business as well as educating his children for a brighter future. He needs a loan to be able to increase his business capital to buy more molasses.

loans.use: To buy more molasses to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tubers of yam

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. Khom K. is 25 years old. She lives in Kampong Pou Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectare of land on which she grows rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Se Segn, is a fisherman. 

They have some problems with their farm because their soil is infertile, but they do not have enough money to fix it. Thus, to improve the condition of their rice farm, Mrs. Khom K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy fuel and pesticide. 

She is the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the others are too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a petty trader. She sells yams, clothes, and shoes to make a living. She hopes to be a major foodstuffs distributor in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 30,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She is married to a bricklayer and they are blessed with 2 children. Anna’s children are schooling and they are excelling in their school work. She hopes to see her children graduate from the university in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.en:
Ibolya is a single mother who raises her daughter herself. She works hard to ensure a decent livelihood for her small family. Ibolya started her small business ten years ago when the used clothing sales business was only getting started in Ukraine. Even today, there is still little competition at the market where she sells her inventories. This business is her family's only income.
Ibolya has used business loans before and finds them very helpful. This time she is requesting a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase the variety of items she offers. She hopes to restock her kiosk and make more profit.

loans.use: To increase the variety of items she sells

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesús

texts.es: Magdalena D. Jesús R. D.
texts.en:
Magdalena D. Jesús R. D. Ángel, 32 years of age, lives in Cuscatlán with her husband, a farmer, and two children ages 11 and 9 who are in school. Magdalena has a general store where she sells basic necessities. She has developed an excellent customer base, since hers is the only store in the area. Likewise, she sells staple grains that are harvested by her husband. Magdalena is requesting a loan to buy more products, in particular those that are in most demand by her customers. With Integral’s loan, she harbors the hope that she can increase her store’s sales and therefore generate more income to help her proviD. for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic necessities.

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is widowed and has one daughter and two sons who attend school. She sells small, dried fish, 'mandazi', a Kenyan pastry, and brown sugar wholesale from her home. With the Ksh. 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase more brown sugar and fish. The greatest challenge to her business is that the small fish business is seasonal. She rents her house and has no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, rent and food. 

Scola decided to work with Yehu to improve her standard of living and hopes to someday have a shop from where she can operate her business.

loans.use: Fish and brown sugar

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria run her personal business in Lagos, she is into buying and selling of groceries and drugs to costumers at retail prices. She has been managing the business for the past 10 years now. With the proceeds from the business she could take care of her family financial needs. 

32 years old Victoria is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a civil servant and they live together in Lagos. She is happy about her business and she wish to expand it in future. She hopes for the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more groceries and drugs to sell as this will attracts discount, improve sales and increase her profit. This she said will be reinvest into the business and sponsor her children education. She expresses her thanks to all.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drugs to sell

loans.name: Heredon Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Hérèdon (cinq femmes mariées dont deux dans des familles polygames) ont en moyenne 28 ans, 4 enfants et résident toutes dans le quartier N’gola  de Fakola l’une des Sous préfecture de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et font toutes la restauration sauf Chata Koné, un des membres du groupe qui excelle plutôt dans la vente de pâtes d’arachides. Elles achète les grains d’arachides et la transforme en pâtes.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé le premier. 
Chata Koné compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 100kgs de grains d’arachides auprès des grossistes au marché de Fakola. Chata effectue sa vente en ambulant dans les quartiers, à domicile et au marché de Fakola, à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes qui achètent au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Chata, à l’instar des autres membres du groupe, espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7900FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille en condiments. 
Les femmes du groupe (majoritairement des restauratrices) ont pour ambition d’acheter  chacune un réfrigérateur pour produire de la glace et les jus de fruits.
texts.en:
The women of the Heredon loan group ( five married women including two women of polygamous families) are an average of 24 years of age, with two children. They live in the N'gola neighborhood of Fakola, a sub-district of Sikasso, the third administrative region in Mali. They know each other as neighbors and are all in the restaurant business with the exception of Chata Koné, who is a group member who excells at the sale of peanut butter. She buys bulks peanuts and prepares the peanut butter paste herself. To increase their operating capital and provide a greater variety of goods to sell, theydecided to become associated with Soro Yiriwaso with who they are now taking out their second group loan, having duly repaid their first loan. Chata Koné plans to use the loan to buy 100 kgs of peanuts from the wholesalers in Fakola. Chata hawks her product in the neighborhood around Fakola, to a clientel made up generally of women, who buy for cash or occasionally credit. Chata hopes to earn an average monthly income of 7900 francs CFA and like the other members of the group, will use the income to make her loan payments and meet the basic needs of her family. The women of the group who are in the restaurant business each want to purchase a refrigerator to make ice and to store fruit drinks.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Nom's Group

texts.en: Four people, located in Srae Vong village in Takeo province, make up a group loan. Mrs. Nom P. is a group leader, selected by the other members. Each member will use a small portion of the loan for their individual purposes. Mrs. Nom P. is 52 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Chhun Chhay, are farmers who own two-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice to sell to support their family. Right now they have a problem because their field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Nom P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. The couple supports three children: one is a laborer, one is a construction worker and the other is a student in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca Flor tiene 66 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona que tiene un movimiento comercial moderado, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la venta de golosinas, ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante todos los dias por la tarde y por la noche en el parque infantil de la ciudad. El negocio goza de buena acogida ya que este lugar es bastante frecuentado por los pobladores de la ciudad que acuden diariamente para recrear a sus menores hijos y pasar juntos un buen momento. Esta actividad le provee de algunos ingresos que utiliza en ayudar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Blanca Flor desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más dulces, de modo que sus ventas puedan aumentar y que perciba mayor numero de ganancias, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Blanca Flor es una mujer hacendosa y que siempre se ha esforzado por sacar a sus hijos adelante. Actualmente todos ellos ya se han independizado y ello la llena de orgullo. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Blanca Flor, age 66, is married and lives with her husband in the city of Lambayeque. It is an area that has moderate commercial movement. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For six years she has been selling sweets. She sells as a street vendor everyday in the afternoon and evenings in the Parque Infantil (Children’s Park) in the city. The business is well-received. This is because it is a place that many people in the city go to entertain their young children and have a good time together. This activity provides income that she uses to help her husband support her family. Blanca Flor wishes to expand her business by purchasing more sweets. Then her sales can increase and she can get more sales. That is why she is asking, for the first time, Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 500 PEN to help her meet her objective. Blanca Flor is a hard-working woman who has always put forth effort to get her children ahead. All of her children are now independent, and that fills her with pride. The neighbors and acquaintances who live in her neighborhood consider her to be a level headed and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets to increase her itinerant sales business

loans.name: Mess Road Group

texts.en:
Mamusu K. sells bread. She was born in Makeni city, 38 years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a businessman and four of her children are attending schools. She has been selling bread for 12 years now. With the help of this loan, she will buy bags of flour, sugar, etc., in order to produce a larger quantity of bread. 

Mamusu (on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. They are members of the “Mess Road Group" from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. These small business owners have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, sugar, etc., to make bread

loans.name: Unidos Para Progresar 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maxima is the coordinator of her group Unidos para Progresar 1 & 2 (Progressing Together). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 4 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to improve her house.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying being with her family.

Maxima is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 7 years, starting when she learned how to sew. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she makes and sells curtains, sheets, quilts, tablecloths, and she will buy fabric, needles, thread and others. She will use the profits to improve her home, by changing some wood and having a floor. She wants to be successful in her business and with God's will and her Esperanza Loan, she will do it.
 
This Esperanza associate's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. The rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffer from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles and thread

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Multan, a city in Pakistan famous for its history and warm weather.  She is an uneducated woman who couldn’t attend school due to her family’s poor financial condition. She spent lots of time with her mother when she was young, and helped her cook food and handle domestic chores.  

Azra learned how to manage a household efficiently from her mother, a very patient lady who knew how to control and meet expenses. She learned patience from her mother, and now she handles her own expenses as her mother would have, but the circumstances have entirely changed due to inflation and other economic conditions. She still tries to manage things, though it is very difficult. Azra’s husband, N., respects her for this wonderful habit.  

N. has a shawl-selling business, which he purchased in his native city of Multan. He purchases the shawls cheaply and sells them for a good profit. His earnings help Azra to meet the financial expenses of the family. Azra has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband, which he will use to buy shawls in bulk and expand his business. She hopes that purchasing shawls in bulk will help him to reduce his travelling expenses and improve his earnings, and allow him to save something for a rainy day.

loans.use: to purchase shawls for reselling

loans.name: Matha Esthefania

texts.es:
Martha de 22 años, vende ropa para ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Es madre soltera, ella y su bebe viven en una zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas.

Su mama tenia un negocio de ropa y decidió ayudarla para que Martha tuviera su propio negocio y pueda mantener a su hijo. Ahora realiza su trabajo sola, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones, zapatos etc. Mientas que ella sale a vender ropa su hermana le cuida a su bebe.   

Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa y zapatos. En el futuro quiere incrementar su clientela, y así darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Martha, 22, sells clothes to help with household expenses. She is a single mother. She and her baby live in a periurban area with unpaved streets and houses built on hillsides. Her mother had a clothing business and decided to help her so that Martha would have her own business and be able to support her son. She now works alone selling blouses, shirts, pants, shoes, etc. When she is out selling her sister babysits her son. She wants the loan to buy clothes and shoes. In the future she’d like to enlarge her customer base thus providing her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita O. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three businesses: grinding peanuts, selling peanuts and running a general store. She lives in Purok 7, Barangay Bantayan, which is a part of Kabankalan City in the Negros Occidental province of the Visayas islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her three businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9000 PHP.

Nenita is now borrowing 10,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her general store and maintain her peanut grinder. This will be her fifteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 6000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nenita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store and maintain her peanut grinder

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es: Eddy tiene 44 años su actividad es venta de cerdos, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, el es un hombre muy tranquilo y la mayoría de sus clientes conocen muy bien su negocio, el se siente muy contento pues les brinda un excelente servicio. Inicio hace más de 11 años con ciertas dificultades como es la falta de transporte para trasladar los cerdos hasta su hogar, por lo que él tiene que buscarlo anticipadamente. Este financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos por lo que tiene una buena demanda de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en: Eddy is 44 years old and his activity is selling pigs. This is not the first time that he has taken out a loan. He is a very calm man and most of his customers know his business very well. He is very content because he gives them excellent service. He started more than 11 years ago with certain difficulties such as the lack of transportation to move the pigs to his house. Because of this, he has to arrange it ahead of time. This loan is to buy pigs since he has good demand from his customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two daughters, who are 11 and 13 years old. She is a market vendor who owns two vending locations in two different markets of Ivano-Frankivsk: Central marketplace and Novgorodskyi market. Ludmila runs a teenage clothing sales business. She launched her venture eight years ago through lending assistance for start-ups. Currently, her monthly income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas.

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to purchase 100 sweaters, 50 body shirts, 50 pants and 50 jackets to re-stock her merchandise. Her business is the main source of income for the family. Ludmila is planning to continue expanding her trade and to open a new vending location in the future. Profits generated will be used to finish construction of her private house which is still in process.

loans.use: To purchase 100 sweaters, 50 body shirts, 50 pants and 50 jackets

loans.name: Rolando Javier

texts.es: El Sr.Rolando S. es un hombre muy trabajador lleva 16 años laborando en la empresa de servicios electricos empezo como ayudante y ahora tecnico en la empresa su jefe lo aprecia mucho y lo recomienda ampliamente argumento que ha base de esfuerzo y dedicacion a conseguido lo que actualmente tiene. El requiere el credito para ampliar su vivienda desea hacer su sala y recibidos mas grande para comodidad de el y de su familia siempre se ha comprometida con ella y quiere lo mejor mejorando su patrimonio que es lo que el le puede dejar.
texts.en: Mr Ronaldo S. is a very hard-working man.  He has worked as an assistant in an electric utility company for 16 years and now he is a technician in the company.  His boss values him very much and recommends him to everybody.  He argues that through effort and dedication he has obtained all that he currently has.  He needs this loan to extend his home.  He wants to make his living room and entrance hall bigger for his family's comfort as he has always promised to do.  He wants to improve his estate as it is what he can leave his family.

loans.use: To extend the front of his house, building a room

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con tres hijos. La señora tiene grado de instrucción de secundaria completa.
Blanca viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de ropas.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar la mercadería  de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es ampliar su negocio. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the “San Salvador” Communal Bank, located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 45, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She has a high school education. 

Blanca has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten years. Her initial loan was for 300.00 Peruvian nuevos soles, money that she invested in her clothes selling business. She is now requesting a loan for 2000.00 Peruvian nuevos soles, a loan that will allow her to increase the merchandise in her business. 
 
Her dream is to grow her business. What she likes best about her communal bank is the comeradery.

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cookies and candies.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip K. is 62 years old, married and supports a family of eight. His wife has no income so he is the sole provider. Phillip runs a retail shop in Kapsoo Trading Centre 10 km from Kabarnet town. From this business, he gets a monthly profit of Kshs 4,000.

Phillip has borrowed a loan of Kshs 10,000 and he intends to use the entire amount to restock his business. He also anticipates using the profits to expand his business. His dream and hope is to open a wholesale shop and buy land for his family.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Martha Petrona

texts.es: Martha Petrona se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos. Pues siempre le ha gustado ser una joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora.  Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Ella tiene a su hija de 7 años que depende de ella, que con su esfuerzo ha logrado obtener este medio de vida que las mantiene. Todos los días se tiene que levantar temprano para realizar su trabajo y proporcionar el alimento diario.
texts.en:
Martha Petrona sells dairy products. She has always enjoyed being an enterprising and hardworking young woman. This is not the first time she has received financing for her business.

Martha has a seven year old daughter who is dependent on her. Through her efforts she is able to make a living so that she can support herself. Every day she wakes up early so that she can complete her work and provide for her daily needs.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Taturmor Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you members of the “Taturmor” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Memuna T. is the leader of this group. Memuna is thirty-eight-year-old, married with five children – two in primary school and three in secondary school. Memuna sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been doing this business for ten years now. With the help of this loan, Memuna will invest in her business by buying ready-to-wear-clothes and shoes to add to her business.  

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mohamed L. Tarawalie handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: Buys ready-to-wear-clothes and shoes to add to her business.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia T., 57, is from the village of Talinga and is a group member of PMPC. She is married and has two children. To make a living, Lucresia owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store in the local community. Her customers are neighbors and people in the nearby Barangays.

In 2007, Lucresia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to add to her capital. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. Lucresia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products.

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Francis Kahura

texts.en:
Francis has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He is 60 years old, married to Hannah Wanjeri, and they have five children.

Francis was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fifth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for labour.

In the future, Francis hopes to venture into dairy farming to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for labour

loans.name: Sukiasyan (Shisha House)

texts.en: N. has a big Arabian cafe-restaurant “ARABICA” in Yerevan that she started in 2010. She sells Arabian cocktails, coffee, nargiles (hookah pipes) and so on. Now she wants to enlarge her business and to increase her product assortment. She also wants to purchase some nargiles from Syria. N. and her husband are both economists. Their children are very involved in the family business.

loans.use: increase her product variety

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa M. has been a market woman for six years now, working at the market of Jukwa near Abura. She sells provisions like corn, salt and plantains as you can see in the picture. Plantain is used for lots of different dishes is Ghana and one can prepare it in a lot of different ways. 

Yaa is a widow and has four children to take care of. She is hoping for a loan to be able to invest into her business and see it grow. She would like to purchase larger quantities of goods and thus sell more. Education for her children is the highest priority and to ensure this privilege for her children she works hard.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of the goods she sells.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina Y. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 41 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Gina owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling green bananas and coconuts for copras in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Gina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina M. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 60 years old. Josefina is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish, like sardines & milk fish, in the local community. She also buys and sells coconuts & bananas. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts & bananas. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts & bananas.

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Apelie

texts.en: Apelie M. is 24 years old. She is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She will use her loan to stock more alcohol. She is married to a businessman and they have two children, only one of whom goes to school. Her future goal is to build a terminal house.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina E. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 59 years old. Marcelina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase soft drinks, rice and corn grits for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marcelina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, rice and corn grits for sale

loans.name: Wakilaré Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité wakilaré est créé le 31/05/2007.Il est composé de 17 femmes habitant le même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe de par voisinage et par affinité .leur principale activité est le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou est responsable du groupe ,elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.elle a en charge aussi de 02 autres enfants .

Elle a un petit commerce de tissus (thioub et wax);sacs à main.Comme activité secondaire elle vend de l'encens .Elle possède une cantine au marché de son quartier.Elle capitalise 07 années d'expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus, de l'encens,et sacs à main.

Elle a comme objectif de diversifier sa marchandise en y ajoutant des bijoux .Elle soutient aussi son mari dans la prise en charge de la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Wakilaré solidarity group was created on May 31, 2007. It consists of 17 women who live in the same neighborhood. They created their group based on affinity and proximity. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs. Aissatou is the group leader. She is married and the mother of four children. She also looks after two other children who were entrusted in her care.
She has a small business selling fabrics (thioub and wax) and handbags. As a sideline, she also sells incense. She has a canteen at the local market. She has seven years of experience.

This loan will help her to buy fabrics, incense, and handbags. Her goal is to diversify her merchandise by adding jewelry. 

She also supports her husband with respect to the children’s food and tuition.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, incense and handbags for resale

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is married with two children. She is 33 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. Anita sells "banana cue" to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of Php 7000 and the purpose of this loan is to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to increase her savings for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal.

loans.name: Marcialisa

texts.en:
Marcialisa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Marcialisa is a livestock farmer. She has been doing this for nine years. Marcialisa has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Marcialisa is requesting a loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and supplies

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 39 year old mother who is blessed with 3 school age children. Annie is a farmer working in the Philippines. She earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Annie is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Annie grows root crops and has been doing it for almost 8 years.

In the future, Annie hopes to increase their crop yields in order to earn more income to be used in financing the tuition fees and allowances of their children. She is thankful that Kiva lenders offer their financial assistance for them to improve their income source. She believes that someday she will be able to start another kind of business to give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Larry

texts.en: Larry, 46 years of age, is married, and they were blessed with 5 children. Larry is has been a farmer for almost 19 years. He grows rice. His net income last cropping was 25,000 PHP (~$600). He's asking for a loan for 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his farm. Larry would like to maintain his relationship with Kiva and ASKI MFI to request larger loans so that he can grow his agricultural business and supplement his family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Viviana Fenes

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos en casa propia ubicada en la comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Viviana es una madre trabajadora y dedicada a su familia.  Ella tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

Viviana se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino. Ella los cría en la parte trasera de su casa y una vez que alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa a los pobladores de la zona y en el mercado de su comunidad. Sin embargo, el negocio que más rentabilidad le da , es el cultivo de mango y limón. Viviana cuenta con terreno agrícola que su padre le heredó es allí donde  tiene sus cosechas. 

Viviana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles para invertir en sus negocios. Comprará alimento balanceado para sus ovinos , así como , fertilizantes para sus cultivos de limón y mango. 

Viviana es una clienta conocida de nuestra entidad y ha sido puntual en sus pagos
texts.en:
Viviana, 27, lives with her husband and two children in her own house located in the rural community of Tambogrande-Piura District.  Viviana is a hard working mother who is devoted to her family.  She has a strong wish to improve her children’s quality of life.

Viviana raises sheep to sell.  She raises them in her back yard and once they reach ideal size and weight she sells them to local residents and at her community’s market.  However, the business that’s most profitable is growing lemons and mangoes.  Viviana has a field that her father passed down to  her where she grows her crops.

Viviana is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to invest in her businesses.  She will buy nutritionally balanced feed for her sheep as well as fertilizer for her lemon and mango crops.

Viviana is a well known client of our firm and has been punctual with her payments.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has operated a clothes selling business for the past six years, selling from home and at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

She and her husband have four children: three attend school and one has graduated. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. The greatest monthly expenses for the family are food and school fees.

With the Kshs 100,000 loan, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to start a boda boda (motorcycle transportation) business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start a boda boda (motorcycle transportation) business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 48 years old and is married with three children, between 10 and 20 years of age. She owns a business of selling local drinks and some food like cakes and other items. Her business hours are from 8 am until 5 pm every day except on the weekend. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Christine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying a large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks and to add more food like cakes for sale. With any profits, Christine will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantities of sorgum to make a local drinks.

loans.name: Micahel

texts.en:
Michael has operated his posho mill (for grinding maize or grain into flour) in Naivasha town for the last three years. He is 23 years old and married to Rebecca. They have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to add more maize to the inventory in his posho mill shop.

In the future, Michael hopes to own a big posho mill in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more maize.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 41-year-old married man with three children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him and his desire is to educate his children up to university level. 

Henry has been operating a stationery shop for four years. He acquired capital for the shop from farming. His hardship is inflation and his vision is setting up a bookshop. Henry needs the loan facility to buy books and reams of paper for sale.

loans.use: To buy books and reams of paper for sale

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 21 years old and has a four-year-old child who is not yet in school. She is married to a policeman. She sells foodstuffs and vegetables in the market such as tomatoes. She has been doing this business for two years. She managed to buy herself some land from the profits so far. Joselyne needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs and vegetables. She wants to use the profits to buy a motorcycle in order to make money in the transport business, which will enable her to build a house on the land she purchased.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and vegetables.

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is a 29-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two school-aged children. She works in producing handicrafts, embroidery/needlepoint and all artisanal work, and she's a very talented woman. She works upon request from clients who ask for special orders. She has been involved in this type of business since 2006. She works hard to support her husband. 

Today, Lama is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy textiles and tailoring supplies needed in order to increase her business productivity. In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy textiles and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Solar Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Solar  está formado por 20 integrantes todas del Barrio Solar de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación. Este grupo tiene muy buena comunicación, solidez y solidaridad.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elva, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata de todo tipo. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo y a su habilidad en las ventas  ha logrado salir  adelante y de este modo ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos diarios.
Ella solicita a la fundación y a kiva el crédito para la compra de platería con lo cual podrá seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Comité de Mujeres Solar is made up of 20 members, all of them women from the Barrio Solar in the city of Villa Elisa. They are currently in their sixth loan cycle in the Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs. The group has great communication and is very unified and supportive.
One of the members is Elva. She sells silver jewelry of all sorts. She says that this work and her talent for sales have helped her improve her family's lives and cover their everyday expenses.
She is requesting a loan from the Foundation and Kiva to buy silver jewelry to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is a 29-year-old married woman who has one child. The couple works hard to earn a living. Roxanne was just selling balut before, but as time passed by, she decided to start her own business. Nowadays, she is operating her own balut-making business. Aside from her own business, she also has one in another place where she has a business partner. They started their joined business in January. Roxanne is thankful because her business continues to grow. She earns about P15,000 monthly in her own business. The income she generates from her business is used for their daily needs, other household expenses, and payment of electric bills.  

Roxanne acquires her fresh eggs in the villages of Cebu and Gud San Isidro. She makes her own balut at her house since she has the materials needed for making it. Roxanne would like to buy more fresh eggs due to the many buyers of balut but her funds are not sufficient, so she is asking for additional capital in the amount of P30,000. She hopes that through her patience and additional capital she could make her business expand and grow so that she could educate her only child and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fresh eggs for balut-making business

loans.name: Kodé

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui a arrêté ses études au lycée.Avec l'appui de son oncle, il a  loué une cantine au marché pour y vendre des habits, des chaussures mais aussi des téléphones portables et leurs accessoires.Il parvient à obtenir des bénéfices qui lui servent à satisfaire ses propres besoins et à soutenir la famille dans la prise en charge des besoins alimentaires et de paiement des factures d'eau et d'électricité.l'exiguïté de sa cantine constitue une contrainte pour la bonne marche de ses affaires car ne pouvant pas contenir beaucoup de marchandises.Toutefois, sa position dans le marché, en plein centre ville, lui permet d'attirer beaucoup de clients et d'écouler rapidement ses produits.Ainsi, pour renouveler son stock, il sollicite sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un prêt de 150000f pour acheter des chemises, des pantalons, des maillots de l'équipe national de football et des chaussures. Il ambitionne d'ouvrir une autre cantine plus large qui pourra stocker toute sa marchandise.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young man who left school at the high school level. With support from his uncle, he rented a booth at the market to sell clothes, shoes, and mobile phones and accessories. He is making a profit which allows him to help his family meet their needs for food and utility bills. He is limited by the small size of his booth as it doesn't hold much merchandise.  However, the location of the market, right in the center of town, means he attracts many customers and his products are sold quickly.

To increase his inventory he is asking UIMCEC for a loan of 150,000 francs to buy shirts, pants, national soccer team jerseys, and shoes. His ambition is to open a larger booth that will hold all his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, national soccer team jerseys and shoes.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Elisa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Consuelo”, del Distrito de San Pablo, Provincia de Bellavista y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y 04 hijos que están a su cargo y cursan el nivel primario y secundario.
Cuando recién se casó, ella y su esposo se dedicaban a la agricultura, pero desde hace 8 años su esposo instaló un taller mecánico y desde entonces se dedican a ello, él la motiva para que inicie un negocio de venta de repuesto y lubricantes, negocio que inició gracias al préstamo del Movimiento  Manuela Ramos de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles.  Ella recibe la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,300.00, comprará insumos como repuestos, lubricantes, aditivos.
Elisa es una mujer luchadora  y emprendedora,  su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque reciben sesiones educativas, a través de éstas charlas  les enseñan cómo administrar el dinero de su negocio
texts.en:
Elisa belongs to the "Consuelo" communal bank, in San Pablo district, in Bellavista province, in San Martín department. She is 30, lives with her partner, and has four children in her care, who are in primary and secondary school. 

When they had just gotten married, she and her husband farmed; but eight years ago, her husband set up an auto repair shop, and has worked at that ever since. 

He encouraged her to start a business selling spare parts and lubricants. She began the business thanks to a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Movimiento Manuela Ramos. 

She gets help from her husband and her children. With this new loan of 2,300 nuevos soles, she will buy supplies such as spare parts, lubricants, and additives. 

Elisa is a determined and enterprising woman. Her dream is to expand her business. She is very thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, because she gets educational sessions, and through these talks she is being taught how to manage her business' money.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as spare parts, lubricants, and additives.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. Mercedita is married and has a business buying and selling cellphones and home appliances in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Mercedita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba pero actualmente vive en la ciudad Yucay. (Los distritos peruanos de Huayllabamba y Yucay son uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en el Departamento del Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú). 

Yolanda tiene 40 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella tiene una actividad económica principal que realiza durante todo año. Ella durante los meses de abril hasta octubre se dedica a comprar,  a cultivar y a sembrar maíz, zapallos, zanahorias, tomates y otras verduras pero durante los meses de octubre a marzo se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras y a la venta de choclo. Ella lleva sus choclos a vender a la ciudades de Urubamba, Cusco, Calca y otras ciudades. Ella distribuye sus productos a los diferentes mercados mayoristas de esas ciudades. En esta oportunidad Yolanda requiere el préstamo para comprar más choclos, pasto, zapallos y otras verduras. Su sueño de Yolanda es abrir un restaurante. 

Yolanda es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y otros en la ciudad de Yucay.
texts.en:
Yolanda  was born in the city of Huayllabamba, but she now lives in the city of Yucay. (The Peruvian districts of Huayllabamba and Yucay are two of the seven districts of Urubamba province, located in the department of Cusco in the Cusco region of Peru.)

Yolanda is 40 years old and married.  Through this beautiful relationship they have 5 children. Yolanda works throughout the year.  During the months of April through October she plants and cultivates corn, squash, carrots, tomatoes and other vegetables, but during the months of October through March she has a business selling choclo (a Peruvian variety of large-kerneled corn). She takes her corn to sell in Urubamba, Cusco, Calca and other cities.  She distributes her corn in the different wholesale markets in these cities. At this time, Yolanda needs a loan to buy more corn, pasture grass, squash and other vegetables. Yolanda's dream is to open a restaurant.

Yolanda is a member of the communal bank “Virgen Natividad," which has 15 members who live in the city of Huayllabamaba, and others who live in the city of Yucay.

loans.use: to buy more corn, pasture grass, squash and other vegetables

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes de 29 años es una mujer soltera y sin hijos. Vive con sus padres y hermanos en la comunidad nativa de San Román Bajo, en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Mercedes es una mujer independiente. A pesar de vivir en el mismo techo que sus padres, sabe ganarse la vida con su propio esfuerzo. Ella cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, en ellos siembra café. En esta actividad necesita la ayuda de personal operario, pues a veces sus hermanos no pueden ayudarla.  La cosecha del café es anual, por eso Mercedes, se dedica a varias actividades como jornalera en otros cultivos, apoyo en el trabajo del hogar, entre otros.
Pero cuando llegan las cosechas sale bien beneficiada ya que la venta de café no tiene pierde. Ya lleva 5 años desempeñándose en el negocio, y ya sabe quienes son los compradores más fieles.
Una de sus metas más cercanas es ampliar sus cultivos, con la siembra de plátanos y yucas. Es así que deberá trabajar y ahorrar. Ésta sería la primera vez que Mercedes obtendría un crédito de MFP, gracias a su ayuda, por tal razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente emocionada por ser parte del banco comunal “La Bella Durmiente”. Con el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar 8 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para el café, así también pagará al personal quien le ayudará a limpiar sus tierras.
texts.en:
29-year old Mercedes is single and doesn’t have any children. She lives with her parents and siblings in the community of San Román Bajo, Perene District, Chanchamayo Province. Mercedes is an independent woman, who, despite living in the same house as her parents, knows how to earn a living through her own efforts. She has two parcels of farmland where she grows coffee. She needs help with the farm as her siblings cannot always help out. 

Coffee is harvested annually so Mercedes also works as a day labourer on other farms, assists with household chores, as well as taking on other jobs.

But when it is coffee harvest time, all is good as you can’t fail with coffee. Mercedes has been doing this work for five years and already knows who are the best people to sell the coffee to. One of the things she wants to do soon is to sow bananas and yucca in her fields so she can save more money.

This will be Mercedes’ first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the assistance. She gives her word that she will be punctual with the repayments. She is excited to be part of La Bella Durmiente (Sleeping Beauty) Community Bank. With the loan money she plans to buy eight bags of organic fertilizer for the coffee plants and hire labourers to help her weed the fields.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of organic fertilizer and hire labourers

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоату 60 лет, разведенная и имеет одного совершеннолетнего ребенка. Она очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 15 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается куплей продажей продукты питания в продовольственном магазине. В последнее время у нее мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и она не может придерживать своих клиентов, которые делают покупки новых супермаркетов. Она должна срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы вернуть своих клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 Сомони для того, чтобы купить хлеб, масло, колбасные изделия, консервы, напитки и молочные продукты. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rafoat is 60 years old, divorced and has one grown-up child. She is a very hardworking person and has more than 15 years of experience in business. She buys and sells food products in a grocery store. Lately, she has had very few customers as there is a lot of competition and she is unable to retain her customers who do their shopping at the new supermarkets. She needs to immediately expand her assortment of goods in order to get her customers to return. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy bread, butter, sausages, canned goods, beverages and dairy products. She relies on you and your support.

loans.use: to buy bread, butter, sausages, canned goods and dairy products to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Nyachiewo B village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Nyachiewo B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Nyagul river. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Mary and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Mary works as a subsistence farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Mary and three other promoters in her community, including Irine, Josia and Melda, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Mary will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Mary wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will kill bacteria in water, hence making water safe for drinking and improving overall health.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Mary’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Tsilaviniaina

texts.fr:
Tsilaviniana a 20 ans, et est encore célibataire.  C'est un jeune homme débrouillard et dynamique. En ce moment, les revenus tirés de l’activité lui permettent d’appuyer financièrement sa mère. 
Il vend des salades dans l’un des marchés de la capitale. Il a commencé cette activité depuis qu’il a abandonné ses études, il y a maintenant 2 ans. L’activité dépend de la qualité et de la diversité des produits vendus (couleur, pointure, quantité).  Le marché est en pleine croissance en cette période de pluie. Il est actuellement à son troisième prêt. Au début, il travaillait avec sa mère qui  exerce la même activité le stock de marchandises était encore faible, les prêts antérieurs lui ont permis de disposer son propre stock de marchandises et de les augmenter. Le prêt sert à acheter des sandales de différents couleurs pour les revendre
Son souhait est de pouvoir construire une maison avant de se marier.

loans.use: acheter des sandales, kitos

loans.name: “Juanita” Juana

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Doña Juana lives in a small town in Oaxaca state, in the Mexican Southeast. She has three sons, two of them born with cleft lip disease and it was the reason for starting her small business in order to pay their medical treatments (and afford their studies) because they've needed operations since they were little children. Four years ago she started her business, where she offers fruits, vegetables and groceries. Actually, her youngest sons are students at school and support her in the small business. In addition, her oldest one supports her by selling goats in the nearby communities into “los días de plaza” (market day) and this is why they share the credit for both businesses.

She is asking for a loan of $550 USD to be able to supply her business, because when her children go back to school, she has a lot of expenses. And now she needs the working capital to help supply her business and buy some goats to sell in different community markets. The term to repay will be 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

Doña Juana vive en una comunidad pequeña en el estado de Oaxaca, en el sureste mexicano. Ella tiene tres hijos, los dos menores nacieron con el paladar hendido y es por eso que decidió iniciar su negocio para poder costear los estudios y el tratamiento de sus hijos, ya que fueron operados desde pequeños. Hace cuatro años inició su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, frutas y verduras y en la actualidad sus hijos menores estudian y le ayudan en el negocio. Su hijo mas grande le ayuda dedicándose a la compra-venta de ganado en las comunidades cercanas en los días de plaza (mercado del pueblo) y es por eso que comparten el crédito para ambos negocios.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 550 USD para poder surtir mejor su negocio, ya que con el regreso a clases de sus hijos tuvo muchos gastos y necesita apoyo de capital de trabajo para resurtirse y además requieren recursos para comprar algunos chivos para vender en los mercados cercanos. El plazo para pagar será de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: to buy goats and merchandise

loans.name: Baybala

texts.en:
Baybala was born in Gazakh region of Azerbaijan. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He began his business 3 years ago, when he was 19 years old. In the beginning of his business he sold bags. He is now 22 years old. 
Now he needs a loan amount of $1100 to be busy with selling industrial goods.

loans.use: To be busy with selling industrial goods

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en: Tiresa is a widow with six children.  When her husband passed away, she was left without steady income.  Supporting this large family on her own is very difficult.    Tiresa learned to sew and how to make hand-printed fabrics from her mother.  Tiresa is leveraging her talent as a seamstress to achieve her dream of financial security.  She prints fabrics and sews clothes to order for the local villagers.  However, she is anxious to expand her business and build up a stock of finished fabrics and clothing for larger scale retail sale.  Tiresa feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that her children can stay in school and have a bright future.

loans.use: Buy material and fabric-printing tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a hard-working woman. She is married and has two daughters: the eldest is a five-year-old and the youngest is just a one-month-old baby. For the past four years, Elizabeth has dedicated herself to selling toys and baby's apparel. She started her business after her husband's contract with the construction company he was employed with ended. With her husband’s income missing bills started to pile up and she decided to generate her own income to try to fill the gap.

It's been less than one month since her second child was born. During this period, her business received less attention because she's had no one else around to help out. Now she is able to return to work and she needs a $250.00 loan to purchase merchandise that can boost up her business. She commits to paying her loan back within three months.

This is an important matter for this family's well-being. Please, help Mrs. Rodriguez's business grow. She truly appreciates your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora, es casada y tiene dos hijas, una de 5 años de edad y otra de sólo un mes de nacida. Desde hace cuatro años Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de juguetes y artículos para bebé, inició su negocio después de que su esposo terminó el contrato en la constructora en la que estaban empleado, al no contar con un ingreso las deudas de su hogar comenzaron a acumularse y para poder ayudar a su esposo decidió abrir su propio negocio.

Hace apenas un mes que nació su segunda bebé y descuidó un poco su negocio porque no tenía a nadie que le ayudara, pero ahora que puede regresar a trabajar necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ayuda a Elizabeth a crecer con su negocio, ella agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for her food market

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira I. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. She is 35 years old, married and has two children. She and her husband are engaged in cattle-breeding. She started her business 10 years ago. She borrowed three loans from Normicro and increased the number of her cows. Now she needs $600 to buy another cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow to expand her cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Muen

texts.en: Mrs. Muen H., 70, is a widow and lives with her eight children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works on her piece of land growing mushrooms and generally earns around $5/day in revenue from selling the outputs to a middleman. One of her children is an electrician, another one is employed by a private company, and the rest work at a garment factory or are students. Mrs. Muen H. has applied for a loan to purchase a simple car for her son to operate his own business as a taxi driver.

loans.use: To purchase a simple car for her son to operate his own business as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: My name is Nasreen B. and my husband and I have six children. Four of our children are in school while two are grown and have jobs of their own. My husband owns a wagon and uses it to make a living offering local transport services. This wagon is our major source of income, but to continue to use it we must renew the government token which allows us to offer these services. We are seeking a loan of $175 to renew the token.

loans.use: Renew the token which allows us to transport goods in our wagon

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.ru:
Fathullo Halimov is 22 years old, has finished high school, single. Fathullo owns a truck and works as a driver for hire in his town. He is planning to use the loan to purchase additional spare parts for the truck and it's repair. This loan will allow Fathullo to fix his truck, which is a source of income for him and will allow the locals to rent the car when needed for the purpose of transportation of heavy goods. Mr. Halimov is planning to pay back the loan in the next 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Халимов Фатхулло, возраст – 22 года, образование – среднее, неженат, детей не имеет. Фатхулло имеет свой собственный грузовой автомобиль, на которм оказывает услуги местным жителям. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение отдельных автозапчастей для автомобиля, а также для его ремонта. Данный кредит даст возможность Дильшоду починить свой автомобиль, который является средством для получения дохода и даст возможность местным жителям в необходимый момент заказать машину для перевозки каких-либо сыпучих грузов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: transportation services

loans.name: Nancy Socorro

texts.en:
Nancy is a 45 year old single mother of three children. Nancy has been a member of the community bank for two years. She is a member of the “Virgen de Cocharcas” Lending group within the bank. Nancy says that through the bank she has learned hardwork and the discipline to manage her money effectively. Since joining the bank she feels happier and more economically stable.

Nancy sells herbal life products, which is a line of natural dietary supplements. She travels to Lima about once per month to buy products and bring them back to Ayacucho. She has been selling these products for almost eighteen months. In the past she sold clothing, but has a higher profit with herbal life products.

Nancy dreams of owning a store, and giving her children a better life.

loans.use: To buy supplies in Lima in order to increase profits

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Xiomara lives with her husband and three children in their own home in a rural zone of Achuapa, Nicaragua. Together they work on their farm, dedicating themselves to raising livestock and sowing seeds for an abundant harvest.

Xiomara's family have stood out a lot by being so hard-working; her kids also lend their hands daily to the farm work.

Because they live in a remote area, Xiomara and her family aren't able to get electricity. To improve the living conditions for her children, she has requested adding a solar panel to her home to provide energy for two lamps, an electric grill and a small television set. To cover these costs, she's requesting a loan so she can still continue fighting hard to improve the conditions for her small children who need their parents so much.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El municipio de Achuapa es una localidad ubicada en una zona rural donde habita la dama Xiomara T. con su esposo y tres hijos en su propia casa de habitación. Ambos trabajan en el negocio agropecuario dedicándose a la crianza de ganado y siembra de semilla para obtener abundante cosecha.

La familia de la señora Xiomara se ha destacado mucho por ser muy trabajadora ya que sus hijos también forman parte del trabajo diario en el negocio agropecuario.

Para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus pequeños, la señora Xiomara al no contar con energía eléctrica en su sector por estar muy alejado, ha solicitado que le implementen un panel solar en su casa de habitación para iluminarse por medio de dos lámparas y tener acceso a una plancha y un pequeño televisor. Para cubrir este gasto ella ha acudido a CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito necesario para cancelar esta deuda y así continuar luchando fuertemente para mejorar las condiciones de sus pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de sus padres.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for her home / Pago de panel solar para la vivienda

loans.name: Aida Saballo

texts.es:
Aída lives in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood. She is single, 53 years old, with two married daughters. She has been an elementary school teacher for 20 years and she has been selling cosmetic products for two years. She started her cosmetic business with her own funds, with the goals of improving the structure of her home and improving her business. With the loan she is going to buy more products resulting in greater demand from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Aída vive en el barrio Carlos Fonseca, tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera, con dos hijas las cuales están casadas ya. Ella es docente de primaria tiene 20 años de dar clases pero a demás vende productos de cosmético que lleva dos años de experiencia vendiendo comenzó con fondos propios su propósito es mejorar la estructura de su casa y mejorar el negocio. Con el préstamo va a comprar más productos, y así tener mas demanda con sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetic products

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en: Munawar Baji is a wife of S. H. who is a fruit seller. She is the mother of four sons. One of her sons helps her husband in fruit selling. From the income of the fruit business she was able to marry her three sons. Her husband has been in this profession since his childhood because his father and his forefathers were doing the same business for many, many years. She is applying for a loan for her husband’s fruit business.

loans.use: To expand the fruit business

loans.name: Jose Daniel's Group

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Jose Daniel C. tnego 35 años de edad, estoy casado, tengo 3 hijos, me dedico a la venta de repuestos y reparaciones de bicicletas, tengo 4 años de dedicarme a este negocio, mi taller es el unico en esta zona ahi que tengo mucha clientela y como las bicicletas en nuestra cominudad son un medio de transporte para muchas personas ir a los colegios a los trabajos, entonces hay bastante demanda de repuestos para bicicletas, mis clientes me quieren mucho ya que les brindo una buena atencion y amabilidad. en la actualidad no cuento con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mi negocio y poder cumplir con toda la demanda que existe, por esa razon solicito ayuda a uds para poder salir adelante con mi pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Compra de cadenas, balineras, pedales, neumaticos, cables de breques, guadafangos, parrillas, monturas,

loans.name: Sioni

texts.en:
Sioni is a married woman with three children aged 4, 6, and 8. In 2002, she opened a small store with groceries and clothes. Every day, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Sioni now hopes for a loan to buy more beer, soda. and clothes for her store.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda, and clothes to increase her store.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
30-year-old Zawadi has been selling charcoal and firewood since 2005. She works from 7am to 8pm at her business each day, earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zawadi now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Julia es separada, tiene 53 años y 2 hijos, Julia vende ropa, calzados, artefactos y todo cuanto le piden sus clientes, Julia reparte sus productos en diferentes instituciones, amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito y cobra mensual o cada quincena dependiendo, sus productos los adquiere en las ciudades de Lima, Tacna y Trujillo. Además Julia brinda servicios de preparación de comida para diferentes eventos, compromisos familiares. También viaja a Lima a apoyar en el negocio que tiene su hijo de venta de accesorios de juegos de video y lentes.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 2550 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa y calzados variados. Los sueños de Julia son que sus hijos se titulen, el negocio de su hijo prospere y su negocio sea estable.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Legión Community Bank.

Julia is separated, is 53 years old, and has two children. Julia sells clothes, footwear, devices, and everything her clients ask for. Julia delivers her products to different institutions, friends, and relatives. Her sales are by credit and she gets paid monthly or every fortnight. Her products are purchased in the cities of Lima, Tacna, and Trujillo.

Also, Julia offers catering services for different events and family commitments. She also travels to Lima to help with her son’s business, which sells video game accessories and glasses.

Julia needs a loan of 2550 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of clothes and varied footwear.

Julia dreams that her children are titled, that her son’s business prospers, and that her business will be stable.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 2550 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of clothes and varied footwear

loans.name: Sobhi

texts.en: Sobhi is a 51-year-old man. He lives with his wife and they have 5 children. He lives in Beirut where he owns a small garage for auto repairs. Sobhi is an ambitious man who places great emphasis on the education of his children. He has asked for a loan of $1000 in order to cover the costs of school fees for his children. This will be Sobhi's second loan.

loans.use: to help pay for his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Bahati A.

texts.en:
