Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Bahati K. from Kyela. She is married with four children, ages 3 to 15. Bahati has been running a fish and crops business since 2006. She buys fish from fisherman at the lake and sells them in town; she also buys crops from farmers sells them.

She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Bahati currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 550 USD in order to purchase more fish, rice and red palm seeds in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Bahati thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish, rice and red palm seeds in bulk

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel J. is a 40-year-old man who lives with his wife and 5 children in the Stella B area of the Rongo District in Kenya. His wife is a farmer, and 4 of their 5 children are currently attending school.

Abel runs a community pharmacy, which he started in 2008. He sells painkillers like Panadol and Brufen, among other medications. With the profits from the pharmacy he is able to pay his household expenses. If the business does well, there will also be enough profit to pay for his children’s school fees.

Abel is applying for a loan of KSH 11,250 (USD 150) in order to buy a larger stock of medicine, in order to better serve his community’s health needs and also to increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase stock of medicine

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea M. lives in the Svay Ron village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Song Vuthy, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard they still do not earn enough income to support the family. They also live in an old house in poor condition. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Sophea M. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a better house for her family. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To build a better house for her family.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is a single entrepreneur. She is a direct dealer of beauty products for men and women. Other than that, she is also engaged in the poultry business, raising ducks and chickens.  She is proud that she can help her family earn something for their daily needs.  Thus, to further maintain her business activities, Analyn wants to take out a loan amounting to PHP 4,000.  She believes that this amount will help her family be lifted out of poverty.  She hopes that her loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business and somehow expand to other types of business someday.  It is just a matter of “sacrifice,” says Analyn.

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Lien

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị Liên 69 tuổi, gia đình chị có  4 con đều đã trưởng thành.  Năm 1994 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vay  vốn để đầu tư buốn bán đồ nhựa và hàng tạp hoá. Hiện tại chị đã  mua được quầy hàng cố định tại chợ huyện Sóc Sơn- Hà Nội. Hàng tháng bên cạnh nguồn thu từ kinh doanh gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ lương hưu của chồng với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. Dương Thị Liên is 69 yrs old. She has 4 children who are all grown. In 1994 she joined TYM fund to borrow money to invest in a business selling plastic merchandise and grocery. Presently she has a kiosk at the market in the district of Sóc Sơn in Hà Nội. In addition to her income from the grocery business, she also has another source of income from her husband's retirement pension, totaling 288 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to invest in her grocery business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 37-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Samir has been working as a van driver. He requested a loan of 700 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is the first time that Samir has requested a loan. Samir decided on doing his business because he had to improve his family’s financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe M. is 37 years old. She's married and a mother of  4 children.  Her husband is a hardworking farmer.  They both work hard for their family. Fe became interested in business when she engaged in the buying and selling of bananas. Everyday she is busy with  the business.  She entertains walk in customers and also sells through peddling. Fe is always aiming for the improvement of her business.  Fe has decided to apply for  loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00. This amount is intended for the purchase of additional stocks of bananas. Fe is looking forward to the great help that  HSPFI, a Kiva partner, will extend to her.

loans.use: To purchase of addtional stocks of banana  for selling

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: MR M. EST UN JEUNE TAILLEUR DE PROFESSION NE EN 1978 A THIES.IL A COMMENCE A EXERCER CE METIER DEPUIS 1998 ET A OUVERT SON PROPRE ATELIER EN 2008.IL A L'HABITUDE DE TRAVAILLER SUR COMMANDE ET A UNE CLIENTELE IMPORTANTE.AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT ACHETER UNE MACHINE A COUDRE POUR RENFORCER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
Mr. M. is a young tailor by profession. He was born in 1978 in THIES. He began working at his trade in 1998 and opened his own shop in 2008. He usually works by special orders and has many customers. With this loan, he wants to buy a sewing machine for bolstering his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sérieux Group

texts.fr:
Sérieux est un groupe constitué de sept femmes dont trois monogames et quatre polygames qui ont en moyenne 32 ans et  3 enfants. Elles habitent à Bougoula hameau, une des communes rurales  de  Sikasso  (3ème région administrative du Mali).  
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de condiments alimentaires, de  pagnes wax, des  fruits et  des céréales.
Elles sont à leur  sixième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de  satisfaire le besoin croissant des  clients  et d’accroitre leurs revenus. Tous les prêts précédents ont été  bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  30 colis de condiments alimentaires, 30 sacs  de 100 kg de céréales  et  25 paniers de fruits.  Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans  les villages environnants auprès des producteurs. Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place,  à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et en détail.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’éducation et  la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Sérieux ambitionnent d’entreprendre des voyages d’affaire en vue d’élargir leur horizon.
texts.en:
Sérieux is a group composed of seven women (3 monogamous and 4 polygamous) who average 32 years of age and 3 children each. The women live in the hamlet of Bougoula, a rural community of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They operate diverse businesses, including the sale of condiments, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), fruit, and grains. They are on their sixth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy customer demand and to grow their revenues. All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy thirty packages of condiments, thirty 100-kg sacks of grain, and 25 baskets of fruit. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in surrounding villages from producers. The merchandise is sold retail in cash transactions at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City locally, out of the house, and door-to-door. The customers are composed of women and men. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. A portion will be used for the education and health of the children, and the other portion will be invested in business and used for making loan payments. Their ambition is to embark on business trips with the aim of expanding their horizons.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo” vive en la Av. Amazonas Nº 463, del Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años; es madre de 06 hijos y 03 que aun dependen de ella. 

Una mujer luchadora que vio la forma de cómo generar sus propios ingresos en su hogar, sin ningún jefe, ni horario. Emprendió su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio que ofrece a sus clientes fijos, amistades y vecinos. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien y que tiene mucha clientela que hace sus pedidos por catalogo o por el stock de cosméticos que tiene. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, invertirá comprando cosméticos como perfumes, colonias, lociones y desodorantes para damas y caballeros; polvos, cremas y maquillajes para el rostro, para aumentar su stock, de tal manera que pueda tener variedad para ofertar a su clientela y así encuentren de todo en un solo sitio. 

Beatriz manifiesta que el Banco Comunal es una excelente propuesta para las mujeres que desean trabajar y progresar, hoy se siente una mujer independiente y responsable, con ganas de seguir adelante e implementar un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Community Bank "El Triunfo", meaning Triumph. She lives at 463 Amazonas in the district of San Hilarion in San Martin. She is married, 44 years old and mother to 6 children, three of whom are still under her care.

As a hard worker, she figured out a way to generate an income for her household, work without a boss, and without a set schedule. She took up cosmetics sales with the first loan she received amounting to S/.300. She contiues with that same business and she has established a solid clientele, mostly friends and neighbors. It has been going very well and she counts on a large client base, taking orders through a catalogue and selling the inventory of cosmetics she has on hand.

This loan of S/.1500 she will invest in the purchase of products such as perfumes, colognes, lotions and deodorants for ladies and gentlemen, body powders, creams and make up. She wil replenish her inventory so that she will have selection to offer her clientele, so that they will find all they need in one spot.

Beatrz says that the Community Bank is an excellent resource for women wishing to work and advance themselves. Today she is an independent and responsible woman, with a strong desire to keep going and develop her business even more.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics (perfumes, colognes, lotions, deodorants and make up) for ladies and gentlemen.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou  Konaté est âgée de 45 ans, mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille monogame avec ses enfants et son époux dans le  quartier Sébénikoro -Pélengana de Ségou (4ème  région administrative de la république  du Mali). 
Ayant abandonnée l’école  en classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour se marier, Oumou Konaté a appris le commerce de pâte d’arachide auprès de sa mère depuis son jeune âge et jouit aujourd’hui d’une très grande notoriété pour la propriété  et la qualité de sa pâte d’arachide surtout du côté des femmes fonctionnaires de Ségou. 
Pour avoir  de la pâte d’arachide, on procède au lavage des grains pour enlever l’ivraie (mauvaises graines) des bonnes graines puis les opérations suivantes se succèdent : séchage, triage, grillade, épluchure et broyage au moulin. La pâte ainsi obtenue est mise dans des seaux en plastique avec couvercles pour la vente.
Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle a fait recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 42 mois, après avoir bien remboursés 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 sacs de graines d’arachide et 32 seaux en plastique. Elle s’approvisionne en ces matières premières au marché de Pélengana. La pâte d’arachide est vendue dans des seaux, à crédit payable mensuellement et au comptant majoritairement  aux femmes en ambulant et à domicile.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge certaines charges familiales (savon et compléments du prix des condiments).
texts.en:
Madam Oumou Konaté, aged 45, and the mother of 5 children lives in a monogamous family with her children and husband in the Sébénkoro-Pélengana neighborhood of Ségou( Fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having dropped out from school in the 9th basic year (Malian education system) to marry, she learnt to make groundnut paste as a business from her mother, at a tender age and enjoys today a huge reputation for her business and the quality of her groundnut paste especially from women civil servants from Ségou. To make groundnut paste, wash the grains first to remove the chaff (bad grains) from the good grains and the following processes come one after the other; drying, sorting, frying (without oil), removing the skin and grinding at the mill. The paste is thus collected and put in plastic buckets with lids for sale. With the goal of increasing her funds for this business, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been with this institution 42 months ago, and after having repaid correctly 3 group loans and 2 individual loans, she is on her 3rd individual loan. This new loan will be used to buy 5 bags of groundnuts and 32 plastic buckets. She gets her basic supplies at the Pélengana marketplace. The groundnut paste is sold in buckets on credit to be paid monthly and mainly on cash to women who sell from door -to- door and in their homes. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 37,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and to pay for certain family expenses (soap and seasoning).

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of groundnuts and plastic buckets

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita T. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Unidos. Mercedita has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Mercedita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase products to sell. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for a general store

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch S. is a 27-year-old married woman and mother. She currently owns a small hairdressing shop next to her house, and earns some additional money selling a few soft drinks in the shop. She married years ago and is devoted to her two school-aged children.  Her husband works as a civil servant in the department of ministry. Ouch said that her business runs smoothly because it is in a good location crowded with passersby. She has found that the home decorating business for wedding parties is a profitable one and would like to to invest in it to earn extra income, but she lacks money to do so. She would therefore like a loan through Kiva to purchase wedding supplies to begin a decoration service.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to begin a decorating service.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina N. is a woman with the courage and determination to overcome poverty. She is 43 years old and the mother of four, all daughters. She was widowed and left with four children to take care of. She lives in the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Life was not easy for Josefina when her husband died. She needed to work and look for a living to support the needs of her children. In 1999, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During her membership in ASHI, she was noted for her exemplary performance in terms of responding to her responsibilities in the organization.

For almost ten years already, Josefina has been engaged in the resale of ready-to-wear clothes and beauty products. When she first joined ASHI, she used her first loans as starting and rolling capital for the business. The business became her main source of income and she receives a good income and proceeds.

Now Josefina is requesting a loan of 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for pants, short pants, T-shirts, face powder, perfumes and many others similar items. She has regular customers and she also receives and accepts orders.

Josefina hopes to send her younger children to school until they finish college and find jobs. She also hopes to expand her business and be able to have more stock. She even aspires to having a space in the market.

loans.use: To pay for pants, short pants, T-shirts, face powder, perfumes and other goods

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham tiene 37 años, es un hombre muy laborioso, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Trabaja como operario podando y fumigando las plantas de frutos cítricas en un fundo de su región, esta labor la realiza de lunes a viernes, de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde. Pero los fines de semana, aprovecha en cultivar, podar y fumigar sus propias plantas de naranjas y plátanos. Cuando sus productos están maduros su esposa va recolectando y acumulándolos en su casa para ir vendiéndolos a los compradores mayoristas, quienes le ofrecen precios muy satisfactorios. Por tal motivo Abraham valora mucho sus cultivos, por ello está planeando comprar más terrenos, para que de ese modo, en el futuro sus hijos no sufran de necesidades económicas.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, él es muy puntual en sus pagos y en las reuniones, ya que en su banco comunal se siente muy contento con todos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de 500 plantas de cítricos para incrementar su producción.

loans.use: Compra de plantas de frutas cítricas

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
A young and active entrepreneur is Mrs. Richie A., 24 years old and a resident of Purok 3 Sta. Cruz, a zone within Tangub City on the island of Mindanao. She is blessed with one minor child. Her husband, Samuel, drives a motorcycle for hire, which is locally known as a Jabal-jabal. On average, he earns at least 150 PHP a day.

Richie wants to help her husband. She decided to start a wholesale RTW clothes, jewelry and powdered milk business one year ago with her neighbors and friends as her first customers. She is now earning an average net income of 3,000 PHP a month.

Richie is a new member of Nangka Center under the PDP-LP program of Paglaum MPC (PMPC). She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP for her business. She hopes that someday she will have her own boutique.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: For additional capital for her wholesale RTW clothes, jewelry and powdered milk business

location.town: Tangub-P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Togoohuu

texts.en: T. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both his children, ages 15 and 13, attend a local secondary school. T. operates a taxi service and a coal transportation service in his town. After operating a consumer goods business for five years, he began his delivery service in 2008. T. says “All I want is to be able to educate my children and make them better people who can contribute to society.” He is requesting  a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan in order to purchase repair parts for his delivery truck.

loans.use: To purchase repair parts for his delivery truck

loans.name: Azel

texts.en:
Azel A. is 43 years old, married to Mr. Reno, 47 years old. The couple is blessed with two children, namely: Sarina Daphnie, grade II pupil and Luis Daryll, grade I pupil. Azel is operates her business two years from now. 

She is engaged in the buy and sell business of clothes, at the same time she sells AVON products and owns a retail store. She buys clothes in Manila (which is around 6 hours travel from her village) then she will sell these in their village. She sells it through walking around their village looking for costumers who will buy clothes.

Azel is dreaming of improving her business. She wants to have a permanent location for her business by setting aside some of her business earnings. She wanted to borrow the amount of PHP7,000 for additional capital of her business. She planned to buy a bigger bulk of clothes from Manila to maximize her transportation costs.

loans.use: Additional capital for her small businesses

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Francisca Elsa

texts.es:
La señora  FRANCISCA ELSA F. C. tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ERO   de secundaria refiere que no continuo estudiando por falta de recursos económicos por lo cual empezó desde joven a trabajar, es soltera y no tiene hijos. La socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a sus amistades y familiares  y con su crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró cosméticos como: talcos, cremas, colonias, perfumes, labiales, etc. para surtir su stock.
Con este crédito de  500.00 nuevos soles también lo utilizará para comprar cosméticos como: colonias, labiales, polvos, delineadores, etc. en oferta para así poder generar mayores ganancias.
FRANCISCA sueña con tener un stand en un centro comercial en donde pueda vender mayor cantidad de cosméticos y así generar mayores ganancias para cubrir sus propias necesidades.
texts.en:
FRANCISCA ELSA F. C., 54, lives in the MOCHE district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SAN BORJA communal bank. She finished 9th grade but did not continue her schooling for lack of funds to defray costs and started to work from a very young age. She is single and has no children. She sells cosmetics to her family and friends. With her initial, 300 new sol, loan she purchased cosmetics like: powders, creams, colognes, perfumes, lipsticks, etc. to constitute her stock. With this 500 new sol loan she will also buy discounted cosmetics like colognes, lipsticks, powders, eyeliners, etc. in order to generate higher profits. FRANCISCA dreams with having a stand in a shopping center where she can sell higher quantities of cosmetics thereby earning higher profits to cover her own needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics like: colognes, lipsticks, powders, eyeliners, etc.

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en:
Adenike is 33 years old and married with a child. Her husband also supports the home. She sells groceries and medicines at retail prices to make a living in Ibadan, Oyo state. 

She is happy because of the high season and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and groceries to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica J. is currently in the business of selling beans, maize flour and charcoal in the market and is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil, sugar and salt to sell. Monica is 29 years old and is married to a soldier. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of cooking oil, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice P. is from the village of Barra. She is 48 years old, is single, and has one school-aged child. Alice owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Alice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Alice is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the education of her child. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Obiya East A Auma Margaret Group

texts.en: A. Margaret is a 48 year old, group representative. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is going to school. She has three other dependants also at school. She owns a bakery which she has been operating for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase bread ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil and baking powder. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to grow her business to, at least, a kiosk.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil and baking powder for her bakery

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens professionnels et de parenté et font le commerce de céréales, d’articles ménagers en plastiques  et de condiments alimentaires.                                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 500Kg de céréales et 50 paniers de condiments alimentaires.                                                                           
Elles s’approvisionnent en céréales et en condiments sur place et dans les  villages environnants. Tous les produits sont  vendus sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour amorcer le prêt, les dépenses familiales telles la santé, la nourriture, les frais scolaires et le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group, who are all married, are in average 36 yr-old with 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Zagnenabougou, in the Fana prefecture of the Koulikoro Region (Second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). They met through professional and family ties, and trade grains, spices as well as plastic household items. The women of the Benkadi are requesting their 4th group loan, that they will use to buy 500 kg of grains and 50 baskets of spices. They purchase their supplies in Zagnenabougou as well as its surroundings. They also retail in their village and surrounding villages to a client base of both women and men. They expect to each make an average monthly profit of 30.000F CFA that they will use towards the loan, health care expenses, food and school fees and the remainder will be re-invested into their activity.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains and spices

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: Guillermo De Jesús tiene 58 años, el es responsable de 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la compra y vente de caballos, además se dedica a la venta de cerdos, pues siempre está buscando la manera de salir adelante. El tiene más de 8 años de estar en este negocio, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar la condición económica de su familia, como padre responsable siempre le ha gustado trabajar. El financiamiento que actualmente está solicitando es para la compra de caballos y algunos cerdos, por lo que tiene una buena demanda hasta los momentos. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y además poder ofrecerles a sus hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Guillermo De Jesús is 58 years old and responsible for two dependent children. His business involves buying and selling horses, as well as selling pigs. He is always looking for ways to get ahead. Guillermo has been in this business for more than eight years since he is always concerned about improving his family’s financial condition. He is a responsible father who has always enjoyed working.

The loan he is currently requesting will be used to buy horses and a few pigs, since they are in high demand at the moment. He dreams of improving his business so that he can provide his children with the things they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase horses & pigs

loans.name: Indrawathi

texts.en:
Indrawathi is a 57-year-old married woman in Dangedara area, Galle district of Sri Lanka.  She lives with her husband and three children. She is a hard-working woman and very honest.

Indrawathi has a business in which she sells clothes at the local marketplace or a fair.  She has been doing this for 15 years, and now she is starting to build a tailoring shop and is seeking a loan.

Indrawathi has requested a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC, which will be her fourth loan.  She has previously never missed a payment. 

She hopes to develop her business through building her own tailoring shop.  She has already  started to build up the shop and is seeking this loan to help make it possible.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to help build a tailoring shop

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: EL SEÑOR CARLOS ESTA CASADO Y TIENE HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ES UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA RESPONSABLE SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO HACE BASTANTES AÑOS, CUENTA QUE CUANDO INICIABA SU VIDA DE TRANSPORTISTA LE FUE MAL YA QUE NO LE PAGABAN LA TARIFA, TIENE MUCHAS ANECDOTAS DE ESOS TIEMPOS, CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD EL SEÑOR CARLOS PIENSA SALIR ADELANTE CON SU ESPOSA E HIJOS, CON LOS CUALES TIENE POR OBJETIVO ENVIARLES A LA UNIVERSIDAD PARA QUE PUEDADN ESTUDIAR Y SEAN PROFESIONALES, Y PUEDAN ALCANZAR LAS METAS QUE SE PROPONGAN. DON CARLOS CONTINUARA TRABAJANDO YA QUE LOS DIAS NO SE DETIENEN Y DEBE CONTINUAR ALIMENTANDO A SU FAMILIA YA QUE ES EL UNICO QUE MANTIENE SU HOGAR UNO DE SUS DESEOS ES EL DE COMPRARSE UNA CASITA YA QUE VIVE EN ALQUILER Y ES MUCHO GASTO PARA EL, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA REPUESTOS PARA SU VEHICULO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and has school age children. He is a hard-working, responsible person who has provided public transportation services for several years. He tells us that when he started out in this occupation he didn’t do too well because customers often would not pay the full fare; he has a lot of anecdotes about those days. Carlos plans to get ahead with this line of work; to see that his wife and children succeed, that they become professionals and can reach whatever goals they set up for themselves. Carlos will continue to work because days don’t stop coming and he must continue to feed his family because he is their only source of support. One of his dreams is to buy his own house because he currently rents and this is a big expense for him. He will use the requested funds to buy replacement parts for his vehicle. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Jova

texts.en:
Jova M. is currently in the business of selling prepared food at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish and chickens. Jova is 48 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more dried fish and chickens.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 45-year-old married man with five children, ages 10, 14, 16, 18 and 21 years.  He has been operating a cyber café for two years where he has employed two people.  He also raises chickens to earn extra income.  He was in construction work before he started his own business. 

He belongs to Faulu Kenya with a group of young entrepreneurs.  He has been an active member of Faulu Kenya and so far he has received two loans.  He has been allowed to take out another loan worth 80,000 KES because he has paid off his first two loans successfully.  

With this loan, he plans to buy stationery, one computer and to expand his business premises.  He hopes to own a computer college in the future.  He sees himself expanding his business and employing more people.

loans.use: To buy stationery, one computer and expand the business premises

loans.name: Ihromitdin

texts.ru: Аминов Ихромитдин проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Ихромитдин занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку, где продает масла, мыла и многие другие вещи нужные для хозяйства. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 17 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Ihromitdin A. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife is a homemaker. Ihromitdin is involved in retail sales. He has a retail outlet, where he sells oils, soap and other goods that are necessary for a household. He has been involved in this type of business for over 17 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Sandra Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Sandra  forma parte del Banco Comunal Los Tamarindos, se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita; nuestra socia está casada y tiene dos hijos, es profesora de la Universidad Técnica De Manabí y aparte de eso es vendedora de productos Avon desde hace varios años, junto a la Fundación ha podido hacer que su negocio crezca, ella compra  al contado los perfumes, bisutería y productos para el aseo personal  y los vende atreves de un catalogo  a sus amigas del trabajo, que en su gran mayoría le compran y le cancelan mensualmente.

La señora Sandra invertirá  este nuevo crédito en la compra de productos, cuenta que tiene varios pedidos por entregar y lo que más vende es perfumes para damas y caballeros, con este crédito también quiere probar suerte con las venta de productos Yanbal y espera que le vaya bien.
texts.en:
Sandra is part of the Los Tamarindos Communal Bank which meets in the city of Portoviejo. She is married and has two children. She is a professor at the Technical University of Manabí, and has also worked selling Avon products for a few years. With help from the Foundation she has been able to grow her business. She buys perfumes, costume jewelry, and personal care products at wholesale and sells them through a catalog to her friends at work, most of whom buy things and pay her every month. Sandra will invest this new loan in the purchase of products. She has several orders to be delivered and the best sellers for men and women are perfumes. With this loan she wants to try her luck with the sale of Yanbal products, and she hopes that it will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase makeup, perfumes, lotions, soaps, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 46 años, vive en una casa alquilada, con su pareja Héctor (51) y con el menor  de sus 3 hijos, pues los mayores trabajan y viven  independientes.Todos los días, desde las 5 de la mañana empieza con sus labores, atiende a los animales que cría – cerdos y vacas- luego vigila sus  cultivos de papa y alverja, junto con su esposo. Ya lleva 4 años dedicada a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, y lo que más le gusta es cosechar las alverjas y seleccionarlas de acuerdo a la calidad del producto para comercializarlas en el mercado, donde tiene varios clientes conocidos, aunque le incomoda trasladar los pesados sacos hasta ese lugar. Además de vez en cuando vende sus animales, y de las vacas saca rica leche fresca, que le sirve para realizar sus quesos, que también comercializa. Como sus actividades son rentables, quiere comprar más terrenos productivos que incrementen su cosechas, también piensa emprender el negocio de venta de papa, verduras y queso en los centros de abasto de la selva peruana, porque sabe que obtendrá generosas ganancias de sus ventas.Es  la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y en las últimas reuniones observo como es la metodología de trabajo de su grupo comunal, y asegura que le gusta porque aprende de las experiencias del resto de integrantes.Julia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono y semillas de papa de la variedad Yungay, de esta manera espera obtener buenas ganancias que le permitan seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Julia, 46 years of age, lives in a rented home with her partner Héctor (51) and the youngest of her 3 children as the older ones are working and now on their own. She starts her work at 5 am every day, tending to the animals she raises – pigs and cows – after which she tends to her potato and pea crops along with her husband. She has been raising livestock and farming for 4 years, and what she enjoys most about her work is harvesting her peas and picking the best ones to sell at the market. There, she has many customers that she knows, although transporting the heavy sacks with her product is challenging. In addition, she occasionally sells her livestock, and her cows produce rich fresh milk that she uses to make cheeses that she also sells. Since her activities are profitable, she would like to buy more fertile land in order to grow the size of her harvests. She is also thinking about embarking on a business selling potatoes, vegetables and cheeses at the general stores in the Peruvian jungle because she knows she can earn a good income from her sales. This is her first loan through MFP and, at recent meetings, she observed the mechanics of how her cooperative group works, which she enjoyed because she was able to learn about other members’ experiences. Julia plans to invest the funds she is requesting into the purchase of bags of fertilizer and seeds for the Yungay variety of potato. Through these steps, she hopes to obtain good earnings that will allow her to continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to improve the productivity of her crops.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married to a taxi driver; they have four children and all their children are in school.  She owns a stall in Mulago market selling second-hand clothes   and she has been in this business for seven years. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes. She buys bales of clothes from Owino market and goes for shopping once a week.  Gladys uses public transport to and from shopping. 

Besides clothing sales, she also owns a restaurant at her home and has three girls who work in it. She works six days a week. Her business challenge are the rainy season which hinders her customers from getting to her.   She is aspiring of building her own house and decided to work with  MCDT  because she wanted capital. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Metekai Ole

texts.en:
Metekai Ole K. is 39 years old. He is married to Kirotian K. and is the father of three school-aged children. Metekai has been farming on his own piece of land for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend 15,000 KES on harrowing, 15,000 KES on seed and 10,000 KES on planting his five acre wheat farm. He anticipates to buy some farm machinery with the profits from the expanded farming activity. 

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to harrow and plant his five acre wheat farm

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys N. displays provisions on a table for sale. She is divorced and has four children. She has no educational background. Gladys uses her income to educate, feed and clothe her children. Gladys will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell. With the new revenues from her expanded business, Gladys plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Yaky

texts.es: Yaky, de 23 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Edeuterio de 28 años y de sus 2 pequeños que estudian en el colegio, juntos desean salir adelante, habitan en un populoso barrio ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de lencería, tanto para damas como para caballeros. Trabaja en su casa y con pedidos, y en el negocio le va bien pues ya tiene clientes fijos que le compran de vez en cuando la ropa interior que ofrece, porque es de  buena calidad. Además siempre le ha gustado el trabajo de ventas, pues tiene buena capacidad de persuasión y convence rápidamente a sus clientes. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene grandes planes para seguir en la comercialización, como el de instalar una tienda de venta de lencería en algún gran centro comercial de la  zona por donde vive. Pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá salir adelante, y continuara ayudando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas, pues quiere continuar en su negocio hasta alcanzar el progreso, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero. Yaky tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en lencería, pues quiere ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, y para lograrlo comprará al por mayor en la ciudad y lo ofrecerá por la zona donde vive a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Yaky is 23 years old and lives in her own home alongside her husband Edeuterio, age 28, and their two young children who are in school. Together they wish to get ahead. Yaky and her family live in a crowded neighborhood to the north of the city. For the past two years she has been selling undergarments and lingerie for women as well as men. She sells from her home and also takes orders. Her business has done very well since she has established customers who buy whenever she has undergarments available to offer since these products are of good quality. Yaky has always enjoyed working in sales because she has good persuasive skills and is able to convince her customers to make quick decisions. Being an enterprising woman, she has grand plans for the future to continue her sales such as opening a large lingerie shop at a shopping center where she lives. She knows it will take a great deal of effort and dedication to get ahead and continue supporting her husband with the household expenses.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yaky promises to complete her payments on time because she wants to continue making progress with her business. She is extremely grateful to everyone who made this loan possible. Yaky plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of merchandise, such as lingerie, so that she can offer variety to her customers. This will allow her to buy in bulk in the city and then offer the goods in her area at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Judith Mariuxi

texts.es:
Judith tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo de Guayaquil la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Hace un año atrás comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector no había y con la ayuda de su mama que también tiene una tienda pudo surtirla, poco a poco la ha venido incrementando con verduras y vegetales. Con la ayuda de su mama a podido tener sus propios ingresos y darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos. 

Pero ahora quiere surtir mas su negocio comprando con el préstamo aceite, arroz y bebidas. En el futuro quiere tener un almacén de víveres para poder cubrir con los gastos que afrontan sus hijos.
texts.en:
Judith has a shop in the front part of her house. She lives in the urban district called Guasmo de Guayquil, where the majority of the inhabitants are informal business people.

She began her grocery store a year ago, since there wasn't one in her sector. With the aid of her mother, who also has a shop, she was able to stock it, and little by little she has been increasing her stock of greens and vegetables. With her mother's help, she has been able to have her own income and give a better life to her two children.

But now she wants to stock her business with more items, using the loan to buy oil, rice, and beverages.  In the future she wants to have a larger store to be able to cover the expenses that her children present.

loans.use: Buy vegetables, rice, oil, and beverages

loans.name: Mrangirangi Group

texts.en:
Esther A. is in her late fifties and is married with three children. Since 1997, Esther has been running a charcoal business. The shop is open daily between 6 am and 6:30 pm and earns Esther a good monthly profit. 

This will be Esther's 8th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Esther's previous loans were all used to increase her supplies of charcoal. These loans have all been successfully repaid. Esther aims to use her 8th loan to once again increase her stock of charcoal.

Esther will share this loan with her loan group Mrangirangi, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Esther can be seen on the far right in the back row.

loans.use: Increase stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: O. Béatrice est née le 13 Février 1961 et habite Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis une douzaine d’année. C’est une veuve qui est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et dont deux ne sont plus à sa charge. Béatrice vit donc seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les différentes charges du foyer. Il y a près de treize ans que Béatrice mène comme activité la vente des céréales et des produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, riz, etc.) ainsi que des condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, épices, etc.) à son domicile. Béatrice s’approvisionne au marché de Houègbo, dans le département de l’Atlantique.  C’est la première fois que Béatrice sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire à travers ses produits vendus.
texts.en: Beatrice O. was born on February 13, 1961. She has been living in Agbalilamè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, for about a dozen years. She is a widow and the mother of five children, all of whom study and two of whom are no longer in her care. Béatrice lives with her children and provides for the household by herself. Almost 13 years ago she first started selling cereals and groceries (corn, beans, rice etc) as well as sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, pimentos, spices etc) out of her house. Beatrice stocks up at the Houègbo market, in the Atlantic Department. This is the firs time that Beatrice is seeking a loan for ALIDé, with the goal of strengthening her business and increasing the revenues brought in from her sales.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals and groceries

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con cuatro hijos y tiene grado de instrucción de primaria completa.
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de queso, quinua lavada y trabajos en artesanía. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles,  dinero que fue utilizado en su negocio.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que invertirá en su negocio.
Su sueño es  tener vacas lecheras de calidad. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank “Santiago Apóstol,” located in the Paucarcolla district in the province and department of Puno.  She is 55 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She has an elementary school education.

Carmen buys and sells cheese, washed quinoa, and handicrafts.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she used in her business.

Now she requests a new loan of 300 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in her business.

Her dream is to have quality milk cows.  What she likes about her communal bank are the savings she can accumulate.

loans.use: to invest in her business selling cheeses and washed quinoa

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 33 year old single man, and the owner of a wood factory for the past 10 years, with 21 years of experience in the business. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time, in order to expand his business through buying more wood to work on. As usual, his previous loan had a positive effect on his business. Ali hopes to open a larger factory in the future to improve his living and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.en:
Jumakan S. is a 52-year-old farmer and has seven grown children. She lives with her family in the north of Kyrgyzstan, in Kyzyl-Tuu village. 

Jumakan is engaged in cattle breeding and cultivation of kidney beans and perennial herbs, which she started with the initial capital of 5,500 KGS.    

Being a persistent person, Jumakan works hard and was able to enlarge her herd of livestock to one horse, one milch cow, and 15 sheep and earns about 8,000 KGS monthly.  Her tireless activity led Jumakan to obtain two loans from Bai Tushum and Partners to purchase livestock, loans which were repaid without any delays. 

Jumakan plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to expand her herd of cows and to purchase mineral fertilizers to fertilize land that will lead to  an increased harvest and top-quality products. With future revenue, Jumakan plans to purchase a good fence for her house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing goods in larger quantity

loans.name: Mercedes Consuelo

texts.es:
Mercedes de 31 años, escogió la actividad de comerciante porque la mama le enseño como administrar un negocio ya que ella tenía un bazar para mantener el hogar. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicaciones mercedes ha trabajado para surtir su pequeño negocio con cuadernos, pañales, cuadernos etc. Por el momento su mama le ayuda en el negocio para que ella tenga tiempo para sus estudios. 

Sus planes para el futuro es seguir trabajando en su negocio y con el préstamo comprar pañales, cuadernos, zapatos para tener más surtido el negocio y que sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de un segundo piso.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 31 years old.  She chose to become a saleswoman because her mom taught her how to run a business as she had a small store through which she supported their household.

Little by little, with effort and commitment, Mercedes has worked to stock her small business with exercise books, diapers, etc.  At the moment, her mom helps her in her business so that she has time for her studies.  Her future plans are to continue working in her business and to use her loan to buy diapers, exercise books and shoes to better stock her store so that her customers have more variety when they come to buy from her.  In the future, she would like to add a second level to her home.

loans.use: To buy diapers and exercise books

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel R. lives in the village of Bacungan. He is 36 years old, married, and makes a living by selling fish. He has been in this line of work for more than one year and makes about 15,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Alberto joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for his third loan, for 20,000 PHP, to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand a fish-selling business

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D., 51, agrees that once a person has a family, he or she is rich; that is why she values her family much. Julieta reached college before getting married to Aristardo, a businessman. At present, they work hand-in-hand in making their business grow and become sufficient enough to support their daily living. Julieta uses her learning from CCT* as a Community Partner to boost her business. Together, they lived in Tanza, Cavite.

Being a fruits vendor is Julieta's main occupation. She has a commercial space in the public market of their community, where daily she sells fresh fruits to household people who go to the market to buy some real food. Other than fruits, she also sells barley products. This business she operates without any employees working for her, and monthly she earns roughly Php 12,000.

To help her grow her business, Julieta applies for a Php 8,000 loan. She will use the money to buy more quantities of fruits for sale, specifically bananas and mangoes. She also plans to buy supplementary materials like salt and plastic.

Julieta admits having lots of competitors in the market that have the same products she has. Also, the death of her mother led them to use part of the capital to pay medical expenses. But Julieta believes that she can surpass these challenges and make her business grow. She plans to have a commercial space for a fruit stand in a shopping mall, where more people can serve as prospective customers. Julieta desires to make her business really profitable, because by it she can assure a bright future for her family, her utmost treasure.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchasing of additional quantities of fruits for sale

loans.name: Hourt

texts.en:
Hourt S., 42, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells snacks and cakes at a local public school, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 45 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of maize, potatoes, and eggs.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly T. is from the village of Mainit, Iligan City. He is 31 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Rolly owns and operates a business providing motorela or habal-habal (a motorcycle that is encased in a carriage with 2 rows of seats facing each other) services to local community members. Rolly has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Rolly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase tools needed to maintain his service. Rolly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools and utilities needed to provide service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rolly from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools and utilities to provide service

loans.name: C9212 Mutimawurugo Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 52 years old.  She is widowed and has seven children between 14 and 20 years old. She is the president of a group called “Mutimawurugo." Agnes sells clothing at the local market. The others in the group have businesses selling beans at the local market. Agnes employs one person in her business and has been working for one year in this business. She is the first person on the left side in the photo, wearing white and black.

Agnes has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy more clothing to sell. She would like to use any profits generated to start saving and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard B. lives in Yerevan with her husband and two children. Alvard is a teacher, but her salary is very low. Alvard is also engaged in clothing sales. The main income comes from  sales and is not enough to meet her school-aged children’s needs. 

Alvard wants to increase her income and develop her business. With the requested loan she plans to purchase more clothes for resale. With the loan’s help Alvard will get more income and will be able to insure better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to pay for new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Oscerlin

texts.en:
Oscerlin B. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old, single, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Oscerlin owns and operates a kindergarten. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing kindergarten school services in the local community. Oscerlin has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,800 PHP a month.

In 2011, Oscerlin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscerlin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Oscerlin is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the classroom. This loan will be Oscerlin's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her  family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the classroom

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 43 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Yony de 18 y Lesly de 15 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Recorriendo las calles del distrito de Ancon, Marlene realiza su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y es una vendedora muy convincente, motivo por el cual sus productos se venden muy rápido y tiene que renovarlos constantemente. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a él, puede brindarles a sus hijos los estudios que se merecen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que mejor actuaran sobre su piel, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus productos de belleza. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo el dinero en su negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de donde elegir.
texts.en: Marlene is 43 years old; she is a humble and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her 2 loving children, Yony who is 18 years old and Lesly who is 15, Sonia would like to give them a better quality of life. Marlene works traveling through the streets of Ancon as she sells makeup and is a very good saleswoman which is why her products are sold quickly and has to keep restocking her products constantly. Marlene feels that her work is very profitable since thanks to it she is able to give her children the education they deserve. What she enjoys most about her work is giving advice to her customers about the products that will help their skin. Marlene has worked for 10 years in this field and says that the most difficult aspect of her job is walking around all day looking for customers. In the future she would like to set up a store where she can sell her products with more convenience. This is her second loan with MFP and is very happy to be able to get it and says that she will use all of it for her business since she wants to improve her life. She is a very happy-go-lucky member of her communal bank. With the fifteen hundred nuevos soles, she will buy more beauty products to be able to give her customers a greater variety of products for them to choose from.

loans.use: buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 60 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, milk, other groceries, etc. 

Rosalia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 34 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Rosalia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les  6 membres du groupe DANAYA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KAMBA, qui est debout en deuxième position à gauche, enfant au dos,  fait le commerce de  pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 balles de pagnes wax au prix d’en gros au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et souvent à Bamako.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Les  6 membres du groupe DANAYA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KAMBA, qui est debout en deuxième position à gauche, enfant au dos,  fait le commerce de  pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 balles de pagnes wax au prix d’en gros au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et souvent à Bamako.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.

loans.use: Pour acheter des pagnes wax

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 29 year old, is married with two children, six and three years old. Every month Heng spends $43 on food and $18 on other expenses.

Heng is a garment factory worker, and her husband sells sand. Their income totals $7.50 a day. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for the family’s use. Her husband’s business is progressing, and she wants to extend his business to make more income.

Heng plans to repair her house so as to be more comfortable and will work hard with her husband to send her children to study at the university. She wants them to work in a bank or in a microfinance company just like CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family’s use.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old.  She is engaged in  a hog-raising business. She raises her pigs in her backyard and sells them at the market. Evangeline’s husband is a farmer. She helps him grow rice crops and sell their harvest.

Evangeline requested a loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins, rice seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that her business and her husband's farming will grow. She also hopes that her family’s living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins, rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jesuwehuhlontche Group

texts.fr: JESUWEHUHLONTCHE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et qui vivent tous au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Florentine Mahoutin (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Cosme. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Florentine Mahoutin et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Florentine Mahoutin a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Depuis deux ans, Florentine Mahoutin mène comme activité la vente de produits de quincaillerie dans une ville du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi faire face aux besoins de ses enfants. Florentine Mahoutin s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Florentine Mahoutin sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les membres du groupe JESUWEHUHLONTCHE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
JESUWEHUHLONTCHE is a group of three persons whose members are friends all living in Benin. The group’s representative, Florentine Mahoutin (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 41 years old. She is married to a retailer by the name of Cosme. They have two children, both in school and in their care. Florentine Mahoutin and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the various family expenses are covered. 

Florentine Mahoutin dropped out of primary school.  For two years, she has been selling hardware in a city in Benin. This business generates revenues thus helping her to cope with her children’s needs. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, she and the other members of the group JESUWEHUHLONTCHE are requesting a second loan. They will use this loan to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy hardware goods

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a single woman with five children, two boys and three girls. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of purchasing a plot to establish her own house in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of onions, ginger and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of onions, ginger and green vegetables.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children aged 17, 16 and 6. She is engaged in farming and hog raising. Thelma's husband is the one who mainly manages their farm and Thelma spends most of her time raising pigs in their backyard. She also helps work at their farm when she can. They grow rice and corn crops to sell.  

Thelma has requested a loan to purchase 4 sacks of pig feed, 2 sacks of fertilizers and 2 quarts of herbicides. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is married to a farmer and they live happily in a village with their two children. They cultivate their farm, planting rice and vegetables for sale. These are the main sources of their income.Since their children are now at the college level, they are in need of more financial support. In this regard, they put up a welding shop in their village to generate additional income. 

To provide better service and customers' satisfaction, Leonida wants to ask for an additional capital of P8,000 to buy welding rods, hammers, steel and other welding materials. They believe that this loan will help a lot to strengthen the business. In the future, they are hoping that their business will become viable and profitable to give their children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, hammers, steel and other welding materials to provide a better service.

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en:
Agneta has been fishing in Naivasha town at Lake Naivasha for the last six years.  She sells all the fish at the local market in Naivasha town.  She is 48 years old, married to Joseph, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She repaid both her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a new fishing boat.

In future, Agneta hopes to open up a fish processing company.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Madame Magatte est une femme divorcée de 29 ans qui vit au Sénégal, dans l’une de ses banlieues. Elle est mère d’un enfant de 8 ans et a l’entière charge de sa mère. Elle évolue dans le commerce d’habillement  depuis 2 ans. Elle a choisi son  activité par passion  mais aussi par nécessité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis un an. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de nouveautés en habits. Actuellement  son objectif  est de diversifier les produits qu’elle vend. Elle espère  pouvoir élargir son activité  de commerce  qui est en pleine expansion en diversifiant les marchandises qu’elle commercialise.
texts.en: Ms. Magatte is a 29-year-old divorced woman who lives in a suburb in Senegal. She has one child, aged 8, who is entirely in her care. She has been involved in selling clothes for two years. She chose this activity both from interest and from necessity. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC for one year. She is seeking a loan of 200,000 Frs destined for the purchase of novelties and clothing. Her current goal is to diversify the products she sells. She hopes to be able to enlarge her business, which is rapidly growing, by diversifying the merchandise she sells.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chimako

texts.en:
Chimako is a married man with four school-going children. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Chimako has operated a cafe for the past four years; his potential customers are local area residents. He faces a major challenge of lack of customers especially during the weekend. He dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.
