With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his business.

loans.name: Nofah

texts.en:
Nofah is 48 years old and a married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of 6 children. She sells accessories and home products. She started the business by selling only tea cups then she expanded into many other necessary home products in addition to accessories.

Nofah is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase more products to sell so that she increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell.

loans.name: Izzatoi

texts.ru: Иззатой трудолюбия женщина. Она замужем и у них 5 детей. Её муж пенсионер и ей необходимо работать на содержании семьи. С детство она научилась выращивать растение и овощи. Она работает на сельском хозяйстве с удовольствием более 7 лет. Иззатой выращивает овощи, а потом после сбора урожая продает за выгодную цену. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и ГСМ. А часть займа хочет использовать за оплаты труда работников. Она заранее благодарна вам за ваше внимание и доброты.
texts.en: Izzatoi is a hard-working woman. She is married and has five children. Her husband has retired, and it is essential for her to work in order to support the family. When she was a child, she learned to grow various plants including vegetables. She has enjoyed working in agriculture for more than seven yeras. Izzatoi grows vegetables, and after harvest, she is able to sell them for a good price. She would like to expand her business and make a good profit. She would like a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer and fuel. She will also use part of the loan to pay for manual labour. She is thankful in advance for your time and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel, and to pay for labour

loans.name: Dionela

texts.es:
Dionela de 21 años de edad, convive hace 2 años con Nilton. Ambos tienen un hijo de 2 años. Esta familia habita un hogar propio en el distrito de La Unión. Con sus tres parcelas de terrenos agrícolas, heredados de la madre de su esposo, Dionela ha podido desempeñarse con éxito estos 2 años que lleva como madre familia. De esa manera hace producir  espinacas, orégano y manzanilla.  “Este mes es temporada de espinacas, vendo 3 atados por 2 soles, en la ciudad de Lima el precio es mayor”, menciona. Además agrega que, con la venta de orégano también obtiene ingresos considerables, esta planta también la lleva para la capital del país, donde cuenta con clientes que le hacen pedidos para sus empresas de sazonadores y condimentos. Dionela, a su corta edad ha experimentado ciertos fracasos o pérdidas, las que se debieron en su mayoría, ala falta de capital. Ese problema fue solucionado gracias a la ayuda de sus padres y suegros quienes le hicieron préstamos. Ahora Dionela cuenta con fondos para seguir trabajando.
En el futuro, ella ansía contar con una estabilidad económica que le permita acceder a servicios de calidad, como alimentación, educación para su hijo, y talvez darse algunos lujos. “Con fe todo se puede”, finaliza. Gracias a su ayuda Dionela accederá a su segundo préstamo de MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En cuanto al trabajo con su banco comunal dice sentirse a gusto y esperanzada con los trabajos siguientes. Con el crédito, ella podrá adquirir fertilizantes para esparcirlos en sus terrenos. Además comprará semillas de arvejas y espinacas para la temporada de febrero.
texts.en:
Dionela, 21, has lived with Nilton for two years.  They have a 2-year-old son.  This family lives in their own house in La Unión District.  With the three parcels of farmland inherited from her husband’s mother, Dionela has been able to develop successfully these two years she’s been a mother.  She produced spinach, oregano and chamomile.  “This month is spinach season; I sell three bunches for 2 soles.  The price in the city of Lima is higher,” she mentions.  She also adds that she makes considerable profits with the oregano sales.  She also takes this plant to the national capital where she has customers who place orders for their condiment and spice factories.  At Dionela’s young age she has already experienced certain failures or losses that were due for the most part on lack of capital.  That problem was solved thanks to help from her parents and in-laws who made loans to her.  Now, Dionela has the funds she needs to continue working.

In the future, she hopes to have economic stability that will allow her to access quality services like food and education for her son and maybe even give herself a few luxuries.  “With faith, everything is possible,” she finishes.  

Thanks to your support, Dionela will get her second MFP loan and for this reason she commits to being punctual with her installment payments.  As far as work in the communal bank is concerned, she says she feels at ease and hopeful with the coming tasks.  With the loan, she will be able to acquire fertilizer to spread in her fields.  She will also buy pea and spinach seeds for the February planting season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pea and spinach seeds.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Isabel María tiene 61 años de edad es casad a tiene cuatro hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 43, 40,42 y 39 años de edad  en el cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC ALAS DE CRISTO  se encuentra ubicada en las calles sucre y Ernesto Briones, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Comerciales en General.

Isabel se dedica a trabajar vendiendo comida ofrece desayunos, almuerzoa, meriendas. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en el comisariato. Solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, carnes, frutas.

Con la ayuda del crédito tendría mayores ingresos.El Sueño es poder tener un carro, No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.

En los momentos libres le gusta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Isabel María is 61 years old, is married, and has four children.  She lives in the canton Ventanas, in the province of los Ríos, with her husband and with her children who are 43, 40, 42, and 39 years old.

The VRC ALAS DE CRISTO [Wings of Christ] is located on the streets of Sucre and Ernesto Briones.  It is located in the canton Ventanas and is focused on commercial labor in general.

Isabel works selling food.  She offers breakfast, lunch, and snacks.  She makes purchases and sales in the store.  She is asking for the loan to purchase vegetables, meats, and fruits.

With the help of the loan she would have better income.  Her dream is to be able to have a car.  She has not presented any kind of problem.

In her free time she likes to read the Bible.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, and fruits.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 30-year-old business lady from Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is a single lady who has been in the school business for the last three years. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD., and this marks her third borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more textbooks for her school and use the anticipated profit to expand her school by building more classrooms for students. 

She hopes to see her school grow into a large educational institution.

loans.use: to purchase more textbooks for her school.

loans.name: Uzbek

texts.ru: Узбек женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Жена домохозяйка. С детство он любил скот и всегда ухаживал за скотом и помогал отцу, тогда его отец занимался скотоводством. После распада СССР Узбек потерял  работу, он был механиком колхоза. Сейчас он занимается купле- продажей скота и за счет этого бизнеса содержит свою семью. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. А потом хочет сыграть свадьбу дочки, то есть выдать её замуж. Узбек запрашивает займ чтобы купить корм для скота на запас в зимний период. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Uzbek is married and is a responsible father of four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Uzbek has loved livestock since childhood, always took care of it and helped his father, when his father was involved in animal husbandry.  After the breakup of the USSR, Uzbek lost his job as a mechanic at a collective farm.  Currently, he is involved in buying and selling livestock and supports his family with the income from this business.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit, and then hold a wedding for his daughter, i.e. to marry her off.  Uzbek is requesting this loan to purchase animal feed for his livestock to store for the winter period.  He relies on your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed for livestock

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 27 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Acomayo pero vive en el poblado de Rio Grande de la provincia de Urubamba, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella trabaja en un condominio donde realiza actividades como por ejemplo limpieza, lavado, cocina y otras más, ella trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 12 de medio día o desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde este horario depende si los dueños del condominio se encuentran. Ya es un año que trabaja y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Sonia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para educación  y para alimentación de sus hijos. 

Sonia es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba. La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.
texts.en:
Sonia is 27 years old and in a common law marriage from which she has two children. She was born in the province of Acomayo but lives in the village of Rio Grande in Urubamba province. She is a very  enterprising and hard-working woman who helps her family to get ahead. She works in a condominium where she performs activities like cleaning, washing, cooking, and other services. She works from 8 in the morning until noon or from 8 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. Her schedule depends on whether the owners of the condominium are there. She has been at this job for a year and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. At this time, Sonia needs a loan for personal use - for her children's education and nutrition.

Sonia is a member of the "Nueva Visión de Rumichaca" ["New Vision of Rumichaca"] Communal Bank, which is comprised of 19 members who all live in Urubamba province. The province of Urubamba is located north of the city of Cusco, on the shores of the Vilcanota River. It is a zone known as the "Valle Sagrado" ["Sacred Valley"] thanks to its temperate climate, fertile land, and abundant streams that make the valley one of the most beutiful places on the planet.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education and nutrition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is a 27 year old married woman. She describes herself as determined and flexible. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services, such as plaiting, blowdrying, etc., and sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to  buy more beauty products and also shoes and clothes for her boutique. Her business goal is to run a bigger boutique within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, as well as shoes and clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en:
Jokudu lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 45 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Jokudu heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a permanent resident of Mbarara municipality. He is 61 years old. He is married and has eight children and two dependents.  All his children and dependents go to school. He was a soldier in the Ugandan military forces, but he retired early because he was injured in a bomb blast that affected his back.

After his retirement, Alex resorted to poultry farming, which enabled him and his family to survive.  This activity made him prosper in life, and even helped him to build a semi-permanent house to accommodate his family.  He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 UGX, which he will use to buy materials for the completion of the house.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip is a 51-year-old proud father of 5 children.  He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District.  Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Philip has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Philip described his harvest last year as good, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.  With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Philip’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open up a drug shop.

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en: Fizuli is an IDP from Kelbadjar district of Azerbaijan. He came to Baku in 1993. He is married, has a child. In 2002-2006 he borrowed four loans totaling $4000 from Normicro Baku branch. Now he would like to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is 21 years old and is married with one child.  She grew up with her mother and father labouring on their family plantation to bring in enough income to support their large family.  Now it is Epenesa’s turn to provide for her family, and she is trying to develop her banana plantation to do so.  She wants to cultivate her land so that the banana crop can bring in a steady income for her family’s future.  She brings her crop to her local village market as well as those markets in neighbouring villages for sale.  She is passionate about ensuring that her child has a future full of opportunity, and is thus anxious to reinvest in her land.  She will use loan funds to purchase fertilizer and pest control agents to improve her crop yield.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pest control agents for plantation

loans.name: Saba Din

texts.en: Saba D. lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He is married. He lived for a long time in other countries. He has good experience in shopkeeping. He has a small ice cream shop.  He wants to take an individual loan to buy new ice cream machines  and also rent a new and larger shop to attract more clients and make a good monthly income to help his family. He is very happy with this loan. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy ice cream machines

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es:
I have been selling clothes and sports accessories for more than 15 years. Both my husband and I work in this business, which is my family’s source of income. Thanks to God, sales have gone well, but we want to stock up on merchandise during these cold times, and video games, since the majority of our clients are young athletes, who are asking for sports video games. We are requesting a $1200 loan, in order to buy merchandise and video games, build up our stock and increase the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 15 años en el negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios deportivos. En este negocio, que es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia, trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Gracias a Dios nos ha ido muy bien en la venta, pero queremos surtir más mercancía ahora en tiempo de frío, y video juegos, ya que la mayoría de los clientes que tenemos son jóvenes deportistas que nos están solicitando videojuegos de deportes. Estamos solicitando un préstamo de $1200, para comprar mercancía y video juegos, y tener más inventario y más ingresos para la familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and video games.

loans.name: Lili'a

texts.en: Lili'a is a mother of 42 years of age, married with 7 children. Her husband works for one of the hotels in town. Unfortunately his salary is not enough to support them. Lilia thought of doing something so she could earn some money instead of relying on her husband. Selling pancakes from her home was easy for her, and many people buy pancakes, especially for breakfast. Lilia is thankful for being allowed to borrow from SPBD so that she can now earn money and buy whatever she needs.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancake business

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude proudly calls herself a fashion designer. She is 41 and single with three children. She also cares for eight dependents. For the past three years, she has operated a storefront where she has two sewing machines. One is electric and one is manual, used when the electricity goes out. Her clients choose a pattern from one of the pattern books, then they select the material. When their choices are made, Gertrude quotes a price, which is often less than what the item would cost in a store. Sometimes a customer wants to buy a gomesi, or traditional dress. This is only sold as a custom-made garment and can be quite elaborate. 
There are different levels of tailoring shops in the villages. Some are simple, on the street: just a bag of scrap cloth, a foot-powered sewing machine, some thread and a bench to sit on. Others, like Gertrude's, have a storefront, with several sewing machines, a variety of cloth and embroidery to choose from and books from which to choose patterns. 
Gertrude learned this trade as a young girl, and it is very good for young girls to have a skill if they don't get formal education. Often in villages, it is considered more important that boys stay in school. Without a formal education, young girls become very vulnerable. So, learning a trade or skill which can be practiced in their village is vital. 
To become a tailor is usually a two-year course. During these two years, girls learn sewing skills, independence and self-esteem. The people that start these schools usually have a shop themselves and the classes are a labor of love for these young girls. Gertrude exudes confidence, a confidence born by learning a skill. With her loan, she will buy more cloth and embroidery for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth and embroidery for her business

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.ru:
M. Vuqar was born in 1966 in the village of Padakirshlak located in Ahsuniyski region. He has 3 children. He has been in the business of animal breeding for 5 years. This hardworking person always tries to provide for his family. He is seeking a loan from Normicro to purchase several more cows.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Мюзаффарли Вугар родилься 1966 году в село Падаркышлак Ахсуниского района. Семейный, имеет троих детей. Пять лет подряд занимается скотоводством. Этот трудолюбивый человек всегда старается обеспечивать свою семью. 2007 году он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Вугар хочеть купить еще несколько коров.

loans.use: To  purchase additional cows

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Mr. Gilberto is 44 years old and married. He has two children of 8 and 11 years of age, attending elementary school, and a 19 month old baby. Mr. Gilberto runs a small grocery store located at his home. When opportunities arise, he also does photography jobs, in order to obtain a higher income and greater benefits for his family. His wife works at home and when he is not present, helps running the store.

The roof of Mr. Gilberto’s house is in very bad shape, so he is requesting the loan in order to buy zinc sheets to replace it. He also needs to build the left wall of his house, currently made out of wood pieces. Mr. Gilberto, as every family head, wishes the best for his family, and to be able to give them a dignified life and a comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Gilberto tiene 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, de 8, 11 y un bebé de 19 meses de nacido. Los dos hijos mayores se encuentran cursando la escuela primaria. Don Gilberto posee una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, y en las oportunidades que salen, se dedica también a la fotografía, todo en busca de mejores ingresos y beneficios para su familia. Su esposa es ama de casa y en los tiempos que no está Don Gilberto, ella le ayuda con la administración de la pulpería.

El techo de la vivienda de don Gilberto se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, por lo que requiere el préstamo para comprar láminas de zinc y cambiar el techo de su casa. También necesita construir la pared izquierda de su casa, que actualmente está hecha con pedazos de madera. Don Gilberto, como todo padre de familia, desea lo mejor para su familia y darles una vida digna y una casa cómoda.

loans.use: Roof repair and building of a wall at his home.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.en:
Zenobia has been a member if the community bank “Minka” for six years. Through the community bank she has learned manage her finances responsibly.

Zenobis is 39 years old. She is a single mother and has three children. Zenobia runs a store from her home where she sells rice, sugar, and flour, as well as fruits and vegetables. Previously, Zenobia traveled to the city of Lima where she bought groceries in bulk and then sold them to stores in Ayacuchho. In addition, Zenobia sells spices in the Covadonga market.

Zenobia needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy beer, soft drinks, sugar, chicken, oil, and milk.

Zenobia plans to use her profits to buy a motorcycle taxi so that her son will be able to work as a taxi driver. Her dream is to have her three children grow up to be successful business people.

loans.use: To buy beer, soft drinks, sugar, chicken, oil, and milk.

loans.name: Puapuaga

texts.en: Puapuaga is a hardworking woman with three children. She spends hard labor on the farm that supports her family. She repayed her previous loans well and is always trying to better her small business. She sells her bananas every week at the Fugalei Market in Apia town. With her requested loan, she plans to purchase more planting materials and agricultural supplies to expand her farm.

loans.use: To purchase additional planting materials, agricultural supplies, and some farm tools like long knives, rakes, planting sticks.

loans.name: Francisco Arturo

texts.es:
A general store, like any other business, requires a great deal of investment as the increasing number of competitors obliges merchants to improve their sales levels. Mr. Francisco E., originally from South San Rafael, runs a general store and is conscious of this need.

Despite his long-standing difficult economic situation, Francisco has been able to bring food home to his family, which consists of his wife and three children. Today, he has come to Ceprodel in order to benefit from a loan that allows him to purchase the merchandise he needs for his general store. Francisco, his business and his family will all benefit from the loan, since he will sell the products he acquires in his store and thus generate more income.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

El negocio de pulpería como cualquier otro requiere de mucha inversión por el hecho de que hoy en día surgen mas competidores que obligan a los comerciantes a mejorar su nivel de ventas. Consciente de esta situación, el señor Francisco E. originario del municipio de San Rafael del Sur se dedica al negocio de pulpería en su localidad de habitación.

A pesar de su difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado ha logrado llevar el alimento a su casa de habitación que se compone de su esposa y tres hijos. Hoy en día el señor Francisco acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de su mercadería. Al obtener el crédito se beneficiara el mismo, su negocio y su familia ya que al adquirir los productos los comercializará en el negocio y esto hará que se generen mas ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Margaret Kasweera’S Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 24 years old and lives in Nalukolongo, a neighborhood near the outskirts of Kampala. She is married with two children, both in school. For the past three years, she has been making candles using a machine her husband bought that enables her to make 12 large candles at a time. She trained with Indians who taught her how to use the machine and, with her first loan from MCDT, started her candle-making business. She sells to shops at wholesale and at retail along the roadside. A box of wax ranges in cost from 45,000 to 50,000/= (Ugandan shillings, between $27-$29 US). She makes a profit of about 50,000/= per box of wax.

With this new loan, she would like to buy a second machine that makes 50 candles at a time in a smaller size. The profit from her business will make it possible for her children to continue their studies and for her family to construct a house.

She has successfully paid back more than five loans.

loans.use: To purchase new candle-making machine to produce more candles of smaller sizes

loans.name: Alba Luz's Group

texts.es: hola mi nomnre es Alba Luz V. tengo 35 años de edad, tengo 2 hijos a los cuales quiero mucho, estoy casada, mi actividad principal es la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 5 años en la experiencia del manejo y administracion de mi negocio, el cual a crecido en los ultimos 2 años y la demanda es bastante y no tengo capital para invertir en productos, por tal razon estoy solicitaqndo ayuda monetaria para poder cumplir con todas las necesidades de mis clientes.

loans.use: compra de carnes, lacteos, refrescos, manteca, aceite, sal, azucar, jabon, embutidos, churros, papel higienico, salsas, chiles, desinfectantes

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane A. is 49 years old, married and the father of 3 children, all of whom attend school. He has lived for many years in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Being a food merchant, he wishes to use this loan to increase his business capital which will allow him to then increase his stock of merchandise. The profits from his business will allow him to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Ousmane A. est âgé de 49 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il est depuis des années à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit augmenter son fond de commerce pouvant lui permettre de augmenter son stock de marchandises étant un particulier commerçant d’alimentation générale. Les gains issus de son activité permettront à monsieur Ousmane de réaliser plus de bénéfice et de faire face aux besoins de sa famille

loans.use: To increase his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Mr. Arnaldo Z. is 48 years old and married to Ms. Julia Ramirez, 40 years old. They hae 8 children, who live with them and are students.

Arnaldo, who was in search of work traveled to Argentina, where he spend a good deal of time working and with a small amount of savings, he was able to return to our country in approximately 2002. He decided to invest in the purchase of tools and materials to work as an ironworker, making chairs made of metal and cables (in Paraguay metal and colored cable chairs, which are usually used in the garden, are very popular) and other iron works.

He is requesting this loan in order to purchase more materials such as; cables, pipes, gas, oxigen and others, taking into account that materials are expensive and that he need them in large quantities.

He is confident that if one works with dedication, effort and determination one will progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Arnaldo Z. de 48 años de edad, esta casado con la señora. Julia Ramírez de 40 años, la pareja tienen 8 hijos todos viven con ellos, todos están estudiando.

Don Arnaldo que en busca de trabajo viajó a la Argentina, donde paso un buen tiempo trabajando y con un pequeño ahorro volvió a nuestro país aproximadamente en el año 2.000, y decidió invertir en la compra de herramientas y materiales para realizar trabajos de herrería, fabricar sillones de metal y de cables (en Paraguay son muy populares los sillones hechos de cables de colores que generalmente se usan en el jardín) entre otros.

La solicitud de crédito es para comprar mas materiales tales como: cordones, caños, gas, oxígeno y otros, teniendo en cuenta que los materiales son caros y el lo necesita en grandes cantidades.

El confía que si trabajamos con mucho esfuerzo, empeño y dedicación progresaremos.

loans.use: Buy materials such as: cables, tubing, gas, and oxygen.

loans.name: Virgen De La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
L. comunidad D. Sachabamba, esta ubicado aproximadamente a una hora D. L. comunidad D. Condorccocha, pertenece al distrito D. Chiara y provincia D. Huamanga, esta Comunidad cuenta con aproximadamente con 80 familias que viven en L. comunidad, los comuneros se dedican a L. siembra D. cereales como trigo, cebada, maíz, arveja y tubérculos como papa, mashua, olluco, etc. L. comunidad tiene su propia feria ubicado en L. plaza principal.

Julia H. N., compra todo tipo D. cereales y tuberculos, los lleva a Ayacucho para comercializar. Julia desea mejorar su trabajo para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y sean profesionales. Julia desea ahorrar para invertir en L. educación D. sus hijos y tener su propio negocio.

Alicia Palomino, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, también en época escolar venD. zapatos y útiles. A Alicia le gustaría mejorar su tiendita D. abarrotes, para hacer estudiar a sus hijos, elL. desea que tengan mejores oportunidades.

Irma C. A., compra y venD. animales menores, también venD. queso. Le gustaría tener un carro para poder hacer mejor su negocio, para ello ahorrara mucho. DesD. que esta en Finca elL. dice que ha aprendido a respetarse a si misma y ahora sabe que también tiene las mismas facultades que los varones, hace bien su negocio y tiene dinero mas que su esposo, Irma aporta mas a L. casa en los gastos. Ha aprendido a capitalizarse y trabajar en equipo con las socias, ellas le dan sus productos, las compra y lleva a Ayacucho.
texts.en:
The community Sachabamba is located approximately one hour from the community Condorccocha. It is part of the District of Chiara and the Province of Huamanga. This community has about 80 families that live there. These people are dedicated to the cultivation of cereal grains like wheat, barley, corn, peas, and tubers like potatoes, olluco and mashua (local perennial tubers), etc. This community has its own market located in the central square. Julia H. N. buys all sorts of cereals and tubers, and she takes them to Ayacucho in order to sell them. Julia would like to improve her work so that her children would be able to study and become professionals. Julia would like to save in order to invest in the education of her children and to have her own business. Alicia Palomino has a snack store. When she was a student, she used to sell shoes and household goods. Alicia would like to enlarge her little snack store, in order that her children could study. She wants them to have better opportunities. Irma C. A. buys and sells small animals. She also sells cheese. She would like to have a car in order to improve her business, and for this she would save a great deal. Over time here on the farm, she says that she has learned to respect herself, and now she knows that she also has the same abilities as the men. Her business is going well and she has more money than her husband. Irma does a lot for the household expenses. She has learned to build capitol and work with tools with the women’s groups, they give her their products, and she buys them and takes them to Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loans for 15 Group Members

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Halima N. from mbeya. She is a widow with five children between the ages of 19 and 32. Since 2005, Halima has been running a bar where she sells soda, beer and pure drinking water. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Her bar is a good place to relax with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. You can relax on a plastic chair under a tree with a local beer in your hand and the aroma of roasting mishikaki (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to everyone who happens to wander by.

Halima currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 250USD in order to purchase additional stocks of beer, water, and soda. She plans to increase both the quantity and range of the stock. Halima thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer, water, and soda.

loans.name: Ok

texts.en: Mrs. Ok E. is a villager in Prey Kduoch village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now faces an obstacle because she does not have much money to hire laborers to harvest the rice. She decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Un Ou, is a construction worker who earns a little income to support the family. Mrs. Ok E. is 35 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school, while the other two are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest the rice on her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling clothing in her community.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo que estudia y la apoya mucho. Ella trabaja cuidando ancianos en un albergue, y por las noches o en momentos libres vende golosinas, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y le gusta hacerlo porque se relaciona con muchas personas. El deseo de Laura es contar con una vivienda adecuada y segura para su hijo, es por ello que con este crédito, que es el segundo que tiene con MFP quiere comprar materiales de construcción para ir poco a poco levantando su casa.
texts.en:
Laura is 32 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her son who is in school and who supports her a lot. She works caring for the elderly in a hostel, and in the evenings and during her spare time she sells candy and snacks. She has been doing this work for one year and enjoys it because she interacts with many people. Laura hopes to one day have a secure home for her son. She will use this loan, the second loan that she has received from MFP, to buy construction materials to gradually build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
A resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, Mrs. Mok T. earns a living growing mushrooms and raising pigs with her husband, earning around $5 per day. The couple currently resides with their two children, both of whom are single, one a local building worker who helps with the family's expenses.

Mok needs to expand her investments and is therefore asking for a loan to buy four piglets to raise and more seeds for mushroom growing.

loans.use: To buy four piglets to raise and more seeds to grow mushrooms.

loans.name: Kessi

texts.en:
Kessi owns a small shop  and has been a firewood seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 9 months. She belongs to Wachewaseme Group loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her shop and more firewood for re-sale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money for future use, and pay school fees for her youngest child.  

Kessi is 45  years old, divorced, and has four children: ages 28, 26, 24 and 9.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop and more firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Hiyam has owned a bakery since 2003. She has a saj oven in which she does mankoucheh or markouk. The saj is the metal oven where you make the saj bread, a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (thinned) bread, doughy confections or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza and its most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Hiyam requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for her work and change the décor of her bakery. This is the first time that Hiyam has requested a loan.

Hiyam is special in her work because she does it well and she is also the only one who does it in her neighborhood. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she was lucky to not have any difficulties. Hiyam decided on doing her business because her mankoucheh is good and plus, she always wanted to open a bakery. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and change the décor of her bakery

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Dembagnouman (sont toutes mariées), avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à Sanoubougou I   un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de  produits de beauté, de boissons, de fruits, de condiments etc.
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter 10 paquets de condiments alimentaires,  15 casiers de boissons et 10 cartons de produits de beauté.
Elles   s’approvisionnent  en générale au grand marché de Sikasso  auprès des grossistes et dans les villages environnants pour certains condiments auprès des paysans. Elles effectuent leurs ventes au marché et dans les quartiers d’une façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes , généralement  au comptant et en détail.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 15.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Dembagnouman group (all married), have an average age of 35 and on average, 3 children. They live in traditional extended families in Sanoubougou I, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They have various businesses, among others the sale of cosmetics, drinks, fruit, condiments, etc. They are on their first loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, they intend to buy 10 packs of condiments, 15 crates of drinks, and 10 cartons of cosmetics.

They do their buying generally from wholesalers at the big market in Sikasso, and in the surrounding villages from the farmers, in so far as certain condiments are concerned. They sell at the market and in the neighborhoods, door-to-door, to a clientele composed of women and men, generally retail and for cash.

They each expect to make a profit of 15,000 F CFA per month, of which part will be used for needs of their families and the rest will be invested back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Wara

texts.en: This is Wara D., age thirty-five. Wara was born in Makali, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a laboratory technician and the two have five children together. All of their children are still attending school, but for the youngest who is still suckling. Wara sells provisions and miscellaneous items. She is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help her strengthen her business.

loans.use: Expand  her business

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef has been working as a blacksmith since 2001. He is trusted in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networks. He is 38 years old and lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children.

Yousef has requested a loan of $2000 US  from Al Majmoua in order to purchase iron for his work. This is the first time that Yousef has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase iron

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells crates of drinks and sachet water. She hopes for a loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase a fridge to cool her drinks and sachet water. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge

loans.name: Julia Magaly

texts.es:
La señora Julia Magaly Briceño M. tiene 39 años, vive en la calle San Lucas Nº 702 del distrito de la Esperanza parte Baja, Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Estudió secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijas que dependen económicamente de ella.

Julia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes hace 15 días, inició su negocio vendiendo ropa por un lapso de 2 años, la cual desarrolla en su casa. Con su primer crédito de S/.300.00, que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de polos, casacas, pantalones.

Con este préstamo de S/.1500.00, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas y gaseosas para implementar su bodega.

Julia desea cumplir el sueño de tener su minimarket para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Julia Magaly Briceño M., 39, lives on San Lucas Street Nº 702, in the lower part of the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department. She has two daughters who are economically dependent upon her. Julia started selling groceries fifteen days ago. She started her business of selling clothes two years ago; the business is in her house. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from her Community Bank, Nueva Esperanza II, she bought polos, jackets, and pants. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy products like rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, and soft drinks to set up her store. Julia wishes to make her dream of having a mini market come true in order to grow as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and soft drinks to set up her mini market

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame   Bintou  Koussoubé est une veuve  de 43 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle  habite chez son feu mari dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses enfants et sa coépouse dans le quartier Pélengana Sébénikoro de la ville de Ségou (4ème  région administrative de la république  du Mali). 
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 6ème (système scolaire Malien) pour des raisons personnelles, elle commença le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après s’être intéressée à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle opta finalement pour le commerce d’habits depuis maintenant  2 ans, au marché château, en ambulant dans les différents quartiers et chez elle à la maison. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans ce commerce car ses habits sont des coupons de la CO.MA.TEX et  elle bénéficie d’une bonne clientèle car ses articles sont bons marchés presque à la portée de beaucoup de personnes.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation  depuis 30 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 50 pièces de pagnes Fancy sur place à Ségou et effectue sa vente, en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt  elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui va lui permettre de payer la scolarité de ses enfants vu que son mari n’est plus vie et également de rembourser ses dettes. 
Son ambition est d’être un import export  tel entre le Mali et le Burkina Faso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bintou Koussoubé is a widow of 43, mother of 6 children. She lives in the home of her late husband, in a traditional family, with her children and her co-spouse, in the Pélengana Sébénikoro neighborhood of the town of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having left school after the 6th grade (according to the school system of Mali) for personal reasons, she began in sales together with her mother, who sold condiments. After being interested in several money-earning ventures, she finally opted two years ago for selling clothing in the "château" market, as a door-to-door saleswoman, and out of her home. She has a good reputation in this business since the clothing she sells are lengths of cloth from CO.MA.TEX . She has a considerable clientele since these articles are so reasonably priced that many people can afford them.

In order to satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she came to Soro Yiriwaso with whom she has been working for 30 months. After 3 solidarity loans and 1 individual loan, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her second individual loan. She expects to use this loan to buy 50 lengths of Fancy-brand "pagne" (brightly colored African print cloth) right there in Ségou and she makes her sales, retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will permit her to pay school fees for her children, since her husband is no longer living, and also to pay off her debts.

Her ambition is to work in import-export between Mali and Burkino Faso.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of  "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda T. is from the village of Puntian, Quezon Bukidnon. She is fifty-two years old and married with three grown children. To make a living, Nilda owns and operates a specialized retail business, buying and selling agricultural products such as rice and corn in the local market. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $210 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used as additional business capital. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S. O. is a 48-year-old woman, married to Ou Choeun, age 51, and they both appear in the picture here. This old couple lives with four school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops O. their own farmland. San S. O. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest and collect her productivity when they are mature. Recently, her crop is not growing well because it is ravaged by insect and lawn. Because of that obstacle, San S. O. has decided to seek a loan to buy insecticide, which she will use to protect her crop.

loans.use: To buy insecticide

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth R. is a woman who believes that poverty is not a hindrance to success. She is 36 years old and married to Salvador who is 41 years old and a private employee. Elizabeth is the mother to three: a girl and two boys. She lives in the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Elizabeth is a busy woman engaged in the sale of vegetables, rice and sugar. In 2004, With her determination to improve and develop her business, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines with the hope of having access to capital for her business. Her previous loans were carefully used as rolling capital for her business. She has been running her business for four years already. It has brought her a good and justifiable income and she wants to invest more in it.

Now on her 7th loan, Elizabeth is requesting PHP 20,000 as additional rolling capital for her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for five sacks of sugar, assorted vegetables, four sacks of rice and to pay for transportation expenses. She is hopeful that her business will grow and will bring her enough proceeds to save for the future school fees of her children. She also dreams of having a mini-grocery store someday.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business and to pay for transportation expenses

loans.name: Mrs. Chek Pat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank Group consists of seventeen people who live in Chroung Sdau village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chek P. was selected the President of the group by its members. She is a good cook, hired by the villagers during wedding ceremonies and parties. Her husband, Mr. Yim Phorn, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectar field on which he cultivates rice. This field has infertile soil which is a challenge, because it affects his crop production. Fertilizer would help make the field more productive. Mrs. Chek P. decided to ask for a loan to buy the fertilizer. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a waiter, two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest is too young to work or study.

Seven members in this group have end-of-term loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The other group members have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Saom's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by two borrowers. Its leader, Mrs. V., 39, has a job cultivating a rice crop for a profit, while her husband works with her on the farm. This family now lives with their four teenage children, all of whom are attending school.

V. will be using her first loan from Kiva to buy rice in bulk to store as her stock supply during the coming harvesting season and then she will sell it when the rice is commanding its highest prices. This will provide her family with extra income.

The other borrower, Mrs. S., 38, sells grocery item from home, and is asking for a loan to purchase a quantity of her essential items to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk

loans.name: Satare Kahkashan Group

texts.en:
Sedeqa is the group leader of Satare Kahkashan group. There are four members in this group. All of them want to receive money for their business.
Sedeqa and Sallema want to take a loan for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Also Sameya wants take a loan for her business of weaver. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business. Sharifa wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to complete her stock. They are requesting a loan in the amount of 56,000 Afghani.
With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and their families in future.

loans.use: they are expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita D., 38 years old, is engaged into rice farming. She has six children. Her eldest child is 18 years old. She wants to make her business prosper so that she will be able to support the growing needs in their family. Marianita also wants to send all of her children to school. Her family relies totally on the income from their farm. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying all the farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y sus cinco hermanos en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la música desde hace más de seis años. Estudió en un instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo y aprendió a tocar la trompeta de varas. Actualmente trabaja en algunas bandas y orquestas de la región que contratan sus servicios de manera eventual. Los ingresos que percibe los utliza para apoyar al sostenimiento de la familia y solventar sus gastos personales.

Alberto nos cuenta orgulloso que hace poco creó junto a su familia una orquesta a la que han llamado Unión y Progreso. Por ahora sus integrantes se encuentran trabajando arduamente para comprar los instrumentos que necesitan para formalizarse y empezar a recibir contratos.

Debido a que la empresa que está formando junto a su familia aún necesita de capital y que los ingresos que percibe no le bastan para aportar al crecimiento de su orquesta, Alberto ha pensado en empezar a trabajar en el negocio de venta de ropa: tiene planeado comprar la ropa en la ciudad de Chiclayo y venderla a los pobladores de los caseríos aledaños, ya que la zona en donde vive no cuenta con las facilidades de transporte necesarias para trasladarse a la ciudad. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es hacer que su orquesta crezca y sea reconocida a nivel nacional. El es un joven trabajador, empeñoso y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Alberto is 28 years old and single. He lives with his parents and five siblings in the village of La Pava. This community is in the District of Mochumi, Lambayeque Province, located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Alberto has been pursuing music for more than 6 years. He studied at an institute in Chiclayo and learned how to play the trombone. He currently works with a few bands and orchestras in the region who hire him as needed. Alberto uses his earnings to contribute toward the household and cover his personal expenses.

He says that he is proud that his family recently formed a band called “Union and Progress”. For now they are working hard to buy all the instruments they need to become official and start booking engagements.

Since the family band is in need of capital and his earnings are not enough to cover the start-up costs, Alberto decided to start a business selling clothing. He plans to buy the merchandise in Chiclayo and sell his products to residents of the surrounding villages since public transportation is not available. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

His greatest hope is that his band will be successful and become recognized nationally. This young man is hardworking, determined, and very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola H. is 49 years old. She is married with five children. Lola is selling office supplies and supplies for school. The trading place is located in the central market. She has a wide range of goods and the majority of her customers are schoolchildren. In comparison with other big stores selling office supplies, Lola’s prices are lower and more attractive. She repaid her previous loan ahead of schedule and now she wants to take another loan because of the high demand for her goods. She requests 5,000 Somoni for purchasing the office supplies for selling. Lola has been a client of IMON for several years with the positive credit history and promises to repay this loan in a timely manner and thanks everyone for support.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Laura's Group

texts.en:
Laura L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Laura is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Laura owns & operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Laura joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Laura from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ramal

texts.en: Ramal A. lives in Baku city. He is 20 years old and single. Ramal has had a cattle breeding business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves.

loans.name: Haisam

texts.en:
Haisam is a 37 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their eight children. Haisam has been working as a taxi driver since 2000. He transports his customers in a van where he does long distance trips, from one village to another. 

When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Haisam is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and also because of his punctuality. He has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan allowed him to pay for his car expenses. 

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Imelda Pastora

texts.es: Imelda Pastora tiene 52 años, por lo que  su actividad económica es una librería. La fuerza emprendedora y las gansa de salir a cumplir con todos sus sueños son las que la motivan a salir adelante. Por lo que tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio, que está ubicada en su humilde vivienda en donde ofrece los productos necesarios, ya que se acerca la entrada a clases y quiere aprovechar ya que tiene ciertos pedidos, y será de gran ayuda para ella. El financiamiento es para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores, marcadores, hojas de block, folders y calculadora. Ella sueña con  incrementar su negocio, pues esto sería de gran importancia para ella.
texts.en:
Imelda Pastora, 52, has a bookstore. Her entrepreneureal spirit and wish to get ahead in life and see all her dreams come true motivate her to continue forward. She has been in this line of work for 10 years. Her store is located in her humble home. She stocks all those items that are necessary, especially now that the new school term is nearing; she wants to take advantage of the orders she has pending. This will be of great help to her. The funding will be used to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, markers, sheet of paper, folders and a calculator. She dreams with enlarging her business; this would be very important to her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stationery items.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda P. is a 66-year-old woman from the village of Malaubang in Ozamiz City. Rosalinda is separated from her husband and has 5 adult-age children. To earn a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. More specifically, she operates a restaurant, where she serves local foods to customers from her community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. In turn, she is hoping to improve her standard of living as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for additional working capital. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory and increasing her existing working capital

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 63-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Said has owned a grocery store since 2000. He sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, etc… He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. 

Said is special in his work because he opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. His customers are his friends, neighbors, and traders. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase a lot of merchandise. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to supplement his wife’s income, and also, he always wanted to work for himself. In future, he plans to keep on improving his store by diversifying his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma is a wife of S. N. who is a driver by profession. Both of them live in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Both of them are very hard-working. Asma prepares the embroider dresses and sells in the market of Lahore. She does this work to improve the standard of living. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband because currently he drives a rented rickshaw and receives the half of his struggle.

She is the group leader of four other ladies from her locality. Mumtaz wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Nasreen akhtar wants a loan to buy goats for her meat selling business. Bushra wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ruqaiya wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: In-Gie

texts.en:
In-gie O. is from the village of Brgy. 3, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 22 years old. In-gie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, In-gie owns and operates a business venture running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. In-gie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, In-gie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. In-gie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. In-gie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by In-gie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
la Señora Juana C. I. de 37 años de edad originaria del Paraje Chocruz, del Barrio Santa Ana Momostenango, actualmente se dedicaal amarrado de cintas para la elaboración de cortes, con el cual ella
debenga de un ingreso para poder mantener a su familia por la razón piensa aumentar de capital sobre un 
prestamo que solicita en la Asociación ASDIR, el cual se tomo la idea de formar un grupo de mujeres con el
fin de poder ayudarlas siempre y cuando tengan ese deseo de superarse, el cual lo integran 10 personas, 
ellas se dedican a la venta de telas para blusas, y otras a la venta de jugos, y entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana C. I. is 37 years old and originally from Paraje Chocruz, which is part of the neighborhood of Santa Ana Momostenango. She currently makes belts that are used in the production of women’s skirts, which allows her to earn income to support her family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Asociación ASDIR so that she can increase her capital.

Juana came up with the idea to form a group of women who could help each other and were like-minded in their desire to succeed. The group consists of ten people who are engaged in businesses such as selling fabric for blouses, juices, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Masio Ene

texts.en:
Masio has been a farmer for the last 9 years, specializing in wheat farming.  She is a 61-year-old widow with 6 children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan with the organization.  She plans to use the money to buy pesticides for her maturing wheat crop in the farm.

She hopes to buy a tractor in the near future.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her crop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with five children and all her children go to school.  She resides in and owns a five-room house. Her home acts as the Center meeting place.  She owns a charcoal store at home in Kisaasi central zone and sells to all categories of people. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She buys bags of charcoal from her home and doesn’t incur any transport costs.  She has been in this business for a long time.  Sarah works seven days a week. She aspires to educate her children up to university and start investing in second hand clothes. She joined MCDT because it was helping poor women. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie A. is from the village of Parabba, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 26 years old. Josie is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Josie owns and operates a business providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Josie has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Josie is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Josie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase recyclables to sell

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn B. lives in the village of Militar in Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 28 years old, married and has two young children. Jerlyn makes a living by running a small store where she sells products people use daily, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been in this line of work for more than a year, and makes about 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jerlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from GDMPC and is now applying for a new one for 10,000 PHP to continue expanding her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and pay for ploughing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: remodeling of rooms of her home

loans.name: Olonana  Ole

texts.en:
Olonana Ole L. is 31 years old. He is married to Noormeiseer L. and the father of three children. Olonana and his wife are farmers and they have been doing farming activity on their own piece of land for the last 10 years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend 30,000 shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizers for tomatoes, which he has already planted. He will spend the remaining 20,000 shillings to prepare land to plant more tomatoes .This area has favorable climatic condition for tomato farming, which is why he has been doing tomato farming successfully for many years. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plow a bigger piece of land to plant more.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and own some farm machinery to make his farming work easy.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizers and to prepare the land to plant more tomatoes

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B. sells cassava and plantain at Takoradi. She is married with two children and has received junior high education. Her husband is into carpentry. Adwoa helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Adwoa will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell. With the new earnings from her expanded business, she plans to invest in the sale of other foodstuffs.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and plantain to sell

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. is into the sale of secondhand clothing in Elmina. She has not received any formal education. She is divorced and takes care of four children. She has been in her business for ten years now. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional secondhand clothes to sell. She anticipates using the new profit from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy additional secondhand clothes for sale

loans.name: Las Mellisa Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Mellisa está conformado por Maria Josefa y Martha Lorena. Ambas tienen las mismas actividades económicas como es la venta de productos Avon, son mujeres muy responsables y se han unido para mejorar las condiciones de sus negocios. Maria Josefa sale todos los días de su vivienda para vender sus productos, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar las tareas diarias del hogar, ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Es por eso que juntas han decidido realizar este financiamiento para invertir en la compra de materia prima necesaria pues ambas tienen demanda de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Las Mellisa” consists of Maria Josefa and Martha Lorena. Both ladies have the same type of business, selling Avon products. They are responsible women who have joined together to improve the condition of their businesses.

Maria Josefa leaves home every day so that she can sell her products, so she must wake up early to complete her daily household chores. She has three young children who are in her care. For this reason, she has decided to request this loan so that she can invest in merchandise. Both of them experience demand from their customers that they must meet.

loans.use: Operating capital for buying merchandise

loans.name: Leticia Yamileth

texts.es:
la señora Leticia Yamileth H. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Ruben Dario Sarmiento tienen dos hijos. Leticia y su esposo tienen casa propia y viven comodamente.
