Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, es una tienda general en la que vende cosmeticos, perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, ganchos, sandalias, y muchas cosas mas. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años.
sus clientes son los vecinos, amigos y hermanos de la iglesia a la que asiste.
El credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para tener mas surtido su negocio y asi tener mayores ventas y mas ganancias.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que sus hijos son muy sanos y que todo le esta saliendo bien.
texts.en:
Leticia Yamileth H. is 34 years old and she is married with Mr. Ruben Dario Sarmiento.  They have two children together. Leticia and her husband own their own home and they live comfortably. Her business is located in their home and it is a general store from where she sells cosmetics, perfumes, deodorants, skin creams, hair accessories, sandals and many other items. She has had this business for the past 3 years.

Her clients are her neighbors, friends and her church family. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to have a greater variety of products in her business and in this manner, ensure greater sales and improved profits. 

She is very happy especially because her children are healthy and everything seems to be going well.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Giovana De Las M.

texts.es:
Giovana F. tiene 57 años vive en el barrio Villas de las Moras en el municipio de Soledad con su conyuge  y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 24 a 34 años. En este municipio caracterizado por la fabricación artesanal de las deliciosas butifarras(embutido) soledeñas, Giovana tiene su negocio que inició hace 2 años con la ayuda de su cónyuge, y es el  de vender   ropa y  calzado  que le representan un margen de contribución del 100%. Todas sus ventas las realiza a crédito, porque tiene una gran cantidad de clientes rentables, principalmente  participantes de la comunidad cristiana donde asiste y comparte las enseñanzas de Dios a los hombres. Así mismo Giovana tiene otro ingreso por  prestar el servicio  alquiler de lavadoras y  la venta de pasabocas empacados, pues últimamente también está vendiendo, chitos, tajaditas verdes, maduras, boliquesos entre los clientes que acceden a su servicio de lavadoras. Giovana realiza sus compras de ropa en un centro comercial ubicado  en el mercado de Barranquilla, donde le ofrecen un buen precio  y compra sandalias, zapatos tradicionales masculino y femenino, en su propio barrio a un microempresario que allí los fabrica. 
Como Giovana se está preparando para  responder a su clientela en el mes de Diciembre, época en la que las familias se integran alrededor de estas fiestas, se visten elegantemente  y se hacen obsequios entre si,  está solicitando su credikiva para comprar  faldas, blusas calzado para damas y lograr responder a su clientela en esta época. Su sueño es seguir creciendo en el negocio para en un futuro tener su propio almacén de ropa y de calzado. Su gran desafío es el manejo del efectivo, porque las cuentas por cobrar no le permiten comprar  inmediatamente  y tener un capital circulante por eso acude a esta financiación.
texts.en:
Giovana F. is 57 years old. She lives in the Villas de las Moras neighborhood in the town of Soledad with her spouse. She has 3  children aged 24 to 34 years old. This town is characterized by it artisanal production of the delicious Soledadian butifarras (sausages). Giovana has her business which she started 2 years ago with the help of her spouse. She buys and sells clothing and shoes with a  100% contribution margin. She does all her sales on credit, because she has a large quantity of profitable customers, mainly participants of the Christian community she attends and shares the teachings of God for men. In addition,  Giovana has more income from offering the service of renting washing machines and selling packaged snacks. Lately she has also been selling Chitos, green Tajaditas, Maduras, Cheesballs and more to the customers who use her washing machine service.   Giovana buys her clothes in a mall located in the Barranquilla market where they offer a good price. She buys sandals and traditional men's and women's shoes in her own neighborhood from a micro-businessman who makes them there.  
 
Since Giovana is getting ready to respond to her customers in the month of December, when families get together around the holidays.  They dress elegantly and give each other gifts. She is asking for the Kiva loan to buy skirts, blouses, and women's shoes to be able to respond to her customers during this season. Her dream is to keep growing the business so that in the future she will have her own clothing and shoe store.  Her big challenge is managing the cash, because the credit accounts don't allow her to buy immediately and have circulating capital. That is why she has turned to this financing.

loans.use: To buy skirts, blouses, and shoes for women and be able to respond to her customers.

loans.name: Jacinto Ramón

texts.es:
Jacinto Ramón A. T. tiene 55 anos. Es soletero  vive con los padres y con los sobrinos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hioa que se llama David de 4 años.

Los miembros de la V:R:C: Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Jacinto trabaja en la bananera destellando es decir, sacando lo malo de la fruta desde hace un año.
  
Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.

Le gusta hacer pedirte.
texts.en:
Jacinto Ramón A. T. is 55 years old, single, and lives with his parents and his nieces and nephews in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He has a four year old son named David.

The members of V:R:C: Dole 2 work as farmers on the Dole banana plantation, which is located in the center of the canton.  All of the members live in the canton of Ventanas, and the majority have worked for more than a year at the plantation and work with bananas.  There are about 13 members.

Jacinto has worked for a year separating the bad fruit from the good.

He is asking for this loan to set up a business in his house and acquire a store and purchase products for his business.  The support of the loan will help him financially provide for his needs.  His dream is to improve his home and succeed in starting a business.

loans.use: Improve his home to include space for a business

loans.name: Herson Elisur

texts.es: Herson Elisur C. de 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Herson  posee una venta de pupusas, tortillas, bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, pan, galletas y otros productos alimenticios más. El negocio esta ubicado en el punto de buses del transporte público de Santa Tecla, misma ciudad en la cual reside. Sus ventas son muy buenas ya que es una zona muy transitada, es por esta razón que él desea invertir en el negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos comestibles, de manera que sus ventas se puedan ver incrementadas, lo cual es lo principal para Herson ya que esto le permitirá brindarle una vida mejor a su esposa.
texts.en:
Herson Elisur Calderon is 34 years old and lives with his wife who is a homemaker.  He owns a stand where he sells pupusas and tortillas, softdrinks, sweets, bread, cookies and other food products.

The business is located at a public transportation bus stop in the city of Santa Tecla, where he lives. Sales volume is very high in this area because of the many passers-by.  

This is the reason he wants to invest more in the business and buy larger quantities of food products.  This will allow him to increase sales and provide a better lifestyle for his wife.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, sweets and softdrinks for his business.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Odette N. est commerçante.  Elle a 41 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 8 enfants entre 12 ans et 29 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle était née à Congo (DRC), mais maintenant elle habite a Nyabugogo a Rwanda.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter de 30 sacs de pommes de terre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et augmenter le marché clientèle.  Elle voudrait arriver à vendre 100 sacs de pommes de terre dans une semaine.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait bien élever ses enfants, et payer le minerval  et matériels scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Odette N. is a merchant. She is 41 years old, a widow, and the mother of eight children, from 12 to 29 years of age. She has finished primary school, and all her children go to school. She was born in Congo (Democratic Republic of Congo), but now she lives in Nyabugogo in Rwanda. She is going to use her loan to purchase 30 bags of potatoes. Her strategy for growing her business is to save money and to expand her customer base. She would like to be able to sell 100 bags of potatoes per week eventually. For her family, she would like to raise her children well and be able to provide for their tuition and school supplies.

loans.use: Purchasing 30 bags of potatoes

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg G. is a 34-year-old single mother who lives with her three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). All her children attend a local school. Enhtsetseg operates an imported clothing and household goods business out of three different workplaces in her town. She began her business in 2004 after working as a salesperson in her sister's stall at the local market between 2000 and 2004. Her business has stabilized over the past year and she has begun to integrate herself into the business community. For the future, she plans to expand her business by increasing her product line. Enhtsetseg is a hardworking woman and says, "I want to continue operating my business with stable operations for the next several years and work hard to provide a decent future for my children." She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrik loan in order to import more clothes and consumer goods from China to sell at a profit.

loans.use: To import more clothes and consumer goods from China

loans.name: Kobekoun Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KOBEKOUN sont mariés, ont en moyenne 43  ans et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à NOUGOUME, un des villages de commune rurale  de NIENA, Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mener les activités de commerce. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de bois de chauffe, de condiments, de tissus et des poissons et de la pâte d’arachide à l’image de   S. T.. 
S. T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 30 kg de poissons fumés et 5 sacs d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA et dans  les villages environnants auprès des producteurs.
Le poisson et la pâte d’arachide sont revendus au  marché de NOUGOUME et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000FCFA  qu’elle compte utiliser  pour contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the KOBEKOUN group are married, are on average 43 years old and have 5 children.  They live mostly in polygamous families in NOUGOUME, a village in the rural commune of Niena, Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their first joint loan with the microfinance institution SoroYiriwaso.  Their goal is to be able to manage a business. These women are in the business of selling firewood, condiments, fabric, fish and peanut butter, as does S. T.. 

S. T. plans to buy 30 kg of smoked fish and five sacks of peanuts with her loan.   She gets her supplies at the main market in Niena and from producers in neighboring villages. 

The fish and the peanut butter are resold at the market in Nougoume and within the family to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash at retail.

She foresees making an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to help cover daily family expenses.  Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to meet the demands of her clients.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Raise cows.

loans.name: Elmurat

texts.ru: Шомуратов Элмурат проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 51 год. Он женат, имеет троих детей. Дети учатся. Сам Элмурат более 15 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он продает детские игрушки, семечки и кукурузы. Вместе с ним работает его жена, она помогает ему в торговле. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Elmurat S. lives in the Gissar Region. He is 51 years old. He is married, with three children. The children study. Elmurat has been a vendor at the local market for over 15 years. He sells toys, sunflower seeds and corn. His wife works together with him and helps him to sell their wares. He is taking out a loan to increase his sales volume. He would like to expand his business.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the village of Paitan, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 55 years old. Fe is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals like adobo, fried chicken & fish soup to customers in the local community. She is also selling bread & serves coffee. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business like putting up a retailing store. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business like putting up a retail store

location.town: Paitan, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B. sells food items including fish, peppers, garden eggs and tomatoes at Jukwa Market, which is a big market, near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been doing this for two decades now. Adwoa is married to a mason and they have six children. 
The family depends on her income to pay for school fees and utility bills. Adwoa wants to expand her business and plans to use her loan to buy more bags of garden eggs to increase sales. She intends to reinvest the new profits back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more bags of garden eggs to increase sales.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is 46 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 17 and 10. Leo's wife is a teacher.

Leo is a farmer. He has been growing rice for more than 15 years, earning approximately PHP 5,000 per month. Leo works hard to sustain his family. He dreams for his children to finish college and have bright futures. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Patrick Kyalo

texts.en:
Patrick is a 36-year-old  gentleman.  He is married and is a father of two children aged between six and two. He has a business selling shoes and has been doing this for the last twelve years. This is his primary business. 

Patrick has applied for a second loan, which he intends to use to expand his business by adding more stock of shoes for sale.  He hopes to expand his business and in the near future own his own farm and a build good house for his family.

loans.use: add more stock of shoes for sale

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia W. R. is a 58-year-old farmer. She has been farming for the past seven years. She was previously employed as a teacher.  

Teresia is a widowed lady with six children between 22 and 33 years of age. With hard work in her business, she has managed to bring up her children.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to save her money and she wants to take a first loan. She has requesting 20,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is a 48-year-old, married woman from the village of Bliss Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She and her husband have two adult-age children. To earn a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the transportation services sector. Specifically, her primary source of income is derived from providing motor-transportation services to customers. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, she was better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Recently, Jocelyn successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jocelyn is now requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of 20,000 PHP ($475), which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service for her customers. Notably, this loan would be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches, which cover the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised of mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Emilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Emilia nació en la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 38 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos.  

Emilia es un ama de casa y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la elaboración de pinturas, ella nos cuenta que junto con sus hermanos Juan, Julio y Trinidad trabajan de forma organizada, Sus hermanos elaboran las pinturas y Emilia vende a diferentes centros comerciales de venta de artesanía y en otras ocasiones vende en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. 

Ha solicitado Emilia a la Asociación Arariwa un crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles para adquirir materiales como por ejemplo marcos de madera, bastidores, tela, oleos, purpurina y pintura.  Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Emilia es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. Emilia tiene como sueño comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Emilia was born in the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.  She is 38 years old, married and has three children.  She is a homemaker who alternates her daily activity with making paints. She works with her brothers Juan, Julio and Trinidad in a very organized fashion.  Her brothers make the paint and Emilia sells it at shopping centers that offer handicrafts.  Sometimes she sells from home.  They have been in this business for several years and it has been successful because of the hard work they put into it.

Emilia has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN through the Arariwa Association to buy materials such as wooden frames, stretchers, fabric, oil paints, glitter and paint.  With the income from sales she will be able to pay back the loan.

She is known as a very hard-working, responsible woman and a good mother who wants to give her children a good future while improving the family's lifestyle.  Her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as wooden frames, stretchers, fabric, oil paints, glitter and paint.

loans.name: Analeah

texts.en:
Analeah is 33 years old and married with six children. Analeah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling young coconuts in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 1,2000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of young coconuts to sell.

Analeah has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 10 years and she earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Analeah aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more young coconuts to sell

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en:
Marziya is hard-working woman who is married and the mother of two children. She sells fresh fruit and vegetables in the market and makes a good profit. Marziya would like to expand her business and improve her living conditions. For this purpose, Marziya has requested a loan of 5000 TJS.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 8 filhos, e não lembra as respectivas idades. Fez 5a classe e parou devido a falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua maê e os sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, apenas deslocou se de um bairro para o outro durante o preiodo da guerra. Trabalha como segurança numa empresa e é comerciante ha mais de 8 anos onde tem um salario de 2.500.00mt por mês na empresa de segurança e cerca de 2.000.00mt de rendimento no seu negocio, este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes desta instituiçao e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para o seu estabelecimento (refrescos, cervejas, batatas e outros) para aumentar a mercadoria ,e obter mais lucros. 
o seu sonho e construir um estaleiro de venda de carvão vegetal e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the city of Matola, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo. He is a married father of 8 children, whose respective ages he cannot remember. He attended school up to the 5th Grade and left owing to his financial situation. He lives in his own home with his family and supports his mother and his nieces and nephews, who live with him.
He has never left Maputo, although he has moved from one neighbourhood to another during the war. He works for a security company and he has also been running his own business for the last 8 years. Each month he earns 2,500MZN from the security company and around 2,000MZN from his own business. He uses this money for household expenses and puts some away as savings in his bank account (BIM).
He has never borrowed money from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also Hluvuku clients, and this will be his first loan of 12,000MZN. He intends to use this money to buy goods for his business, such as refreshments, beers, potato snacks and other items) in order to increase his stock and profits.
His dream is to build a yard in which to sell charcoal; he intends to apply for further loans to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to by goods for his business (refreshments, beers, potato snacks and other items).

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 24 years old. He is a hardworking and honest businessman who is married with no children. He has been making a living for the last 4 years by selling clothes. He wants, in the next 5 years, to be making sales on wholesale terms so that he will be able to realize his dream of expanding his business beyond his county.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more trousers for sale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has now learned good customer relations and how to save.

loans.use: to buy more trousers for sale

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz de 50 años es una mujer que vive con su cónyuge y tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 16 a 32 años en la ciudadela 20 de Julio, barrio ubicado al Sur de la ciudad, que se caracteriza  porque interactúan el comercio formal e informal, escenaR. deportivos y recreativos, infraestructuras comerciales, zonas bancaria y conjuntos residenciales, pero principalmente  esta comunidad tiene una de las infraestructuras deportivas más importantes de Colombia y muy pronto  se convertirá en el escenario del futbol mundial en la categoría sub 20, por eso todo comerciante de su alrededor se  prepara para atender la avalancha de clientes que llegarán a la ciudad de Barranquilla, desde todas partes de Colombia y de otros países.  Allí en este ambiente mezclado  Luz tiene un negocio, a través del cual se dedica a la venta de refrescos entre cerveza, gaseosas, chichas de maíz, poni malta, hielo,  perros calientes, salchipapas y hamburguesas, el cual inició en el año 1985 pues desde muy joven, en el año 1978 ya era comerciante. Sus clientes, son amigos, vecinos, referidos y peatones que circulan por el corredor comercial donde está ubicado su negocio.  Aunque su gran desafío es la alta competencia, se sostiene con precios justos y con su natural amabilidad y vocación de servicio que favorecen la sostenibilidad de su clientela. Su razón corriente es de 2 veces, y la rentabilidad de su negocio es no menor del 15%, gradualmente tiene como meta aumentarla a través de financiamiento, porque su capital de trabajo es pequeño y ahora su propósito es hacerlo crecer para incrementar su clientela y con ello sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por la cual inicia su historial crediticio, solicitándole a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo un credikiva con el cual comprará refrescos hielo, productos de panadería.   Más adelante planea agregarle un café internet porque sueña que sus hijos se involucren y generen ingresos mediante su empresa familiar.
texts.en:
Luz, 50, is a woman living with her spouse.  She has six children ranging in age from 16 to 32.  She lives in the 20 de Julio neighborhood located in the south of the city.  It’s notable because formal and informal commerce interphase here along with sports and recreational venues, shopping centers, banking and residential complexes.  Most significant of all, though, this community has one of Colombia’s most important sports infrastructures which very soon will become the scene of Sub 20 World Football.  Because of this, all the local merchants in the area are gearing up for the avalanche of customers that will descend on the city of Barranquilla from all parts of Colombia and from other countries.

It’s in this heterogeneous environment that Luz has a business where she sells beverages like beer, soft-drinks, “chicha de maíz” (drink made from a base of fermented corn), Pony Malta (pasteurized non-alcoholic malt beverage), ice, hot-dogs, “salchipapas” (fried potatoes with fried sausages) and hamburgers.  She started in 1985 because she’d been a merchant since she was a very young; back in 1978 she was already a merchant.

Her customers are friends, neighbors, referred people and passersby that amble through the commercial corridor where she’s located.  Although her main challenge is the large amount of competition, she stays in business thanks to fair prices and thanks to her natural kindness and vocation of service that are favorable for her retaining customers.

Her liquidity is twofold and her profit margin is no less than 15%.  Her goal is to gradually increase it through financing because her working capital is small and her goal now is to make it grow to increase clientele and with that, her income.

This is the reason behind her starting credit history asking Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan to buy soft-drinks, ice and baked goods.  Later on she plans to add an Internet Café because she dreams with her children becoming involved and generating income through a family firm.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, ie and baked goods.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 30-year-old, hardworking man that owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his parents and siblings, and his goal is to make sure that the young ones in his family are educated.

He has been selling sodas and beers for seven years. With the income he generates from this business, he has been able to support his family and to build a house. His business challenges are high transportation costs and price fluctuations. Despite these challenges, he dreams of having a wholesale depot. George is seeking this loan to buy sodas and beers for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional sodas and beers.

loans.name: Marcyline

texts.en:
Marcyline is 24 years old, married, and has one son. She runs a pharmacy in Chaani, Mombasa and her business has been in operation for the last six years. It has been doing well.

Marcyline is a KADET client and this marks her second loan to finance her business. She plans to use the money to expand her business by purchasing more stock of drugs and cosmetics. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan, and for her upkeep, and to further expand her business. Her dream is to satisfy her clients and to open up new outlets in other parts of Mombasa.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more stock of drugs and cosmetics

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has 15 years of experience working as a farmer. In 2001, he bought a small piece of land where he started managing his own agricultural business. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase fertilizers and seeds needed to increase his business productivity. He has one part-timer helping him with the farming work; Ali notes that he will also use the loan to pay his only employee’s salary. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds needed to increase his business productivity and to pay his only employee’s salary.

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en: Patriciah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years. She is 31 years old, married to Moses and they have four school-going children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In future, Patriciah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothing and footwear

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita Alindayu's main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. She is from Centro 1, Angadanan, Isabela. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day.

She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Conchita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en: Having gotten a loan, Saidi was able to grow his business, a thing he feels will make him realize his dream of acquiring a vehicle to enable him to transport his cattle to the city markets. He wants a loan to buy more cattle to resell at a profit

loans.use: to buy more cattle to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Kheam

texts.en: Kheam is 36 years old, married, and has 1 child. She works for others to make a living. She has been with this work for 1 year. This is her first loan with VisionFund. Kheam is applying for a loan to buy a rice paddy with her sibling and then sell it on the market. This loan will enable her to build her rice stock and sell it to the market to earn income to feed her family and child better.

loans.use: to buy a rice paddy for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy de 38 años hace 10 años convive con su pareja. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad. Esta familia vive en un hogar cálido en el distrito de Tapo. Fredy aprendió las labores del campo de sus padres y tíos, quienes también viven en la zona, caracterizada por la riqueza de minerales en sus suelos. De esa manera este padre trabajador siembra: arvejas, papas, habas, zanahorias, espinacas, etc.  A la vez se dedica a criar y vender animales como: vacas y burros. Los que al ofertarlos obtiene como promedio de 30 a 50 soles por burro; y de 150 a 200 soles por vaca. “El precio de las verduras a veces baja, y como los productos se malogran con el tiempo, me arriesgo a venderlos esos precios. Igual nunca he perdido, de alguna manera siempre he recuperado lo invertido”, explica. En el campo recibe la ayuda de su esposa, quien en las tardes coge las herramientas y remueve la tierra. Cuando es época de siembra o cosecha, Fredy contrata personal a quien paga por el trabajo al día. De ese modo puede ahorrar dinero y más adelante, podrá construir más cuartos en su casa, “eso me gustaría, ampliar mi casa con más cuartos para mis hijos y otros familiares”, puntualiza. Éste sería su préstamo número 8 de MFP, entidad de la que siente agradecimiento por las oportunidades de emprendimiento que consiguió y espera seguir haciéndolo, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. En cuanto a su banco comunal, muestra identificación y dedicación, pues sabe que el trabajo en equipo trae mayores resultados. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de semillas de papas, abonos orgánicos, minerales. Estima que el precio ascenderá a 1200 soles, con lo restante contratará operarios para el trabajo de la siembra.
texts.en: Fredy, 38, has lived with his common-law wife for ten years and they have two children, ages 10 and 4.  This family lives in a cozy home in the district of Tapo.  Fredy learned about agriculture from his father and uncles who also live in this area which is known for its mineral-rich land.  This hard-working father grows peas, potatoes, lima beans, carrots, spinach, etc.  He also raises and sells livestock such as cows and donkeys.  He usually makes an average of 30 to 50 PEN per donkey and 150 to 200 PEN per cow.  "The price of vegetables decreases sometimes and some can go bad over time, so I have to risk selling them at those prices.  But I have never lost money, somehow I always get a return on my investment", he explains.  His wife helps him on the land by aerating it in the afternoons.  During planting or harvest season Fredy hires workers and pays them a daily wage.  He is able to save money this way so he can expand his house in the future.  "I would like to add on more rooms for my children and other relatives", he says.  This is his 8th loan through MFP.  He is very grateful to the entity for the enterprise opportunities he has had and he hopes to continue in this vein and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  As far as the communal bank is concerned he feels identified with it and dedicated because he knows teamwork gives better results.  He plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds, organic fertilizer and minerals.  He thinks the price will be around 1,200 PEN.  He will use the rest to hire workers for the planting season.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Solidario Las Cipresales Group

texts.es: Solidario los Cipresales: este grupo esta integrado por la señora:Doña Maria Isabel,D. 48 años D. edad tiene 5 hijos,ella se dedica a la elavoracion D. tejidos tipicos en telar,desD. hace 8 años nos cuenta que le a ido bien en su negocio,y es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos ya que en esta epoca es cuando mas se venD.,al igual que las siguientes socias esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos tipicos.
texts.en: Los Cipresales is a group that has Mrs. Maria Isabel as a member.  She is 48 years old, has 5 children and makes a living making typical weaves on a loom.  She has been doing this for 8 years and tells us that her business has been doing well.  For this reaS. she is requesting a loan for the purchase of raw material for the making of these woven fabrics because during this time is when they sell the most.  She is requesting this loan at the same time as the other members are doing so.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for the making of typical woven fabrics.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
To alleviate poverty, Helen works hard to generate income. She is 43 years old and has three children. She engages in a food production business. She usually buys and sells eggs ("balut"). She has been in the business for almost 10 years, earning a net profit of 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. Her income goes to supporting the family's needs and toward the school fees of her children.

Helen wants to improve the business in order to increase her income so she can continuously send her children to school and save for future emergencies. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more eggs to sell in their village. She believes that her patience and sacrifices will help her earn a good income someday.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell in her village.

loans.name: Mikael

texts.en:
Mikael is a 26-year-old single gentleman. He is a maize farmer, and he has been for the past eight years. 

He knew about KADET from another registered client with KADET. He has been a good client, and this is his third loan which he plans to use to prepare land for farming and buy farm materials, i.e. maize seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to re-invest in another business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: To prepare land for farming and buy farm materials (i.e. maize seeds and fertilizers)

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 38 años edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Urubamba pero actualmente vive en el distrito de Yucay de la provincia de Urubamba, él es carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en su domicilio donde fabrica hermosas mesas, sillas, roperos, escritorios y otras cosas más. 

En esta oportunidad Ricardo requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo madera. Su sueño de Ricardo es abrir una tienda de venta y exhibición de muebles de madera en la ciudad de Yucay.   

Ricardo es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba. La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.
texts.en:
38-year-old Ricardo is married with three beautiful children. He was born in the city of Urubamba but currently lives in the district of Yucay in the Urubamba province. He is a carpenter and has a small carpentry workshop at home where he makes beautiful tables, chairs, wardrobes, desks and other furniture.

Ricardo requires this loan to buy materials for his business, such as wood. Her dream is to open his own store for the sale and exhibition of his wooden furniture in the city of Yucay.

Ricardo is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Visión de Rumichaca", made up of 19 members living in Urubamba province. Urubamba is located north of Cusco, along the Vilcanota River in an area known as the "Sacred Valley" due to its mild climate, fertile soil, and abundant streams, making this one of the most beautiful valleys in the world.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wood.

loans.name: Mujeres De Confianza Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal está conformado por 9 integrantes en el cual no es la primera vez que están solicitando crédito este grupo se mantiene unido desde que se formaron, ellos mismo se apoyan y se motivan para salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y sobre todo en cada uno de los negocios que tienen cada uno de ellos. Lisbeth es parte de este grupo en cual su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a una pulpería y está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, aceite, shampoo, detergente entre otros productos que demanda sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank has nine members and this isn’t the first time they’ve requested credit.  The group has stayed together since it was formed.  They themselves support and motivate each other to get ahead and improve their quality of life especially in each of their businesses.  

Lizbeth is part of this group and her economic activity is a grocery store.  She’s asking for this loan to invest in the business buying basic grains, oil, shampoo and detergent, among other products her customers require.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, shampoo and detergent, among other products.

loans.name: Msaada

texts.en:
Msaada is a married woman with 3 children who are enrolled in school.  Her husband is a policeman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs.  She owns a house with electricity but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Msaada has operated a food stall for the past 3 years; in addition she also runs a leso (kanga) selling business.  Her potential clients are the local area women.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  She dreams of expanding her business

With the Kshs 40,000 loan she wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, beans and lesos for her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, beans and lesos for her businesses.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Augustine is married, and has seven children and many grandchildren. His wife has retired from teaching, and now they both farm their land. They have been farming for twenty years, and are currently growing beans, bananas and maize on their land, as well as rearing livestock and tending to natural forests. Augustine likes beekeeping because it is easy to practice, and is happy that the honey industry is being developed in his region. 

This is Augustine’s first loan, and he plans to use the income from his hives for household use. His hope for the future is “to see my grandchildren succeed in life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is a petty trader who is involved in the sale of dried peppers, onions and other foodstuffs in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). She has had some form of formal education through middle school form one but couldn’t graduate due to financial difficulties. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a peasant farmer and she sometimes sells his produce from the farm for him. Afua has been working as a petty trader for close to 20 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans to use her loan to purchase an increased quantity of peppers and various vegetable like okra, garden eggs, and onions, allowing her to meet the rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a market stand, so she can stop hawking and sell from a fixed location instead.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, okra, garden eggs, and onions to sell

loans.name: Geneviève Louise

texts.fr:
Geneviève est une mère de famille travailleuse, exemple de force et de courage de 42 ans, elle est divorcée. Ses trois enfants de 18, 11, et 4 ans sont tous scolarisés.  Elle paie un écolage pour le dernier qui est en pré-scolaire . Les revenus tirés de l’activité ont permis à Geneviève de prendre en charge les frais  de scolarité de ses enfants, l’aîné est actuellement en classe de terminale. 
Geneviève a 10 années d’expérience dans la vente de légumes.  Avant, elle travaillait dans une gargote, elle était commis, et cuisinière. Son rêve est d’ouvrir une petite unité d’épicerie gargote un jour.

loans.use: acheter 100kg de pommes de terre, 2 caisses de tomates, 5 kg d'ails,5kg de gingembre, 50 kg d'haricots-vert etc

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 45 years of age and married with 5 children. She is an active religious person and a secretary of the Ngurueini women choir. She gets her income from hawking food in the Ngurueini market, to masons at construction sites, and farmers around that area as well.

Her business is quite challenging although taxing. She earns about USD200 monthly after she deducts the expenses. She is planning to increase the amount of maize flour she buys per day because she has so many orders from her clients. She can not supply the food alone to various sites and that’s why she would like to employ another person.

The area is growing very fast and this assures her of getting more customers. She is determined to pay her loan in time and see her business grow.

loans.use: Jane wants to buy a carton of maize flour, 8 packets of porridge sorghum, millet, wheat flour, and employ one staff.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en: Ilkin is a low income person from Agsu district. He is married and has 2 kids. He is 32 years old. He started his business in 2002. In 2004-2006 he borrowed 3 loans from Normicro Agsu branch amounting $200-$400-$800 and used them for business expansion. Now he applies for $1200 to repair the shop building and purchase medical equipment.

loans.use: building repair, purchasing equipment

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosita has been working as a seamstress out of her home for 20 years. She makes school uniforms, dresses, skirts, and blouses. She opened her business with savings from previous jobs when she began buying the necessary machines. Rosita offers good service to her clientele since not only does she make clothes, but also bags with traditional prints from the Galapagos Islands that she receives by air mail. She makes the bags to fill customer orders, and these customers refer her to others because of her good sewing quality. She is open from 8am to 8pm. Rosita will use the loan to buy fabric for shirts because she needs to fill orders for physical education uniforms and also to buy other goods that she does not make. Rosita, 52, is single with 3 children who live in the Galapagos Islands. Her 3 children are grown-up and have their own families. With increased income from the investment, Rosita says that she will continue impoving her home so that she can have a secure life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosita tiene su taller de costura en su domicilio el mismo que tiene desde hace 20 años. Rosita produce uniformes escolares, vestidos faldas y blusas. Se inicio con ahorros generados por trabajos anteriores y con esos ahorros fue comprando sus maquinarias para poco a poco ir implementando su taller. Rosita da un buen servicio a su clientela ya que no solo ahora produce ropa, sino que también esta produciendo bolsos con estampados típicos de la Islas Galápagos los cuales los envían por avión. Los bolsos los realiza por pedidos ya que fue referida por su buena calidad en su costura. Rosita atiende a sus clientes desde las 8AM a 20PM

Rosita utilizara su crédito en la compra de telas camisetas ya que tiene pedidos de uniformes de educación física y también compra de otras mercaderías que ella no produce.

Rosita es soltera tiene 52 y 3 hijos los mismos que viven en las Isla Galápagos todos son mayores de edad y con sus respectivas familias. Doña Rosita indica que con las utilidades generadas en esta nueva inversión seguirá adecuando vivienda para darle mayor seguridad a su vida

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Fadah Mohammad

texts.en: Fadah Mohammad lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is living with all members of his family. He is a butcher. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy a freezer and also enlarge his shop to attract more clients and make contracts with restaurants to bring them meat. He is happy with this loan because it will improve his income.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en: Mrs. Voeun S. is 40 years old, married, with 4 children. She works as a market vendor, earning $2 a day from this activity. Her husband (pictured) earns $3 a day breeding domestic animals. Voeun S. would like to use this $300 loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so that he can operate a motortaxi service when he has spare time.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi service

loans.name: Slamet

texts.id:
Slamet has started his repair shop business since 1989 with 4 employees. Currently he has 16 employees. He earns about $220 net profit per month with daily living expenses of $5.50. The loan will be used to purhcase several equipment for his shop. Owning more comprehensive equipment inventories will help him repair more vehicles, which consequently may expand his customer base. He projects that the new equipments may increase his monthly earnings by $440 per month.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Usaha bengkel yang digeluti Slamet sejak tahun 1989 - dengan anak buah 4 orang – sudah berkembang. Saat ini dia memiliki 16 orang anak buah. Dalam sebulan dia bisa mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 2.000.000,00 dengan biaya hidup per hari Rp 50.000,00. Pinjaman yang diperolehnya akan dia pakai untuk membeli beberapa peralatan bengkel. Peralatan yang lebih lengkap akan membantunya untuk memperbaiki lebih banyak kendaraan. Semakin banyak kendaraan yang dapat ia perbaiki akan menambah jumlah pelanggan yang ia miliki. Perhitungannya ke depan ia akan dapat menaikkan keuntungan per bulan sampai dengan Rp 4.000.000,00/bulan.

loans.use: Purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: I am a mother of five children, all of whom study at a local school. I also work in the cotton fields as a daily wage laborer to support my family's income. I am requesting a loan for $300 so that my husband can expand his vegetables business which he operates in the food market of the city. He currently earns approximately $200 per month and now wishes to enlarge his stall and keep a greater quantity and variety of vegetables at his stand.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Jamshed Rahimovich S. has been selling food for the past 5 years. He is married and has 2 children. In 2005, Jamshed received the first credit of $142; back then, his assets were $570. After receiving the loan and using it wisely, he increased assortment of goods and expanded his store. After receiving profits, he purchased a minivan to transport his goods. Now, he has a salesman who is paid $50 per month. Jamshed's assets have increased significantly and he plans to open new stores.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Шарипов Чамшед Рахимович занимается продажей продуктов питания вот уже 5 лет. Женат . Имеет 2-х детей. В 2005 Чамшед получил первый кредит в размере 142$ тогда его актив составлял 570$ . Постепенно после получения займа и целевого использования он увеличил ассортимент товара, расширил место деятельности. Получив прибыль от торговли он купил микроавтобус для перевозки товаров. У него на данный момент есть продавец которому он платит заработную плату в размере 50$ в месяц. Сейчас его активы увеличились в несколько раз и он планирует открыт новые торговые точки.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa works as a financial assistant in a multidisciplinary consulting office. Her home is located in the Pampahasi Alto zone on the east side of La Paz. She is single, but is in charge of her younger sisters after their parents passed away. This is the first time she has requested a loan that will be used to complete an upper-level course. Her goal is to earn her degree in public accounting so she can improve her salary possibilities in her line of work. She has five years seniority at her work, which is why she has the ability to cover her requirements.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen Rosa trabaja como asistente contable en una oficina de consultoría multidisciplinaria. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi Alto, ladera Este de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera pero está a cargo de sus hermanos menores pues sus padres fallecieron. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, el mismo que será destinado para realizar su un curso superior con el objetivo de obtener su licenciatura en contaduría pública para mejorar las condiciones salariales en su fuente de trabajo. Tiene una antigüedad en su trabajo de 5 años, por lo que tiene las posibilidades de cubrir su requerimiento.

loans.use: Tuition while working toward an accounting degree

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
G. Shavkat is 32 years old. He is married with two children. Shavkat lives with his parents and is the main bread winner for this large family. 

Shavkat runs a café where he cooks kebab and grilled chicken. Being a very good and experienced cook, Shavakat has managed to make his business successful. The income from the business is used by Shavkat to improve his family's living conditions. He also dreams to be able to educate his children in the Institutes and Universities. Now Shavkat wants to make major repairs to the café thus to attract more clients and keep the old ones. For this he requests $950.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. Shavkat thanks everyone for their support and promises to be precise in loan repayment.

loans.use: Major repair of the café.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. He is married and has one daughter who is five months old. He is living with his parents in the same house. He has a computer shop and he applied to get $1200 to purchase new computer supplies. He also wants to make new shelves, paint the shop, and make advertising to increase his income and save for a better life for his small family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new computer supplies

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys has been selling food in the market over the past four years. Before that, she dedicated all of her time to her home and children.

When she separated from her husband, she felt the need to find a job. She tells us that she inmediately thought of selling food, as cooking is one of her favorite activities. She began by renting a restaurant in the local market and purchased the basic elements to start the business.

Over the past four years she has managed her business to ensure that it keeps growing, even during hard times. She wants to continue in the restaurant business but not in the market. Her objective is to open a soda fountain shop with the support of her eldest daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: To improve her restaurant by adding furniture and electrical appliances

loans.name: Sattorova

texts.ru:
Sattorova M. is 54 years old and has four children, already with their own families. She lives with her husband. During the day she sells goods at the market, but besides her business, she also works the night shift at the hospital as a nurse. Once she found out from friends about loans, she decided to increase her business's sales. She approached Microinvest in order to expand her selection of summer wear.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Сатторова Матлюба, возраст 54 года, замужем имеет 4 детей , все дети уже семейные,она сейчас живет с мужем вдвоем, работает помимо бизнеса в ночьную смену в больнице медсестрой , а днем выходит на рынок торговать. Узнав от подруг о кредите она решила расширить свой товарооборот, хочет добавить в свой ассортимент летних товаров.Для этого она пришла к нам в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Underclothes sales

loans.name: Celedonia's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Celedonia Q., a mi avanzada edad tengo que dedicarme a la venta de refrescos, churros, pan, ya que es muy dificil conseguir trabajo en las condiciones que me encuentro en este momento, ya que para la gente de la tercera edad es muy complicado que alguna empresa ya sea publica o privada lo empleen, tengo 3 años de tener mi negocio el cual me genera ingresos para sustentar mi hogar, tambien elaboro tortillas por las noches cuando cierro mi negocio y las mando a vender todas las mañanas aqui cerca de mi casa, en estos momentos ncesito un prestamo para poder mejorar mi negocio y quiero salir adelente con mi negocio que es lo unico que puedo hacer en estos tiempos dificiles.

loans.use: compra de refrescos, churros, pan, galletas.

loans.name: Happiness's Nyoya Njema Group

texts.en:
Happiness is 38 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children, ages 15, 13, 11, and 7. She also takes care of 2 other people, ages 32 and 7. She owns a minivan and taxi. Every day she works from 5:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Happiness now hopes for a loan to start a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing with clothing and vegetable sales.

loans.use: To start a new business (a clothing shop)

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Рахимкулова Латофат  1962 года рождения. Она разведена и у нее четверо детей. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала еще 8 лет назад с продажи кондитерских изделий. В данный момент у нее большой ассортимент товаров. Она   торгует конфетами и кондитерскими изделиями производства России и Турции на рынке «Саховат» города Душанбе. Также у нее имеется продукты отечественного производства.  Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах «Сафар-Центр»-а города Душанбе и у оптовиков из города Худжанда. Для увеличения оборотного капитала она хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на год.
texts.en:
Latofat R. was born in 1962. She is divorced and has four children. Her enterprise activity that she began 8 years ago sells confectionery products. At the present time it has a big assortment of goods. She trades sweets and confectionery products manufactured in Russia and Turkey in the market "Саховат " in the city of Dushanbe. She also has products of domestic production. She buys her goods in wholesale shops in "Safar-center" in the cities of Dushanbe and from wholesalers from the city of Khudzha. For her to increase capital she wants to receive a loan in the sum of $1200 for the duration of a year.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of different sweets

loans.name: Mrs. Nov Rours Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, located in Angk Village in Kandal Province, consists of eight members who will use the loan for a variety of purposes. For example, Mrs. Nov R., the Village Bank President, is a fisherwoman requesting a loan to buy a new boat in order to restart her business which has been sidelined due to the unseaworthiness of her current boat. Her husband, Mr. Tong Pheng, assists in her business.

Nov is 42 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another two help their parents and do housework. The remaining two are attending the local school. This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new boat in order to restart her business.

loans.name: Rudy Roxana

texts.en:
Rudy Roxana R. H. lives with her mother-in-law, her husband, and their seven year old son. Rudy Roxana is a member of the community bank Emprendedoras, which means "entrepreneurs" in Spanish. Rudy Roxana and her husband have an animal farm where they raise lambs and pigs to sell. Their animals give birth and then the babies are kept for about 8-10 months until they are sold. She and her sister-in-law also sell salchipollo daily, which is a common dish consisting of sausage, rice, and chicken.

With her loan of 400 soles (~$150 USD), Rudy Roxana will invest in her businesses by purchasing oil, potatoes, and more livestock. With her savings she would like to build her own home where she can live with just her husband and son.

loans.use: To purchase oil, potatoes, and additional livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling underwear and clothing in the community.

loans.name: Pedro Daniel

texts.es: El joven Pedro Daniel Hernandez González vive en la casa de su abuelita y de su mamá pero el al ver que la casa necesita arreglos y composturas se hace responsable de  mantener en comodidad a su familia. Este nuevo préstamo lo quiere para poner vitropiso en una de las recamaras en anterior crédito lo utilizo para poner en parte de la sala pero aun le falto en esta habitación que sale en la fotografía. El trabaja en maquiladora al igual que su mama y su hermano.
texts.en:
The young Pedro Daniel Hernandez González lives in the house of his grandmother and his mother, but upon seeing that the house needed repairs and maintenance he became responsible for maintaining the comfort of his family. He wants this new loan to install ceramic tile in one of the bedrooms. He used the previous loan to put it in part of the living room, but he is still missing this room, which is shown in the photograph. He works in a maquiladora (factory), the same as his mother and his brother.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ceramic tile materials

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Né le 11 Mai 1977 à Noepé dans la préfecture de l’Avé au Sud Togo, Mr Kokou A. est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. Il est cordonnier de métier et exerce depuis plusieurs années cette activité avec dévouement. Toutefois, il mène cette activité dans des conditions difficiles : manque de matériels de travail et de local pour son atelier. Pour cela ; il demande un crédit pour louer un atelier et s’équiper en matériel de travail. Cela va relancer  son activité et accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born on May 11, 1977 in Noepé in the Avé prefecture in south Togo, Mr. Kokou A. is married and the father of one child. He is a cobbler by trade and has been dedicated to his trade for several years. However, he works in difficult conditions: namely, a lack of work equipment for his workshop. This is why he is requesting a loan to rent a workshop and to purchase the work equipment he needs. This will revive his business and increase his revenue.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renting a workshop and purchasing work equipment

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Monsieur Magatte D. evolue dans le domaine de l art.IL a une experience de plus de 15 ans dans ce domaine.Il a participe dans differentes foires afircaines.Pour renforcer son son activite il sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Mr. Magatte D. is advancing in the art field. He has over fifteen years of experience in it and participates in different African fairs. To bolster his work, he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boost his working capital

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick T. sells videos, music CDs and DVDs at Santsiwadzie near Elmina. Patrick has received senior high school education. He is married and has no children. His wife is a seamstress.

Patrick has been selling videos and music CDs and DVDs since 1999. He is responsible for paying rent, utility bills, and other expenses. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of videos, CDs, and DVDs for both foreign and local movies and music to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards a house he wants to put up for his children.

loans.use: additional capital for the sale of video CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Ni Made Suderti

texts.id:
Namanya Ni Made Suderti. Dia tinggal di sebuah rumah yang sederhana, di Dusun Katulampa,  Desa Manistutu. Suaminya I Made Tinggal bekerja sebagai petani. Mereka mempunyai 2 orang anak. Yang pertama, laki – laki bernama Putu Mei Sudiantara, sudah kelas 2 SMA. Sedangkan yang kedua, perempuan bernama Ni Luh Kadek Febrianti, baru kelas 2 SD.
Pekerjaan suami Ni Made Suderti yang hanya seorang petani, belum mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Padahal Dia juga masih harus membiayai kedua anaknya yang masih bersekolah. Di jaman seperti sekarang ini, biaya sekolah tidaklah murah. Untuk itu Ni Made Suderti memilih memelihara 1 ekor induk babi dan 2 ekor penggemukan. Namun Ni Made Suderti tidak mempunyai cukup dana untuk membeli pakan ternak untuk babinya tersebut. Karena dalam 6 bulan, Ni Made Suderti bisa menghabiskan biaya ± Rp. 500.000,- untuk 1 ekor babi.
Ni Made Suderti mengajukan pinjaman modal ke Dinari, dengan program 6 bulan dan dibayar di akhir periode. Dengan pinjaman ini, Ni Made Suderti berencana menggunakannya untuk membeli pakan untuk ternak babinya. Ni Made Suderti berharap setelah mendapat pinjaman modal ini, usahanya memelihara babi dapat berkembang. Sehingga Dia dapat membantu suaminya memenuhi biaya sekolah anaknya, serta kehidupan rumah tangganya dapat pula meningkat.
texts.en:
Ni Made Suderti lives in a simple house in Katulampa village in manistutu region. Her husband, I Made works as a farmer. They has 2 children. The eldest sone, Putu Mei Sudiantara is studying at 2nd grade of high school, and the second daughter, Ni Luh Kadek Febrianti is studying in 2nd grade of primary school. Ni Made Suderti is a farmer with insufficient income to pay for all her family expenses. Her husband's income is not sufficient to pay for her children's tuitions. Currently school tuitions are not cheap. To supplement her family's income, Ni Made Suderti started farming 1 breeding pig and 2 fattening pigs. However she did not have enough money to purchase feeds. In 6 months, Ni Made Suderti spends about $40 per pigs. Ni Made Suderti is applying for a 6 month loan to DInari to purchase feeds for her farmed pigs. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and help her husband to pay for her children's tuition with the profit.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy feeds

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Soutoura, toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sanoubougou un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région du Mali).  
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de  pagnes wax, de bazin teintés,  et des fruits et légumes.
Elles sont à leur premier prêt  solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 pièces de bazin blanc et 15 pièces de pagnes wax.  Les bazins seront amenés à la teinture pour recevoir différentes colories avant d’être revendus en pièces de trois, cinq et six mètres.
Elles  s’approvisionnent à Sikasso auprès des commerçants  grossistes spécialistes de la lingerie. Elles effectuent leurs ventes, en détail, la plupart au comptant, dans les différents marchés et dans les quartiers de la ville. Leur clientèle est composée généralement de femmes..
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 18.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Soutoura group, all married, have an average age of 37 and two children, on average, and live in traditional families in Sanoubougou, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They have various businesses, among others selling "wax pagnes" (bolts of high quality African print cloth), locally dyed damask cloth, and fruit and vegetables.

They are on their first solidarity loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan they expect to buy 20 bolts of damask and 15 lengths of "wax pagne". The damask will be taken for dyeing in different colors before being sold in lengths of 3, 5, or 6 meters. They do their buying in Sikasso from wholesalers specialized in cloth. They sell retail, mostly for cash, in the various markets and in the neighborhoods of the town. Their clientele is composed generally of women.

They each expect to make a profit of 18,000 F CFA per month of which part will be used for needs of their families and the rest reinvested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of damask and "wax pagnes"

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet W. is 33 years old and divorced with a child. She has a phone booth where she sells rechargeable phone cards, eggs, and women's bags. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N30, 000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
El señor Abrahan  vive en casa de su madre en la avenida principal de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como transporte publico, pero a su vez alquiló una tienda donde venden pasteles que elabora la esposa durante la mañana, con esta actividad ellos mantienen a su familia.
El crédito que solicitan es para comprar un horno industrial, ya que tienen muchos clientes y no abastecen con su producción a todos 

Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Abraham lives with his mother on the main avenue of Llojeta in La Paz. He has a car which he uses for public transportation, but he also rented a store where they sell cakes that his wife makes in the mornings. With this they maintain their family. The loan they're requesting is to buy an industrial oven, since they have a lot of customers and they cannot supply everyone. His background qualifies him as a good client, and he can thus access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an industrial oven to produce more cakes

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen is 42 years old and married with six children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions and hopes to expand her business. She hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Deisy De

texts.es: Deisy tiene 58 años de edad, su esposo es jubilado de la policia y recibe renta y tambien se dedica  a realizar tramites en general. Tienen su casa propia y solo una hija depende de ellos. Si bien hay mucha competencia en el rubro pero ella tiene ya sus cliente fijos a los que entrega. El credito sera destinado a la construccion de su taller de reposteria ya que actualmente funciona en su cocina y no tienen espacio para desarrollar su actividad. Es una buena cliente de agrocapital quien cancela sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Deisy is 58 years old. Even though her husband is retired from the police force and receiving a pension, he continues to perform general paperwork. They own a home and have one daughter who is a dependent.

While there is stiff competition in her line of business, she is not ready to hand over any of her customers. This loan is earmarked for the construction of her pastry shop. Deisy currently works out of her kitchen and does not have the space to develop her business. She is a good customer of Agrocapital and is responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of her pastry shop

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansour is 61 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Saida, southern Lebanon. Mansour has been working as a fisherman since 1970. He requested a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a fishing net and do some maintenance work on his boat. This is the first time that Mansour has requested a loan.

Mansour enjoys his work. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. He set up as a fisherman because he learnt the skill when he was young and therefore had lots of experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and do some maintenance work on his boat

loans.name: Alimardon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Алимардон  Мажидов проживает в городе Истаравшане. Для того чтобы содержать семью: жену Садокат, 3 детей, родителей и сестренку Дилнозу, он занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока. Дома Алимардон имеет 6 голов овец и 2 коровы. Два раза в день, утром и вечером жена Алимардона доит коров, и из части полученного молока готовит масло, творог, кефир, сливки. Вторую часть молока и молочных изделий  мать Алимардона каждое утро продает на рынке. 
Алимардон начинал свою деятельность животноводства 5 лет назад. Он купил двух овец и корову, откормил их и продал на рынке. Получив от проданного скота прибыль, он   снова купил молодых  ягнят и теленка, но количество его ягнят, уже составляло 4 голов.
И так, он уже делает 5 лет.
Алимардон планирует увеличить количество своего скота, путем их размножения, и поэтому подал заявку на получение кредита  для откорма своего домашнего скота.
texts.en:
Alimardon M. lives in the city of Istaravshan. In order to support his family: wife Sadokat, 3 children, parents and sister Dilnoza, he is involved in raising livestock and processing milk.
