Alimardon has 6 heads of sheep and 2 cows at home. Alimardon's wife milks the cows twice per day, in the mornings and evenings, and uses some of the milk to make butter, cottage cheese, kefir and heavy cream. Alimardon's mother sells unused part of the milk and dairy products at a market every morning.

Alimardon started his animal husbandry business 5 years ago. He bought two sheep and a cow, raised them and sold them at a market. Using the profits he received from the sale, he bought lambs and a calf, and his quantity of lambs now consisted of 4 heads. And he has been doing so for 5 years already. Alimardon plans to increase the quantity of his livestock by breeding it. This is why he put in a request for a loan to feed his domestic livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding livestock

loans.name: Rukiah

texts.en: Rukiah is widowed and has seven children. Four of her children are in primary school, two are in high school and one is about to go to college. She comes from a rural community which is highly dependent on sugar plantation. The main source of energy in this community is charcoal and firewood. After her husband passed away, she started selling charcoal and firewood in order to sustain her family. She has been in this business for the last six years and wants to borrow to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: Increase stock of Charcoal and Firewood

loans.name: Ransford

texts.en:
Ransford is 26 years old and a married father of two. One child is currently in school while his last born is still breastfeeding. Ransford works very hard to support his children and the wife. He is a supervisor for Millicom Ghana limited, a telecommunication network in Ghana, but he supervises the eastern region.

He owns a taxi cab and he is been using the taxi commercially for three months now. For his busy schedule he has employed a driver who uses the vehicle and makes accounts to him on a daily basis. He is requesting the loan to change the vehicle engine as he purchased the vehicle used. With the loan he believes he can invest into different areas and make more cash for the future of his children. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun V. is a farmer in Prey Chher Tel village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. In addition, she is a basket seller.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support their family’s living conditions. In order to improve the family conditions, Mrs. Oun V. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding.

Mrs. Oun V. is 36 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a worker, another three are enrolled in the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Tang Sophat, is a construction worker. He is also shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Mrs. Chean Tum Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chean T. is a group leader of six members who all live in ThU. village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile soil which it is a bad to affect to her crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Men Rorn, is a hard working man who has been hired by the other villager to work on the filed. Mrs. Chean T. is 30 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled I the local school and the others are just five and one years old. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding.

loans.name: Bol

texts.en: Bol H., 48, is a widow and has three children. She resides with her children in Sa Ang, Cambodia. To make a living, she is engaged in weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of US $2.66 per day in revenue. Cambodian traditional method of producing weaving products is difficult and consumes long time to manufacture best outputs. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently working in a local garment factory, earning an income of US $2 per day. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more silk and bean seeds to grow. H. hopes that her standard of living will be improved when her plan of investment to expand her business is successful.

loans.use: buy silk and bean seed

loans.name: Christie Ellen

texts.en:
Christie Ellen A. is a 26-year-old corn farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has four children. Her eldest child is only 8 years old. She likes being a farmer because she is able to eat fresh food coming from her farm. She said she needs additional capital for her business to buy farming necessities; that is why she has requested a loan of  10,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. 

She will use the loan to grow her harvest so that she could be able to buy the basic needs for their family. She said she likes CEVI services a lot because its program is helping a lot of people start a new business. She is delighted with CEVI's 2% interest rate because it is very low and affordable to repay.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: La señora Lilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Lideres II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 21 años y es madre de 01  hijo,  que aún dependen de ella.Se inicio en la venta de pescado fresco hace, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital de S/.300 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de  especies.Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprara pescado frescos en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Sra. Lilia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Lideres II” (Women Leaders II), which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 21 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of one dependent child.

Lilia started selling fresh fish with the intention of helping her family financially. She started with capital of 300 soles and invested that money well, so her business continues to this day but in greater quantities and with more variety. With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy fresh fish by the kilo that is produced in the region as well as raised off the coast of the country. The variety of fish she will obtain includes bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapia, toyo, and pejerey. The will enable her to maintain sufficient inventory for her business and satisfy the discerning tastes of her customers.

Lilia says she is excited to be part of a group of women who have helped her overcome difficulties. Now she is able to face challenges with tremendous strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Temitope

texts.en:
Temitope is a member of LAPO microfinance's Mokola branch. She owns a hairdressing business offering hairstyling services in a location which is very favorable for most of her customers. She has been in this business for about 11 years.

She is 35 years old, married with 3 children. She plans to expand her business by adding the sale of hair extensions and other hair cream. She is requesting the loan amount of N150,000. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her family. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Susi

texts.en:
Susi D. is 36 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband is a driver and her children go to school. Susi is currently in the business of selling tea and local Sudanese bread. She is requesting a loan in order to stock powdered milk and make tea to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a charcoal store.
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy powdered milk to stock and make tea to sell.

loans.name: Goncha

texts.en: Goncha N. lives in the Fuzuli region. She is 50 years old. She is the mother of three children. Goncha has been cooking "qutab" (a sort of pancake turnover stuffed with minced lamb, cheese or spinach) for three years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking "qutab"

loans.name: Telezia

texts.en: Telezia is 35 years old and is divorced. She has five children and her children go to school. Telezia S. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread and is requesting a loan to open a bakery. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Gladys Vanesa

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Vanesa G. es maestra de secundaria ella da clase en una comunidad llamada Isidrillo a 6 km del Esteli.
Primero realiza su plan de trabajo y loimparte en periodo de 5 horas diaria de Lunes ha Viernes
Gladys va usar el crédito para la compra de cama matrimonial. Ella quiere una cama nueva ya que la que tiene ya dio su vida útil.
Gladys es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar ambos menores de edad y convive con su hermana.
Este es  el sexto crédito con Ceprodel ha trabajado con 4 años con Ceprodel. Ella dice que los créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ha solventado algunas necesidades y ha comprado  electrodomésticos que necesita para su hogar.
texts.en:
Gladys Vanesa G. is a secondary school teacher in a community called Isidrillo, which is 6 kilometers from Esteli. She draws up her lesson plan and then imparts it during a 5-hour period from Monday until Friday. Gladys will use her loan to buy a double bed. She wants a new bed because the one she has has given all it had to give. Gladys is a single mother of two, school-age children; she lives with her sister. This is her 6th loan with Ceprodel over the four years she has collaborated with Ceprodel. She states that Ceprodel's loans have been much help to her because they have covered some expenses and have paid for some home appliances she needed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a double bed.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She owns a stall where she sells household items such as cooking pots. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. Helen is very determined to expand her business, and has a good relationship with Kiva partner, LAPO. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more household items to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more household items to sell

loans.name: María Gumercinda

texts.es: María Gumercinda D. C. D. C. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo el cual es empleado D. una empresa privada y junto a su suegra. María es una mujer muy trabajadora quien no se queda D. brazos cruzados ante la situación tan difícil que vive junto a su familia, es por esta razón que ella se encarga D. vender medicinas naturales, las cuales comercializa desD. hace 5 años atrás, por diferentes pueblos D. Oriente D. país, tales como La Unión y San Miguel. Cada día María se dispone a vender su producto D. forma ambulante, ofreciéndolos  a muy buenos precios. Así también es gracias a la confiabilidad que María ha brindado a las personas y sumándosele todos sus años D. experiencia, que  es porque posee muchos clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo a través D. cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar medicinas, esto debido a que en su mayoría, venD. su producto a crédito, y muchas ocasiones no cuenta con el dinero necesario para aumentar su inventario. Esto lo hace sobre todo con las intenciones D. poder ayudarle a su esposo con todos los gastos D. hogar, D. manera que puedan contar con una mejorar estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old and resides in Morazán Department. She lives with her husband who is an employee in a private enterprise, and with her mother-in-law. María is a very hard working woman who doesn't stand around with arms crossed when faced with the difficult situation she and her family endures. That's why she began selling natural medicines some 5 years ago in communities in the east, such as La Unión and San Miguel. Each day she sets out on foot to sell her products, offering very good prices. The confidence she stirs in people, plus her many years of experience, is why she has so many customers. She requests a loan in order to have the money necessary to buy the medicines, because in most cases, she sells her products on credit and often, she lacks the money necessary to augment her inventory. She does this primarily with the intention of helping her husband with the costs of the home, so that they can count on greater economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING NATURAL MEDICINES TO SELL

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 43-year-old married lady. She has been rearing poultry for commercial purposes for nine years. Her main income comes from the sale of eggs to hotels and to other customers in her residential area. She also rents out her houses so as to earn extra income.  

She previously had taken out a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business and she successfully repaid.  She hopes to stabilize her financial status in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy layers and growers feeds.  She says that she is focused, determined and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy layers, feed and growers

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sroeun P. is 51 years old and she lives in Kandal village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Hong Sim Koem, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice and vegetables to earn money for the family. In order to support the farming crops, Mrs. Sroeun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to water her crops. Mrs. Sroeun P. is the mother of a child who is a television and radio repairer in the local village. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water machine
